The left submaxillary gland and tonsil are very much swollen (fourth day); throat much worse (fifth day), [21].

After stool, severe stitching pain in the transverse colon, beginning in the splenic flexure and passing to the hepatic flexure, and there passing off slowly; much aggravated by walking, but relieved by sitting down (second day), [21].
Asthmatic, particularly during palpitation of heart, after mental exertions, [1].
Two mornings in succession, on awaking, the eyelids were tightly drawn together as if pressed on by lead, without agglutination, [1].
Sensation of many burning sparks in the eyelids, that are immediately drawn together, [1].
Visible but painless jerking in one buttock and corresponding thigh (after eight days), [1].
Icy-cold lower extremities, from forenoon until bedtime (after six days), [1].
Intermittent drawing pressure directly over the right buttock, [2].
Feeling of looseness of the teeth, in the evening, [1].
Transient vertigo to falling sideways, [1].
Congestion to the anus soon after dinner (after five and twelve days), [1].
Burning in the face and throat, without redness, [1].
Heat in the feet, at night, [1].
A very violent catarrh came on, which lasted an unusually long time, viz., one month (fourth day), [28b].

Nightly headache; an intolerable, constantly increasing pressure in the lower portion of the occiput and in the vertex, with pressure on the eyes, which he must close, and with chilliness, not relieved by any covering, with profuse offensive perspiration, during which he must walk up and down the room (after five days), [1].
Flow of water in the mouth coming from the stomach, disappearing after eating, [3].
Painful beating in the occiput, [1].
Red swelling on the forearm, with pain as from pressing on a suppurating boil, [1].
While combing his hair, in the morning, he observed a small, not red elevation, on the right parietal region, sensitive to the touch (thirteenth day), [39b].
Morning sweat for several mornings, with anxiety, [1].
Vertigo, worse soon after taking medicine (probably the effect of the alcohol), but lasting in a slight degree all day (second day); slight vertigo (immediately, ninth day), [22b].
One day, three sudden shoots down right thigh into toes, each time making him lift up the foot and shout, [19].
Dyspnœa, with mucus in the chest difficult to loosen, [1].
Bloody saliva, [1].
Collection of water in the mouth, at 9.30 A.M. (third day), [45].
Transient dull pain in the forearm (right side), (second day), [36].
Fearful attacks of toothache; all the top row feel as if being drawn, [58].
Headache and weariness, while walking in the afternoon, changing in the evening to toothache and sleepiness (after eighth day), [1].
Continued ulceration and itching of the prepuce, [1].
Even at night he must arise to urinate, and as often as he woke he had to urinate, with much thirst, even at night, [1].
Great weariness in bed, with early waking, yet cannot sleep again, [1].
Great uneasiness in the limbs, at night, [1].
Urine with much white sediment and fetid, [1].
In the morning, itching and smarting in both eyelids (fifth day), [36c].
He blows a piece of yellowish-green skin with blood at the edges from the nose (after four days), [1].
*Lachrymation and burning, in the morning, [3].
Painful heat in the head, frequently, with flushes of heat over the body, [1].
Drawing pain in the occiput, touching it causes pain, as if from subcutaneous ulceration, [1].
Leucorrhœa, as clear as water (after twenty-two days), [1].
Vertigo, when lying on the back, at night, [1].
Pressing pain in the malar and nasal bones, [1].
Two days before the menses shuddering again and again over the whole body the entire day, [1].
Restless in bed, in the evening, he wakes very early in the morning, [1].
Burning smarting of the lower lip, [3].
Severe pains over the eye, alternating from one to the other (second day), [28].
Milk causes much distress; it is vomited curdled, [1].
Movement in the brain on shaking the head, [1].
Twitching of the lower lid every day, [1].

Much purulent expectoration, with severe cough, with great oppression of the chest and rattling in throat; the slightest motion takes away her breath, and she becomes quite exhausted (after twenty-three days), [4].
Inclination to vomit, when washing the mouth, in the morning, [1].
Continuous chilliness, [1].
Protrusion of the rectum (after several hours), [1].
Headache and weakness much worse from walking in the open air, [1].
Leucorrhœa, with itching in the vagina (after three days), [1].

Every evening, about 7 P.M. (after sunset), heat commencing in head, where it is most felt, lasting till noon next day; hands and face continually hot, but worse in evening; hands feel hot to others; the heat is better in open air, for five days (three days after last dose), [16].
Pain near the head of the humerus, at the tendons of the pectoral muscles, bending the arm backwards and from touch, [1].
While seated at breakfast, felt a cutting pain in the hypogastric region, at the same time an imperative urging to stool (fifth day); I seldom have pains in bowels, [27].
Itching pimples on the chin, [1].
The skin of the palm of the hand peels off, [1].
Sourish nightsweat, five mornings (after seven days), [1].
Sour taste and eructations, lasting several days (fifth day), [26a].
Severe cough, in the evening, [1].

Slight soreness of the outer corner of the left upper eyelid; slight itching of the inner surface; at 5 P.M. (seventh day); increased soreness of the eyelid (eighth day); lid much swollen; eye half close; swelling beneath the lower lid; œdematous, looks as if stung by a bee; lid sore to touch and on closing the eye; slight itching of the inner surface, causing the eye to water (ninth day); eye somewhat better (twelfth day), [26].
Frightful dreams, as if she were falling from a high mountain, [1].
No appetite, all things seemed tasteless to her, [1].
Fulness in the chest and contraction, which interferes with her breathing, [1].
Frequent gurgling empty eructations, [2].
Perspired very freely, wetting my clothes around the waist (I perspire very freely at all times), (tenth day), [22].
Drawing tearing toothache, now in the right, and now in the left side, for hours, and often with intermission for half an hour or an hour; also at night on waking, [1].
Hæmorrhoids without constipation, [1].
Gloomy and dull feeling in the head, with whirling dizziness, for four days, [1].
Desire for coffee (third day), [18].
Headache in the morning, with nausea, until noon, [1].
Painful eructations, with rising of blood into the mouth (after rapid riding), (after four hours), [1].
During the menses it grows black before the eyes, with weakness; she must lie down, which relieves her, [1].
Glans hot, with pale red and at times itching eruption, [1].
Itching on the occiput, [1].
Pressure in the whole abdomen three successive days, increased after eating, accompanied by dulness of the head and tension of the skin of the forehead, [5].
Cold knees, at night, [1].
A slight headache, the pains running down the back of the head (third day), [22].

He must urinate two or three times in an hour; pressure on the bladder, yet he must wait a long time before the urine comes, which then passes without pain; if he endeavors to retain the urine, he is attacked with anxiety and pressure on the bladder (after forty-eight hours), [1].
At 5 P.M., fever, first thirst, and after drinking cold water, chilliness and inclination to lie down, then sleep and inclination to general slight sweat, [1].
Occasional drawing in the teeth and limbs, especially the right thigh, in the morning (seventeenth day), [44f].
The eyes seem blinded, in the morning, [1].
Frequent stitches pass under the hypochondria transversely through the epigastrium, so severe that she could cry out, [1].
Salt saliva, [1].
Stitches in the anus (after eight days), [1].
Violent burning in the bladder, without desire to urinate, [1].
A persistent burning in the external canthus of the right eye, and at the same time a sensation as if a grain of sand was in it (after third dose), [38a].
Stitches in the parotid gland, which swelled and produced a tensive pain when moving the head, [1].
Colic before the natural stool (after four days), [1].
Puffed face (after five, and forty days), [1].
A very painful fissure in the middle of the upper lip, which lasted several days (third day), [18].
Very sleepy during the day, and averse to everything, [1].
Weary pain in left shoulder-joint, [8].
Drawing between the scapulæ and in the upper part of the chest (after twenty-three days), [1].
Violent nosebleed (after twelve days), [1].
Tensive-stitching pain around the hypochondria, impeding every motion, worse when walking, [1].
Eruption in the corner of the mouth, with pain from touch, [1].
Paralytic sensation in the arm, then throbbing in it, [1].

The complaints disappear during violent exercise, such as walking in the open air, fencing, etc. (horseback riding excepted), and appear most frequently and severely when sitting quiet, forenoon and evening, [2].
Abdomen much puffed up after dinner, [1].
Severe dry cough, with stitches in the right chest, [1].
*Stitch in the head, [1].
Violent colic and faintness before the menses, [1].
Numb feeling in right tonsil (after four days), [1].
Flushes of heat, after slight exercise, [9].
Very cold feet, particularly in the evening, mainly in bed, and afterwards, when this passes off, very cold hands, [1].

In the morning, after getting up, great itching on the occiput and nape (ninety-sixth day); great itching on the occiput, compelling him to scratch, in the morning (two hundred and seventy-fourth day), [45b].
Dry feeling in the mouth and throat (first day), [20], [20a].
Very giddy at times, with dislike to all work, [1].
Roaring in the ear, after which she cannot hear with it, [1].
Nosebleed from time to time, for several days, [2].
Sour eructations after supper, [1].
Tingling sensation in the left side of the nose; a strong inclination to sneeze, but I can not (fourth day), [21].
Pain in the sacrum (ninth day), [44a].
Jerking in the lower lid, [1].
Headache all day; worse from 5 to 6 P.M. (fourth day), [38].
He is hungry, but as soon as he only sees food his appetite vanishes and he feels full in the abdomen; when he begins to eat, he is averse to it, [1].
Very feverish (fourth and following days), [21].
Fluent coryza and on blowing the nose, also bloody mucus, [1].
Accumulation of flatus in the abdomen, immediately after walking in the open air, [1].
Contracting pain in the rectum extending into the vagina (after six days), [1].

Continuous dry fever heat, with redness of the face, great thirst, painful swallowing, stitches in the left scapula, arresting the breathing, tearing in the upper and lower limbs (after thirteen days), [1].
Dull pain over the right eye and in the right temple (third day), [37].
High fever, with rash, [10].
He must rise at night and walk about for half an hour, [1].
Swelling at the orifice of the external auditory meatus; pressure near antitragus causes stitching pain, [1].
Occasional slight twinges of headache in the sides of the head (third day), [40a].

Very violent piercing, cramplike pain deep in the right orbit (probably in the muscles), which, as far as he could judge, seemed to extend through the bony wall of the orbit into the frontal sinus; it lasted a few minutes, and then alternated, with a similar pain in the left orbit (after half an hour, second day), [25f].
Biting of the eyes and lachrymation, every evening, [1].
The brownish stool, although scanty and not hard, is expelled with much straining, [2].
Stitch in the right mammary gland, the worst when getting cold while walking or riding, yet she could neither see nor feel anything wrong there, [1].
In the red part of the lower lip, on the left side, sensation like a fissure, though there was none (fifth day), [45a].
Stoppage of both nostrils, with frequent sneezing, [1].
Pain in the abdomen, as if the intestines had been beaten to pieces, [1].
Stiffness in the back part of the neck (after two days), [28].
Entire loss of appetite, but constant thirst, [1].
Slight drawing in the occiput (one hundred and ninety-fifth day), [45b].
Pain darting along the wrist and dorsum of right hand to between first and second fingers; soon a similar pain on corresponding part of the palm of the hand (thirty-second day), [38].
Frequent starting when falling asleep, [1].
Ravenous hunger, which obliges him to eat frequently; if he does not, he has headache and great lassitude, and is obliged to lie down (after ten days), [1].
Much cough, with expectoration, day and night; the cough wakes her at night, with sensation in the chest as if hollow, and smarting therein as if sore, [1].
Teeth very much on edge, for seven days, [1].

Heart's impulse and rapidity increased, especially during inspiration (after eight hours); have occasionally, in the past, noticed a slight irregularity of pulse; the irregularity of the heart has entirely disappeared (fourth day), [39a].
Woke with hands clasped, lying on right side; right hand felt numb, possibly from lying on it (eighth day), [15].
Violent pain in the middle of the head, caused by coughing and sneezing, [1].
Pressure and burning in the cheeks and cheek-bones, [1].
A lame sore feeling all day (third day), [22].

Dimness of vision of both eyes, with great sensitiveness to bright daylight (second day); great dimness of vision (on reading), as if the cornea had lost its transparency; at the same time feeling of dryness (as from fine sand) between the eyelids (after one hour, seventh day), [25a].
Frequent stitches under the right ribs, [1].
Gray and yellowish expectoration from cough, [1].
Slight sensitiveness in the right ear, judging by the feeling in the cavity of the tympanum (one hundred and thirty-second day), [45b].
Stitching-tensive pain in the hypochondria and pit of the stomach, during movement when stooping, [1].
Sensation of stiffness and coldness in the arms, as if they had no blood in them, without any perceptible coldness to the touch, [1].
Repeated stitches in a spot in front of left chest, in the afternoon (twelfth day), [15].
Burning in the urethra, [1].
Profuse secretion of thick, yellow, purulent nasal mucus, for several days, [3].
External warmth was unbearable to her during the violent headache, yet she was chilly, [1].
Tearing in the right knee as soon as she grows cold, no pain from touch, [1].
Stitches in the left ear (sixth day), [1].
After dinner, difficult hearing of left ear (first day), [20].
Dark redness and heat of the face, especially on walking in the open air, [1].
Disturbed sleep all night, from unpleasant dreams (third night), [42].
On taking gentle exercise, transient rush of blood to the head, with burning and creeping in the skin of the face (first day), [39b].
Yellow expectoration, tasting like rotten eggs, [1].
Aching in tibia (thirtieth day); in lower part of both tibiæ, 12 to 1 P.M. (thirty-first day), [38].
Contractive feeling in the anus, passing off after fermentation in the bowels, [2].

Average quantity of urine, 6 ounces five times in twenty-four hours; normal color; no sediment; sp. gr. 1020 (forty-first day before the proving); 1030 (fortieth, thirty-ninth, and thirty-eighth days); A.M., 1022; P.M., 1028 (thirty-seventh day); A.M., 1020; P.M., 1030 (thirty-sixth day); A.M., 1022; P.M., 1020 (thirty-fifth day); P.M., 1030 (thirty-fourth, thirty-third, and thirty-second days); P.M., 1028 (thirty-first day); A.M., 1022; P.M., 1029 (thirtieth day before the proving); sp. gr. 1030; dark red, less quantity, passed only three times (third day); A.M., sp. gr. 1030; P.M., 1030; three times, 6 ounces each times; a yellowish-red deposit adheres to vessel; urine brick-red in color (fourth day); A.M. and P.M., sp. gr. 1030; very scanty, deep red; no desire to urinate; pass but little at a time (fifth day); A.M., sp. gr. 1030; P.M., 1025; as on fifth day (sixth day); P.M., sp. gr. 1025; very scanty; red deposit on side of glass (seventh day); A.M., sp. gr. 1022; noon, 1030; urine very high-colored; it looks like powdered brick (eighth day); the urine remains dark red until the twenty-third day, [37].
Pimple near the nose resembling a blood blister, [1].
Weak feeling in the rectum in the evening in bed, causing restlessness, so that he cannot sleep, [1].
Sensation of fog in his head and dizziness, which makes him sad; ideas indefinite, with irresolution, [1].
Menses three days too late (after nineteen days), [1].
She becomes much heated from a little walk, [1].
Loud snoring during inspiration, [1].
Coated tongue, [1].
Great falling out of the hair (after one and eight days), [1].
Frequent micturition (after four days), [1].
Pain in the region of the navel, very acute when coughing and stooping, [1].
Constant sweetish taste in the mouth, as from fasting, with frequent hawking up of mucus, [1].
Slumbering (almost immediately), with sweat of the face, [1].
Throbbing drawing toothache, [1].
A strange tickling sensation in lower part of chest, [8].
Profuse perspiration on walking, especially in the bends of the joints (twenty-third day), [20].
Cannot bear reflected light from bright objects (twenty-third day); annoyed by reflections from bright objects (twenty-sixth day), [20].
Immediately after a meal feeling of soreness in throat, like a cramp at the inner side of the cervical vertebræ, [1].
Frequent jerking of the left lower eyelid, with sensation as if the tears would flow, which necessitates frequent wiping, [1].
Vertigo, obliging to steady one's self after a meal, [1].
In the evening troublesome feeling of heat in the eyes (thirty-second day), [18a].
Drawing pain in the leg down to the heel, where it was a stinging pain, [1].
Tension of the abdomen, in the morning (after two days), [1].
Spasmodic jerkings in the muscles of the thigh, when walking, [1].
Movements of the scalp from the nape of the neck over the vertex to the forehead, [1].
Burning in the mouth, in the morning, without thirst, [1].

9 A.M., 9 ounces of urine, sp. gr. 1028; 2 P.M., 9 ounces, sp. gr. 1022; 7 P.M., 10 ounces, sp. gr. 1024; midnight, 10 ounces, sp. gr. 1024; total, 38 ounces (first day); 9 A.M., 8 ounces, sp. gr. 1027; 2 P.M., 6 ounces, sp. gr. 1027; 7 P.M., 7 ounces, sp. gr. 1028; midnight, 8 ounces, sp. gr. 1028; total, 29 ounces (second day); 9 A.M., 9 ounces, sp. gr. 1028; 2 P.M., 7 ounces, sp. gr. 1026; 7 P.M., 7 ounces, sp. gr. 1032; midnight 4 ounces, sp. gr. 1025; total, 27 ounces (third day); 9 A.M., 9 ounces, sp. gr. 1025; 2 P.M., 6 ounces, sp. gr. 1027; 7 P.M., 7 ounces, sp. gr. 1027; midnight, 8 ounces, sp. gr. 1031; total, 30 ounces (fourth day); 9 A.M., 8 ounces, sp. gr. 1028; 2 P.M., 7 ounces; 7 P.M., 7 ounces, sp. gr. 1026; midnight, 7 ounces, sp. gr. 1032; total, 29 ounces (fifth day); 9 A.M., 8 1/2 ounces, sp. gr. 1026; 2 P.M., 7 ounces; 7 P.M., 9 ounces, sp. gr. 1021; midnight, 11 ounces, sp. gr. 1022; total, 36 1/2 ounces (sixth day); 9 A.M., 13 ounces, sp. gr. 1024; 2 P.M., 7 ounces; 7 P.M., 10 ounces, sp. gr. 1024; midnight, 4 ounces, sp. gr. 1032; total, 34 ounces (seventh day), [36].
Pressure mostly in the forehead and eyes, finally nausea, with spitting of much saliva, [1].
The scalp pains when touched, as if the roots of the hair were sore (after three days), [1].
Sour eructations (ninth day), [38].
A small painful spot, covered with papulæ, on the right temple (two hundred and seventy-fifth day), [45b].
Severe vertigo, at 9 A.M. (sixth day), [42a],
*Sticking headache in the temples, [1].
After blowing the nose, discharge of yellow water from the nose, with cutting headache in the forehead, [1].
He gets very hot in the face, immediately, from talking, [1].
In the afternoon, while walking, itching tearing in the left temporal bone, which came on by fits some five or six times, and was so violent that it made him stand still (first day), [39].
Swollen inflamed nose, nostrils sore and ulcerated, [1].
Stomachache in the morning in bed, [1].
Putrid after taste from beer, [1].
Pressing sore pain in the shoulders, as if excoriated, [1].
Severe pain in uterus and left ovary (seventh day); pains in uterus very severe; pains pass down into the vagina (eighth day), [21].
She is either too cold, or becomes hot, which immediately results in sweat, [1].
Sweat of the feet, [1].
Tearing over the eyes, [1].
Frequent cutting through all the teeth of the right row from a draft of cold air, [1].
Feeling as if the head were stuffed, as the pain in the eye ceased, in the evening (third day), [35].
The eyes feel heavy and the lids are inclined to close, [8].
Tickling scraping kind of cough, and again a loose phlegmy kind of cough, [9].
Pressive headache in the occiput, in the evening till midnight, [1].
Cutting in the toes as with a knife, at night, mostly when lying on the back, with redness of the tips of the toes; by morning the pain has all gone (after forty-one days), [1].
Obscuration of the head, frequently in the morning, when rising from bed, [1].
Pressive headache in the house, with tightness of the scalp, relieved by uncovering the head, [1].
As if surfeited, with nausea and feeling of debility, [2].
In the evening, frequent sudden tearing in the left cheek, in the right nape muscles, and in the right tibia (twenty-second day), [28c].
Seems to be averse to smoking tobacco (secondary effect?), [1].
Fatigue and powerlessness in both arms, on awaking, [8].
Griping cutting in the bowels, with groaning anxiety, as if an involuntary stool would pass, [1].
Pains in various parts of the body (second day), [28].
Profuse sweat, in drops, especially in the bend of the elbow and knee, in right side, at 4 A.M. (twenty-seventh day), [20].
Before the stool the beginning of a flatulent colic, accompanied with groaning and sobbing, [1].
Itching in the whole face, [1].
Itching on the occiput, in the morning (tenth day), [45c].
Slight drawing behind the left ear (two hundred and sixty-third day); severe drawing (two hundred and sixty-fourth day), [45b].
The hands go to sleep frequently, at night (sixth night), [1].
*Some blows through the whole head, [1].
Drawing in the hollow tooth extending to the ear, aggravated by cold water, [1].
Violent fluent coryza (twenty-fourth day); severe fluent coryza, in the morning (twenty-ninth day); fluent coryza, towards noon (fortieth day); fluent coryza (forty-eighth day), [29].
Putrid sourish offensive stool, [1].
Violent stitches in the pudendum, extending almost up to the navel, [1].
Flexion of the index finger since morning; he could not straighten it, [1].
In the morning on awaking, dryness of the tongue and palate (third day), [29a].
Cramping drawing in the right shoulder and in the whole right side, [1].
Painful thrust in the head when coughing, [1].

During the day, increased frequency of micturition (first day); fulness in the bladder, urging continually to micturition (fifth day); micturition almost every hour during the day (ninth day); micturition more frequent than yesterday, not painful, but with a constant uneasiness, as of great fulness in the bladder (twenty-first day); nearly every hour in the afternoon (twenty-second day); increased frequency of micturition (twenty-ninth day). Urine during the proving, amber-colored; slightly turbid; sp. gr. 1030; strongly acid; bile pigment; marked proof of bile acid, in large quantity. Normal urine; amber-colored; slightly turbid; sp. gr. 1028; no sugar; no albumen; no bile pigment; slight trace of bile acid, [20].
The left lower extremity is jerked upward, in the forenoon, while sitting (after four days), [1].
Jerking in the left lower lid almost constantly, [1].
Tensive pain in the calf (after fourteen days), [1].
*Headache in the vertex as from pressure on the top of the brain (ninth day), [1].
Itching pimples on the scalp (first fourteen days), [1].
Dizziness, like a tingling and buzzing out at the forehead, if she walks rapidly, or moves the head suddenly, [1].
Vanishing of sight, [1].
Eruption on pubes increased (fourth day).
Nausea before each liquid stool (after five days), [1].
Jerking in the lower jaw on falling asleep, [1].
Coldness in a church, so that he could scarcely get warm, [7a].
Frequent eructations, [7a].

On waking from a lewd dream, found my abdomen covered with semen; it was the first time for a long while that I had had an emission (third night); had a seminal emission, unconscious of it until I waked; no dream; did not wake until morning (sixth night), [27]
Stitches in the forehead as if in the bone, [1].
Herpetic eruption on the lips, [1].
He awakes in the morning, at 3 o'clock, and cannot fall asleep again, [1].
Severe stitches in the left ear and left cheek, [1].
During eructation stitch in the pit of the stomach, in the left side and between the scapulæ, [1].
Stitching pain in the right abdominal muscles, with visible twitches, [1].

Cough frequently dry, whooping, and choking, with pain in the pit of the stomach, and scraping, raw, sore pain in the larynx, which is not felt when swallowing saliva; the cough does not awake her from sleep, but after awaking it becomes very severe and continuous; at times there is a rattling in the trachea, resulting in mucous expectoration, [1].
Long-continued erections, at night (after sixteen hours), [1].
Soreness and burning pain between the nates, [1].
Pain in the hæmorrhoids after a natural stool (after four days), [1].
During a week, spasms as from nervous weakness, lasting a day at a time, pulse somewhat weak, then again spasmodic, [1].
Itching blisters and blotches on the face, hands, and feet, [1].
Dull aching pain in chest, right side, near sternum, fourth and fifth ribs, 12 to 1 P.M.; pains in chest return (thirty-second day), [38].
Sight dim, and an appearance as of a mist before the eye (third day), [35].

The skin of the head is again covered with many white scales, difficult to get away (one hundred and eighty-ninth day); on combing the hair, a quantity of scales fall from the head (one hundred and ninety-third day); many scales on the head (two hundred and thirty-second day); a large number of scales on the head, especially the vertex (two hundred and fifty-third day); accumulation of scales on the scalp (two hundred and sixty-ninth day), [45b].
Nose dry; every symptom of cold in the head (after five hours and a half); stuffed nose (after second dose), [33].
Toothache, which becomes accompanied by swelling of the cheek, [1].
Cold air is disagreeable to him, [1].
Headache, especially in the forenoon, as if the head were drawn forward and downward, [1].
Dull pain in upper lobe of left lung (second day), [38].
Stiffness in the back, which passes off when walking, [1].
10 P.M., a chilly sensation in back and right shoulder, running downwards; chilliness in the back, if lying on either side, removed by lying on the back (twenty-first day), [20].
Pressure on the upper part of the sternum, like a weight, [1].

At 6 P.M., suffering with a pain or great weakness in the small of my back (fourth day); pain not so severe (sixth day); back still aches and causes nausea, and a faint feeling while standing (seventh day); back still uncomfortable (eighth day), [37]. [The prover explains the backache:
Jerking in the left lower extremity, [1].
Right shoulder lame and stiff (twentieth day), [20].
Glandular swelling on the lower jaw, [1].
Very weak and short-breathed, as in continued fever, [1].
Burning in the right eye for a short time, which recurs at short intervals (seventeenth day), [34].
Menses two days too early, [1].
Pain in the right side of the abdomen, [1].
Violent bellyache, so that she must bend herself double, [1].
Ringing in the ears recurring several times during the day (fourth day); occasional attack (sixth to tenth day), [39b].
Severe painful jerking in the forehead, [1].
The menses, which were usually accompanied by cold and aching pains in lower bowels, came on without the least distress), [9].
Itching in the axillæ, [1].
Pressure on the bladder, with burning after micturition, in the evening, [1].
In the morning when waking, weak feeling, as from nausea, [2].
Severe pressure in forehead over right eye, [11].
*Heaviness of the head while sitting, lying, moving, and stooping, [1].

Very difficult movement of soft small stool, insufficient, with constant urging and inability (fifth day); soft, small, insufficient, with great straining, followed by great heaviness in abdomen, and pain in pelvis and thighs from the straining (sixth day); small, very difficult, very insufficient stool, with great urging and straining (seventh day); urging to stool, with pressure and straining, but no evacuation (eighth day); urging to stool, with flatus, but no stool, in the morning and at 10 A.M.; very slight stool; constant and severe urging, at 9 P.M. (ninth day); small, soft, insufficient stool; less urging (tenth day); no stool nor desire (eleventh day); stool free, with little straining (twelfth day), [44a].
When awaking, in the morning, overheated, [1].

Sticklike tearing in long irregular intervals, at one time through various parts of the head, at another, pain through the bones of the cheeks, in the region of the lower jaw, and other parts of the face, [1].
A few sharp shooting pains in the vaginal orifice (nineteenth and twenty-third days), [20].
Tearing in the left frontal eminence (after eleven hours and a half), [2].
In the morning, after waking, also at intervals, feverish shivering, with short breath, as from internal heat, which, however, did not exist, [1].
Painful tickling under the right thumb nail, [2].
Tearing, now above, and again below the right calf (after fourteen hours), [2].
Whirling vertigo, in the evening after lying in bed a quarter of an hour, as if he would fall into a faint, everything whirled around in the head, two evenings in succession, [1].
Face red during the heat, [16].
In the afternoon, tearing and aching pain in the frontal region, which sometimes extended into the temporal region, and lasted an hour (first day), [39b].
Roaring and pulsative blowing in the right ear, at night, [3].
Constant sweating and frequent itching in the left external auditory meatus (first day), [25e].
A little acrid fluid comes from the nose (fifth day); increased discharge of thin fluid, about noon (eighth day); profuse discharge of fluid from the nose, in the evening (eighteenth day), [45].
Pain in the rectum during stool, and afterwards for a long time while sitting (after seven days), [1].
Anxious heat, from 4 to 5 A.M., and from 5 to 6 P.M., [1].
Urging to stool in the evening (unusual); stool insufficient and difficult to pass (fourth day); small soft stool in the morning (fifth day); hard difficult stool at night (seventh day), [36].
The urine when standing becomes turbid and offensive, with white sediment (first to fourth day), [1].
Pressing pain on the lower left ribs, even from touch, [2].
Swelling of inguinal glands in left thigh, painful on walking, [10].
Much itching on the head, especially in the afternoon (twelfth day), [20].

Urine clear, amber-colored, acid, free from sediment, film, or cloud, passed about every six or eight hours; average daily quantity (winter) about 45 ounces; sp. gr., A.M., 1029; P.M. (5 P.M.) 122 (before the proving); passed 48 ounces, sp. gr. in morning, as usual, 1029 (before taking any Sepia); at 5.45 P.M., it was 1022 (first day); 9 A.M., sp. gr. 1029; clear as usual; 9.30 P.M., sp. gr. 1029; quantity, 42 ounces in twenty-four hours (second day); 8 A.M., sp. gr. 1032; 6 P.M., 1030; amount, 45 ounces; this urine deposited after a few hours, a white filmy sediment on the sides of the glass, and on the rod left in it, not removable by water alone, nor by acetic acid; removable by caustic potassa, by ammonia, or by nitric acid; not otherwise examined (third day); urine smells badly, looks turbid; 8 A.M., sp. gr. 1031 (fourth day), [40].
Painful turning and crawling in the temples, [1].
Burning in the face, recurring several times during the day (fourth day); occasional attacks (sixth to tenth day), [39b].
Painful eruption on the tip of the nose, [1].
Dry, scaly, rough upper lip and margins of the nose, with burning, [3].
Cramp in the thigh, when walking, [1].
Inactive bowels (fifth and sixth days), [44].
Feeling of dryness in the trachea (after three days), [1].
Vibratory contraction in the top of the head, in the evening, [1].
Beaten bruised feeling of the lower limbs; every nerve therein was painful; also painful when touched; pain removed by dancing, [1].
Feeling of sand in right eye (first and second days), [74].
Rheumatic drawing in the testicles, also along side in the thigh, [2].
At night, a grumbling in the molar teeth, [1].
Severe cutting in right eye (first day), [17b].
Falls asleep late (after a few hours), [2].
Sore pain on the right side of the lower lip near the corner of the mouth, [2].

Pain in sacrum, extending through hips and thighs to below the knee, with weakness and lassitude when moving, especially going upstairs, as if limbs would refuse to act before reaching the top (twelfth day), [44a].
At 2 P.M., I have a very severe headache, which runs from my right temple to my left, and extends into my eyes and nose (third day), [37].
Itching on the chest (after four days), [1].
Pinching jerks in the head, in the morning when rising, [1].
Pressure on the chest, from stooping and deep breathing, [1].
Restless sleep, with vexatious dreams; he calls loudly, stamps with the feet, raises his arms, which he then slowly lays down again, [1].
Cough, with coryza, every morning until nine o'clock; he sneezes already early, while in bed, [1].
Stitches in the sides of the abdomen, for one hour, followed by difficult breathing, [1].
Foul taste in the mouth, in the morning, [1].
Heaviness (after twenty-four hours), [1].
Headache above the eyes and nausea after eating, followed by heaviness of the head, [1].
Asleep sensation in the outer ear, for eight days, [1].
*Dulness of the head, on waking at night, [1].

In the afternoon, dryness of the nose (eighth day); dryness of nose (ninth day); dryness of nose (eighteenth day); dry feeling and aching in the nose (forty-third day); dryness of the nose (forty-seventh and forty-eighth days); tiresome dryness of the nose, in the morning (forty-ninth day); dryness of the nose (fifty-fifth and sixty-fifth days); dryness of the nose, in the morning (seventy-third day); dry feeling in the nose, at noon (one hundred and fourth day); sensitiveness and dryness of the mucous membrane of the nose (one hundred and fourteenth day); tiresome dryness of the nose (one hundred and thirtieth day); dry feeling and aching in the nose, especially its root, in the forenoon (one hundred and fifty-first day); dryness and aching in the nose severe (two hundred and seventieth day); dryness of the nose (two hundred and seventy-first and two hundred and seventy-second days), [45b].
While eating, pulsations in pit of stomach, the more he eats the worse it becomes, [1].
Tenesmus in the rectum, with dull pain in the lumbar region (after fourteen hours, second day), [21].
Tearing in the left temple to the upper part of the left side of the head, [2].
No appetite for supper (third day); little appetite for breakfast; loathed his dinner (fourth day); more appetite, at noon (sixth day), [45c].
Sensation of heat in throat, [1].
Painful swelling of the gums, [1].
Uneasiness in the abdomen, [1].
Slight drawing in the occiput and nape (one hundred and eleventh day), [45b].
Blisters in the mouth, with burning pain, [1].
Always slight sweat before going to sleep, in the evening, [1].
The posterior muscles of the thigh are very painful when sitting, [1].
Tearing in the tibia during the menses, [1].
Sore pain in the ear, [1].
Frequent cramp in the internal border of soles of feet, [1].
In the evening, sudden, very painful tearing in the left upper eyelid (twenty-third day), [22a].
Had a lewd dream (third night), [27].
Tongue coated white, [1], [29].
Itching on the outer side of the sole of left foot, [2].
After rising in the morning, had an attack of nosebleed (fourth day), [37].
Disagreeable metallic taste (tenth, eleventh, and twelfth days), [26].
Salt mucus sticks to the tongue, every morning, [1].
Pressure in the liver generally when taking a walk, [1].
While sitting quietly, a severe tearing pain in the left shoulder-joint, lasting but a few minutes, but there remained for a day or two a feeling as if the shoulder were wrenched (sixth day), [27].
Sick all day in my room (second, third, and ninth days), [20].
Stitching pain in both sides of lower abdomen, [1].
Stiffness in the lower extremities, extending up to the hip-joint, [1].
Pulling and drawing in the top of the shoulder, when at rest, [1].
Pressure to pass water with the pain in ovaries (eighth and twelfth days), [22].
Tearing pressure around the pit of the stomach, [2].
Violent stitches in the rectum at night, [1].
Pressure in the right eye, as from a grain of sand, aggravated by rubbing; felt most sensitively when pressing the eyelids together, [2].
The feet become swollen from much walking, [1].
Frequent drawing pain in the forehead, [2].
*Aching in the frontal bone (first, second, and third days), [29b].
Slight adhesion of the lids, in the morning (ninth, thirty-second, and one hundred and seventh days), [45a].
Tearing and jerks in the teeth, in the afternoon, at every fourth inspiration; worse when lying down, accompanied with profuse ptyalism, [1].

Feeling as if the bladder were full and its contents would fall out over the pubis, with constant desire to press them back; this feeling of distension of the bladder is quite different from the pressure downwards, as if everything would be pressed through the vulva (eighteenth day), [20].
Intense headache, with sensation that his head and ears were suffered, [51].
Cutting-stinging pain in the gall-bladder (after half an hour), [7a].
Pain in the ear, as if ulcerated, on swallowing, [1].

Violent stitches outwards over the left orbit, with complete drawing together of the eye, for three successive days, after arising in the morning, continuing until noon, somewhat relieved in the open air, [5].
Feeling of weight in the chest, as from outward pressure (after three hours and a half, second day), [42].
Itching on the eyes, [1].
Pulse 120, with rash, [10].

Attack of nausea, in the forenoon, after taking a walk, black before the eyes, had no appetite; heat before dinner, with pain in all the limbs; the nausea continued, he had headache, and in company, weakness, even to fainting; every trifle affected him and he was easily startled, [1].
It feels dull and heavy over the eyes and in the forehead (fifth day), [37].
Many black pores in the face, [1].
Irresistible desire for sugar, [1].
Slight drawing in the lower incisors (two hundred and forty-third day), [45b].
Headache, at night, as if the skull would be torn open, [1].

Attack of nausea, in the morning, when taking a walk, everything grew black before the eyes, he felt feverish from 1 to 6 P.M., with tearing in the limbs, accompanied with constant nausea; in the evening weakness, even to fainting, with melancholy; everything affected the nervous system, he was very easily startled; at night discharge of great quantity of very fetid flatus (after four days), [1].
Dreams full of dispute, [1].
The hollow of each concha, and each external meatus were unusually moist from a viscid fluid wax (second day), [25b].
A peculiar roaring in the ears, [1], [7d].
Sleeplessness at night, with fancies during slumber, [1].
Painfulness of the whole back, when sitting bent over while writing, [5].
Lascivious dreams disturb the sleep (fourteenth night), [1].
A full feeling in the head, [28a].
The left nostril is frequently too dry, feels swollen, yet without coryza, [1].
Pressure in the head every other morning at 8 or 9 o'clock, and so alternately till going to sleep, [1].
Burning in the mouth, with thirst, at night, [1].
Distension of the abdomen (after first hours), [1].
Stitching-pressive headache continuous in the lower part of the forehead, just over the eye, worse from motion in the house, much better when walking in the open air, [1].
Accumulation of much mucus in the mouth, after midnight, with tickling, obliging frequent hawking, [3].

In the morning, taste clammy (fourteenth day); clammy taste (seventeenth day); awoke with clammy taste in the mouth (twenty-sixth day); clammy taste, morning, noon, and evening (twenty-seventh day); clammy taste, in the morning (forty-eighth day), [29].
Much itching of the scalp (after sixteen days), [1].
Tensive pain on the right side of the back, under the scapula, particularly when lying on the left side, [1].
Jerking in the lids, [1].
Pressive pain, as if on something sore, in left side of occiput, [1].
Epistaxis, and in one case, a man of 60, nose bled every day, after the third day of taking the medicine, something which had not occurred since childhood, [76].
Drawing pain in the right and left lower back molars, [2].
Pressure on the spinal column, above the small of back, with rheumatic drawing in the neck, [2].
Tearing pressure in the upper part of the left chest, near the shoulder-joint, relieved by eructation, but soon returned violently, [2].
The swelling of the legs up to the knees increases during sitting or standing, passes off when walking, [1].
Great sensitiveness of the tips of the left upper teeth, worse from cold water, with shooting pains, even in the morning, [3].
Sticking headache (after eighteen days), [1].
Restless all night, tossing and turning (seventeenth night), [20].
*Vertigo, to falling forward, on suddenly rising from a seat, [1].
Pain in the small of the back (after five, and sixteen days), [1].
Heaviness of the eyes, [1].
Great protrusion of hæmorrhoids during stool, [1].
An incisor tooth seemed elongated, [1].
Menses seven days too early (after three days), [1].
Bitter taste, soon after eating, [1].
Drawing pressure in the region of the liver, in the evening, [2].
In the forenoon, itching and burning in both eyes, followed by great watering of the eyes (third day), [39].
Very weak in the morning, with uneasiness in the abdomen, [1].
Itching on the eyelids, [1].
Scraping cough; it seems as if it had settled on the chest, [1].
Bruised pain in the thighs, when touching them, with tension therein when walking, [1].
After emission, burning in the forepart of the urethra, [1].
Burning in the eyes, [1].
The arm goes to sleep when resting the head on it, [1].
Rending pressure over the right hip from before backwards, [2].
Cracking or feeling, as of the bursting of a bubble in the upper part of the nose, [1].
A swelling in the eyes, burning, and a flow of tears, which affords relief (second day), [28].
I notice that my lips are cracking; they feel very dry (fifth day), [37].
Lachrymation, morning and evening (after twelve days), [1].
Headache, as if the eyes would fall out, [1].
*Along with the febrile heat there occurred a disagreeable aching pain in the forehead, and great restlessness, which went off when sweat broke out (thirty-eighth day), [32].
She must arise frequently at night to urinate, [1].
Sweat of the lower limbs during the day, so profuse that it penetrates two thickness of clothing, [4].
A very painful pustule in the middle of the lower lip, [1].
Sensation of contraction of the chest, in the morning (after seven days), [1].
In the evening, immediately after taking the medicine, flow of water into the mouth (twenty-second day), [34].
Dry short evening cough, with intermittent stitches in the right hypochondrium for several hours, [1].
Inclination to sleep, particularly in the forenoon; she must sleep for an hour, [1].
At 9 A.M., felt suddenly sick, with distress in the pelvis, which increased during the forenoon (second day), [20].
Headache on waking; better after moving about (third, fourth, and fifth days), [24].
Dulness of the head, as from violent coryza, with reeling, [1].
Dull aching pain over the whole head, lasting nearly three hours, and then gradually going off (after half an hour, ninth day); less troublesome (tenth day), [22a].
Roaring and singing in the left ear much diminished), (sixth day), [40].
Stoppage of the right nostril (thirteenth day), [21].
Severe distension of the abdomen, particularly in the evening, [1].
In the evening, severe cold in the head with headache (twentieth and twenty-first days), [34].
After lying down, slight drawing in the right ear (twelfth day), [28c].
Much eye-gum on the ciliæ, in the morning, after waking (ninth day), [44d].
Biting in the eyes, as from Ammonia, [1].
Dryness of the larynx, in the morning, [1].
Itching in various parts of the body, relieved by scratching, after which there is a pinkish color (after two days), [28].
Nightly emissions, with sexual dreams (after twelve hours), [1].
Bitter spoilt taste in the mouth, every morning, [1].
Continuous moisture, day and night, [1].
Emissions frequently seem coming on, yet suppressed every time by his waking up (after twenty-hours), [1].
Many dreams at night, and loud talking during sleep, [1].
Sweat on the feet, [7a].
Dull frontal headache, at 3 P.M. (second day), [35].
Singing before the ears, [1].
Headache externally on the left side, painful to touch, as if suppurating, [1].
Grumbling and moving about of flatus in the abdomen, in the evening, [1].
Painful stiffness, apparently in the region of the uterus, [1].
No stool since taking Sepia (third day); constipated (fourth day); constipation with urging to stool; no stool for three days (sixth day), [37].
Much purulent eruption on the outer ear, [1].
Pressure in the eyelids, in the evening, [1].
Dryness in the mouth and throat, in the morning on awaking, she could not utter a sound nor speak (after six days), [1].
The commissures of the mouth, especially the left one, smarted as if raw (fourth day), [44c].
In the morning, seized with profuse nosebleed; had four attacks during the day, a bright-red flow suddenly appearing, and disappearing as suddenly (third day), [25].
Tearing in the head, over the forehead, and in the eyes, from 2 P.M., until evening when going to sleep, [1].
At 7.15 P.M., several shoots in the second last healthy molar tooth on the right side (second day), [38d].
Heaviness in the stomach, with dull pain about the abdomen, [1].
Great ringing in the ears for five minutes, in the morning in bed, [1].

Fever, with pressing first in the temples, at intervals of several minutes; short breath, as from internal heat, the whole night through; following this in the morning, weak in the lower limbs, thirst, want of appetite, sleepiness; during the day feverish shivering, pain in the throat, and swelling of submaxillary glands, [1].

After a glass of beer, feeling of dryness in left nostril, and sensitiveness of the mucous membrane on inspiring the air of the room; the latter sensation went off almost entirely in the open air (nineteenth day), [22a].
Stitching in the anus as from a stick, [29].
Tension in the tendons over the knee, when going upstairs, [1].
Sourish taste in the mouth till after breakfast, [1].
Doughy taste in the mouth, [1].
Crawling in the feet, when standing, [1].
Swelling and pain in the eyelids, with lachrymation, [1].
Grumbling in the abdomen, with eructations (after two days), [1].
The breath has a bad odor, when coughing, [1].
Cough, with stitches in both sides of abdomen, upper part, [1].
Uneasy sensation in stomach, cannot describe sensation, at 7 A.M. (twenty-eighth day), [21].
Sweat every other night, [1].
Scraping sensation in the anus during stool, [1].
Shortness of breath when walking, [1].
Intermission of beats of the heart, mostly after a meal, [1].
For some days past there has been a humid eruption on the top of the head, like tinea capitis, small grainlike pustules filled with pus, and drying up into honeylike scabs (thirty-second day), [18a].
Foul filthy taste of different kinds, [13].
Digging sensation in the upper teeth, [1].
Much pain when walking, on account of excoriation from the leucorrhœa, [1].
Stitches in and above the forehead, [1].
Tickling in the ear, [1].
Stitches in the left chest, when coughing (after six days), [1].
Drawing pain in lower part of the forearm, [2].
Contraction and oppression of the chest, with stitches therein on deep breathing, [1].
Head tired and full, with a feeling as if I were just on the point of falling asleep; head symptoms aggravated after sleep (ninth day), [20].
Coryza, for several weeks (after seven days), [1].
Tearing in the left scapula, after slight exposure, [1].
Ulcerated nostrils, which had troubled me for some weeks, were much relieved), (second day), [24].
Nosebleed two afternoons in succession, at 3 oclock, followed by pain in the nose on touch, [1].
Symptoms distinct and more severe on the left side (eighth day), [38].
Drawing-tensive pains in the right side of the lower jaw (seventeenth day), [29].
Bloated feeling in the lower part of the bowels, with dull aching in the ovaries, and a return of the heavy feeling in the head, with sleepiness (fourth day), [22].
Pain in the feet when walking in the open air, as if the tendon at the ankle was sprained, [1].
Vertigo, on waking at night, [1].
Pressing pain in forehead (fifteenth day), [34a].
Whizzing and beating in the ears, [1].
Faintness in the morning when rising from bed, as if he would sink, with loss of thought; then chilliness with gooseflesh and yawning for one hour, tongue very pale, pulse weak and slow, [1].
Taste altered, insipid (third day), [37].
On the inside of the nose, especially on the alæ nasi, great itching and feeling as if the nose were swelled (twelfth day), [29a].
Dryness of the tongue (second day); (in half an hour, third day), [25g].

Heaviness and confusion of the sinciput (after twenty minutes, twelfth day); heaviness, confusion, and dulness of the sinciput, morning, noon, and evening (twenty-seventh day); frequent awaking, with feeling of weight and dulness in the sinciput (thirtieth night); dulness and confusion of the sinciput (nine one hour, fiftieth and fifty-first days), [29].
Great lachrymation and coryza, [56].
He sleeps at night only from 10 to 4 o'clock, [1].

During the whole time of the proving I had little appetite; I ate more from habit than necessity; sometimes, in fact, I had a positive dislike to food, especially to supper, so that I ate nothing, [44d].
Heaviness of the legs, as far as the knees, as if they would fall asleep, [1].

Violent toothache in a right upper back tooth after eating; the pain extending thence to the forehead and head, also to the cheeks and into both rows of teeth on the right side, disappearing after going to bed in the evening, [7a].

Feeling as if she had taken cold, with soreness and burning in the nostrils and aching in the alæ nasi; the right nostril feels stuffed, yet there is a slight watery discharge, in the evening; nose symptoms abating after going to bed (first day); nose burning and painful, especially at the root of the nose (after two hours); the whole feeling is one of a severe cold in the head (after five hours, second day), [44].
Frequent gripings in the abdomen, without flatulence, [1].
The mere thought of eating causes nausea, yet with natural taste in mouth, [1].
Stitches from within outward in the forehead every day, from 11 A.M. till evening, [1].
Intermission of beats of the heart, with anxiety, [1].
After micturition, a moisture remains in the urethra, which afterwards, of itself, exudes from the mouth of the urethra, [1].
Pressure in the stomach, as if it were sore internally, [1].
Burning of the eyes, without redness, [1].
Burning in the right side of the abdomen, when walking far, [1].
In the morning on awaking, sensation of dryness in the mouth (fourteenth day), [29].
Too salt taste to all food, [1].
Painful heaviness in the upper incisors, [1].
Some pain in the forehead, with the dryness and stinging in the nose (second day); slight frontal headache (twelfth day); frontal headache, and below temples (thirteenth day), [44a].
*Reeling in the head
Pain in both sides of the chest, passing around to the interscapular space, [9].
Orgasm and congestion of blood to the chest, as if hæmoptysis would follow, [1].
When she cannot expectorate with the cough, her breath almost leaves her, [1].
Tongue sticky and coated a dirty yellow; a very putrid taste, which causes nausea (third day), [21].

A painful inflamed spot in the red of the upper lip (one hundred and seventy-fourth day); the spot of the upper lip is swollen and burns extremely (one hundred and seventy-fifth day); the spot has turned into an aphthæ (one hundred and seventy-sixth day); the aphthæ begins to dry up (one hundred and seventy-eighth day), [45b].
Nausea, with the chilly sensation (thirty-sixth day); less severe (thirty-seventh day); considerable nausea (thirty-eighth day), [21].
Pain in the ears, in the evening, like otalgia (after sixteen days), [1].
Headache in the forehead and vertex, followed by anxiety in the pit of the stomach, with trembling, afterwards violent nosebleed, [1].

In the evening, he perceived on the inside of the upper lip, near the right commissure of the mouth, a small painless elevation, which in a few days changed into a small pedunculated wart, with three free apices (twenty-eighth day). It still remained months after the termination of the proving, [28d].
Red spots on the glans, [1].
Pressing stitching-tearing pain in the groin, extending into the thigh, when stepping out while walking (fourth day), [1].
About 2 P.M. severe pain in a circumscribed spot, about one and a half inches in diameter, immediately over the spleen, deep; this continued until 3 P.M. (second day), [35].
Beating in the side of the head on which she lies, [1].
Frequent and strong urging to urinate, [1].
Dizzy unsteady feeling when getting up to walk (after two hours); dizziness returns when rising to walk; the least movement causes dizziness (fourth day), [38].
Tongue coated brown with red edges (sixth day); yellow in the middle and at the posterior part; tip and edges red (seventh day), [37].
At 5 P.M., had a slight chill; at 6 P.M., flushes of heat, the skin getting slightly moist (fourth day), [33].
After being stung by a bee, redness and itching red rash over the whole body, inflamed eyes, and drops of sweat on the face, all coming on in a few minutes, [1].
Jerking in the vagina upwards, in the morning, after awaking from a dream, [1].
Pressing pain on the lower left ribs, only when walking, [1].
Face pale during the perspiration (eleventh day), [23].
Itching on the head, with impatience, [1].
Pain in the tibia and fibula, particularly, however, in the malleoli, as if the bones would be forced apart, [1].
Sore pain in the region of the liver (after five hours), [2].
Discharge of blood from the vagina, only when walking, [1].

Violent pains in the left eye, as if it were rubbed against spiculæ of glass, and drawn in towards the pupil. He was obliged to close the eye five or six times involuntarily. This was followed by burning in the eye and flow of tears. The attack lasted about two minutes (fifth day), [17a].
Excessive appetite, she was never satisfied; after eating, eructations tasting of the food, [1].
Palpitation of the heart, with anxious feeling, which necessitates taking a deep breath, without any influence on the spirits, for several days (after twenty-two days), [1].

Before dinner, he observed on the inner side of the lower lip a vesicle, the size of a hemp-seed, filled with a dark blood, but it did not annoy him much, and after dinner was found to have disappeared without leaving a trace behind (second day), [25f].

Pressure and cutting in the throat, when swallowing, with a coating of mucus in the throat; on attempting to hawk up the mucus the pressure and cutting are aggravated, with a sensation as if the throat were cut with shears, followed by bleeding; dulness of the head, heat over the whole body, fever, pulse 108, followed by a stupid condition, in which he did not know whether he was awake or asleep; during the night frequent waking, with great accumulation of mucus in the throat and distressing dreams; on rising the next morning weakness, sweat on the forehead, and qualmishness, so that he lay down again, [7].
Headache all day, with great mental depression, [36].
Cracking in the articulation of the jaw on chewing, [1].
Pressing pain in the region of the liver, [1].
Cutting in the rectum during stool, with discharge of some blood, [1].
Aching-throbbing headache in the right half of the occiput (second day), [25].
Hunger constant, mostly for sweet things and meat (sixth day); continued, especially for sweets (for ten weeks), [24].
His food, which he generally likes very little salted, he now salts very much, and still it tastes to him as if there were no salt in it, [18c].
Drawing pain first in one then in the other upper arm, [1].
Single sharp stitches within the left ear, [2].
Sore pain in throat, when swallowing, [1].
Violent drawing in the right side just above the hips, extending up to the ribs and towards the kidneys, relieved after the emission of flatus, [7a].
The left side of the tongue and throat and left nostril covered with small vesicles (sixth day), [21].
Burning in the rectum the entire day, [1].
Shooting-smarting pains along the inner side of the left arm and leg, while sitting or at rest, at intervals during the day, worse in the evening, from 5 P.M. till late (eighth day), [38].
Woke at 3 A.M., could not sleep again for an hour or two; at last went to sleep lying on face (twenty-second night), [20].
Heat in the testicles, [1].
Burning in the anus during stool (after twenty-one days), [1].
With the pain in the forehead, dryness and fine stinging in the mucous membrane of the nose, as from a cold in the head (second day), [44a].
Rumbling in the stomach, [1].
In the morning, after awaking, itching in the eyelids (second day), which are gummed together (third day); itching much diminished (fourth day), [36].
Itching acridity on the posterior part of each elbow, [3].
Red, almost sore, little indurations, going and coming, on the inner side of the prepuce and glans, tickling when touched, [1].
With the dull headache drooping of the eyelids; I feel as though I had not sense enough left to lift them (third day), [21].

About 10.45 P.M., on retiring, and about ten minutes after taking the drug, felt a dull pain in the right upper chest, soon followed by a boring pain in the point of the left testicle; these symptoms came and went at short intervals, till I dropped asleep; I never felt these symptoms before (sixteenth day), [34].
Shooting pains in the teeth (tenth day), [34a].
Nose obstructed at night, especially right nostril (twentieth day), [20].
Sticking pain in the uvula, with redness of both sides of the throat; very sensitive on swallowing, with shaking chill and accumulation of mucus that cannot be loosened, [7a].
Swelling of the upper lid, with redness and burning pain, [1].
Eruptions, Dry.
Waving and confusion in the head returns, in the evening
Aching in left eye (soon); in the evening, aching in the left eye (second day), [20].
Movements of the scalp forwards and backwards, he must press the molars together, [1].
The irritation to cough frequently comes on so suddenly and violently that he cannot take breath quick enough, and it produces a spasmodic contraction of the chest, [1].
Drawing and tearing in the scalp (one hundred and second day), [45a].
A smarting blister on the right side of the tongue, [1].
Teeth sensitive to cold air (second day), [36].
Drawing pain in the bones of the orbits, [1].
Dry feeling in the nose and fauces, [1].
*Every step is painfully felt in the head, [1].
Violent pressure from without inwards below and in front of the right and left ear, [2].
Drawing tearing from below upwards in the upper and lower limbs, the whole day, but only when at rest, with great weakness, [1].
Swelling of the mucous membrane of the mouth and the internal portion of the gums, so that the mouth seems narrowed, [1].
Blister on the tongue and pain as if burned, [1].
Shivering until going to bed, and heat of the face, in bed, [1].
Absolutely no taste to food, everything tastes like straw, [2].
Pain as if burned on the tongue, when smoking (his accustomed) tobacco, [1].
Aching pain in the forehead, [8].
Vision as through a veil (twentieth day), [34].
In the forenoon, frequent alternation of headache (at one time in the forehead, at another in the occiput), and the previous (gouty) pains in the joints, but only when at rest (fifth day), [25g].
Free loose discharge from the bowels, after the cutting pain in the hypogastric region; previously the bowels had been regular (fifth day), [27].
Throat feels as if it had been skinned (fifth and sixth days), [37].
White tongue, [1].

Copious discharge from the nose, in the morning (fifth day); much thin mucous fluid comes out of the nose (seventh day); frequent discharge from the nose (seventeenth day); increased discharge from the left nostril, at noon (nineteenth day); much fluid comes out of both nostrils, late in the evening (nineteenth day); blowing of the nose, in doing which the septum of the nose burns, after dinner (twentieth day); frequent blowing of the nose, in the morning (twenty-first day); watery fluid flows several times from the nose, at noon, causing severe burning at the edges of the ala nasi (twenty-second day); great discharge from the nose, in the evening (twenty-fifth day); great watery discharge from the nose, which makes the edges sore, in the evening (twenty-seventh day); frequent blowing from the nose of thick mucus, in the forenoon (thirty-first day); much mucus comes from the nose, and there is a disagreeable dryness of the nose (forty-fifth day); discharge of watery fluid from the nose, at noon (fifty-first day); increased nasal secretion (seventy-sixth day); copious watery secretion, in the nose (seventy-seventh day); severe catarrhal symptoms (seventy-eighth day); blew much thick mucus from the nose while in the open air, in the forenoon; later, when in the room, the nose became quite dry, and its borders stiff; in the afternoon profuse nasal secretion (seventy-ninth day); blowing of thick mucus from the nose (eighty-first day); great discharge of mucus from the nose (eighty-first day); several times blowing of mucus from the nose (eighty-second day); frequent blowing of thick mucus from the nose (eighty-seventh day), [45a].

Pain in the centre of the abdomen, from afternoon till bedtime; it seemed as if a lump were lying there; the pain extended upward toward evening, accompanied by sleepiness, yet she was not able to sleep at night, [1].
Taste insipid and bitter, and yet good appetite for dinner (forty-third day), [22a].
Acrid water ran out of the eyes (third day), [25g].
Pain running from one temple to the other like a pressing together (fourth day), [37].
Dizziness, with sticking in the head
Itching of the lids, obliging him to rest them every moment, in the afternoon; the eyes can scarcely endure the light at all, in the evening (twelfth day), [15].
Toothache when biting and from pressure with the tongue, [1].
Disagreeable bitter taste in the mouth, in the morning, [1].

Anxious dreams at night, as if he were chased and had to run backwards; on awaking he imagined something was coming from above, which oppressed his chest, followed by crawling and stitches in the chest, [1].
A sensation under the skin of the face as if dashed with cold water, with perceptible coldness of the face, in paroxysms, lasting a few minutes, [1].
Sleepless at night, without anything to complain of, only she cannot lie quiet (after twenty days), [1].
Have a cold, with few but sudden coughing spells; expectoration full and easy only in the morning, after breakfast (twentieth day), [20].
Dryness of the throat the whole day, [1].
Pain in the tongue as if burned, for five days, [1].
Both eyes inflamed, [56].
A large blister on each upper arm with violent itching, [1].
The hair of the head so more and tender that he could not comb it, [19].
Eructations, tasting like rotten eggs, [1].
Dimness of vision, with giddy confusion (first day), [25g].
Restless sleep, with frequent waking, after midnight, [2].
*Headache, as if screwed together, in and over the forehead, [1].
*Tearing as with a saw in the head, [1].
No appetite (third day); anorexia; what she eats has no taste; she has no relish, and the morsel seems to stick in her gullet (fourth day); no appetite (sixth day), [31].
Wandering pains continue and seem to increase; particularly drawing and expanding pain in the side of the neck, [28a].
At 11 A.M. slight pressive headache; the whole head is affected; this pain ceases in an hour; it returns in the evening over the right eye only (seventh day), [15].
Some stitches in the crown of the head, [1].
Vertigo, in the morning in bed, when rising, as if everything in the room were in motion, [1].
Bad smell from the mouth, [1].
*Rush of blood to the head, like a slight pressure over the head, [1].
Headache, as from incarceration of flatus, [1].
Occasional sharp stitches in the upper incisors (twenty-sixth day), [38].
Tearing in the great toe, [2].
A cold sensation on right side of top of head for a short time, in the evening after sunset (seventh day), [15].
Pain in the right side, between scapula and vertebræ (twenty-third day), [20].
Lungs felt slightly sore, but no cough and no expectoration, except now and then to clear the throat of a little phlegm (twelfth to twenty-third day), [38].
Sleeplessness at night, on account of rush of thoughts, [1].
Discharge of blood with stool, which is not hard, [1].
Paralytic tension in the right thigh and hip-joint when walking, [1].
Dry coryza (first days), [1].
Bleeding of the teeth, [1].
Mouth very slimy, in the morning, [1].
(Diminution of the falling off of the hair), (twenty-third day), [45b].
*Heaviness of the head, so that every motion was disagreeable, [1].

I got up in the morning with boring pain over the right eye, and rheumatic pain in the region of the insertion of the temporal muscles of the coronoid process, which was entirely relieved for a few minutes after eating and while eating; this pain was worse on the right side, although it slightly extended to the left side in the same region, and into the right temporal region (fifth day), [27].
Loose cough, especially at night, [7].
Eyes hot and dry (fourth and twelfth days), [21].
Tired feeling all over, which lasted all day (first and third days), [42].
First tickling, then smarting pain in the last joint of left great toe, frequently recurring, [2].
Congestion of blood to the eyes, [1].
Sensation of swelling and ulceration on the left side of gums, especially the upper jaw, at noon (third day), [18].
Severe oppression of breathing, towards evening from pressure over the pit of the stomach, [1].
Looseness of the lower incisors, [1].
*Aching pain in the forehead (immediately, ninth day); in the morning the usual headache (tenth day), [22b].
Itching in the ulcer, [1].
Occasional noises in the head and ears (eighth day), [31a].
Pale yellow urine without sediment by day or night, [2].
A dull, heavy pain in the lower part of the ovaries, and pressure to pass water (twelfth day), [22].
Swelling of the inner mouth so that he can scarcely introduce any food, [1].
Fine pricking pains in pit of stomach, [1].

Although he ate a very good dinner, yet in the afternoon, contrary to habit, he became so very hungry that he had to eat again; notwithstanding this, he was again ready for supper (forty-seventh day), [45a].
The left side of the tongue is covered with blisters (fourth day); much worse (fifth day), [21].
Pains in hips and thighs, extending to near the knees (sixth day), [44a].
*Hammering headache on vivacious talking, [1].
Painful crawling and gnawing in the left external meatus, [3].
Mucous coating on tongue, one or two hours after eating, [1].
Violent squeezing pain, first in the left, then in the right auricle, close to the meatus (first day), [18a].
Expectoration of blood when coughing, every morning, without pain in the chest, [1].
Pain most in back, across hips (thirteenth day), [44a].
Pressing pain in the right side of the abdomen, [1].
Frequent sneezing, and the sensation as if a cold were coming on, and frequent blowing from the nose of mucus mixed with blood (almost every morning), (first fifteen days), [28d].
The skin of the whole body is painfully sensitive to the slightest knock, [1].
Yellowness around the mouth, [1].
Loud grumbling and sensation of emptiness in the left side of the abdomen, every day, [1].
Icy coldness of both hands in the warm room, they send a chilly feeling through the whole body, [2].
Frequent tingling in the ears (after twenty-four hours), [1].
Putrid-tasting mucus on the tongue, [1].
The vomiting (during pregnancy) frequently strains her so that blood comes up, [1].
Small induration at the root of the nose, without pain, [1].
Great weakness (after twenty-four hours), [1].
Tremulous shaking motion of the whole body, [1].
Blood-red urine, [1].
Nosebleed the third evening during the menses, [1].
*Headache only on ascending steps, [1].
Pressure in the throat, as from a plug, which it seemed to him he must swallow; from hawking or coughing mucus is raised, [1].
Chilliness for many nights, [1].
Thick yellow discharge from the nose (seventh day), [37].
*Much headache, especially on stooping, [1].
Fulness in temples and forehead, and throbbing of carotids (twenty-third day), [20].
Spasm of the bladder, [3].
Anorexia (second day), [26]; (twentieth day), [37].
Flatus in the abdomen (first, fourth, and fifth days), [44a].
Tearing in the left upper arm, at a small spot above the elbow, [2].
Pain in the tibia as from a bruise, [1].
Sensation of fulness of blood in the eyes, [1].
He awakes in the morning with great dyspnœa, and covered with sweat, lasting four hours, [1].
Water trickles from the nose, [1].
Stoppage of the nose (second day), [26].
Gets to sleep late, if she does not lie down quite early, and then also awakes early in the morning, [1].
Dull aching headache, at one time deep in the forehead, then in the occiput, but always alternating with gouty pains piercing through the joints of the extremities (first day), [25g].
Shooting in the inner sides of the tips of the fingers (fourth day), [38].
Burning-contracting cramps of stomach, from a cold, [1].
The candlelight fatigues the eyes when reading or writing, by causing a contractive sensation, [1].
Cramp in the calves at night (after a cold), [1].
A kind of occipital vertigo, [55].

Pulse 92, at 6 P.M.; 87, at 9 P.M. (first day); 88, at 9 A.M.; 82, at 9 P.M. (second day); 80, at 9 A.M. (third day); 83, at 1 P.M. (fourth day); 96, at 9 A.M.; 83, at noon (fifth day); 78, at 9 P.M. (sixth day); 80, at 9 P.M. (seventh day); 86, at 8 P.M. (fifteenth day); 80, at 10 P.M. (nineteenth day); 74, at 9 P.M. (twenty-first day); 78, at 9 P.M. (twenty-third day); 78, at 10 P.M. (twenty-fifth day); 66, at 10 P.M. (twenty-ninth day); 77, at noon; 76, at 9 P.M. (thirtieth day), [20].
Burning in the lower half of the legs, at night in bed, she had to uncover them, [1].
Small painful sore blisters in the mouth, even slightly salted food causes biting, [1].

About 2 A.M. he awoke with violent pains in the inflamed gum; they were burning and tearing, and spread all over the head; at the same time a sensation as if the left cheek were swollen, which is not the case; after two hours he became again quiet and fell asleep; gum very painful, in the evening (one hundred and second day); in the morning the gum is still rather tender, but the swelling considerably diminished (one hundred and fourth day); gum more painful (one hundred and fifth day), [45a].
Uncommon urging to urinate (as in the former proving), (third day), [40a].
Coryza about noon (second day), [43].
Sensation of paralysis in the forehead, [1].
Aching on the right side of the vertex, with rigor (first day), [18].
Jumping-aching pains in lower molars, [11].
Sweat in the morning, after awaking, which continues very profuse the whole day, and makes him so weak by evening that he could not stand on his feet (after thirteen days), [1].
Much salivation, in the evening, [1].
Numb feeling in the nerves, also in the tongue, with dulness of the head and absence of thought, in the evening, [3].
Flickering before the eyes (after forty-eight hours), [1].
Red herpetic spots on both sides of the neck with much itching, [1].
Lentil-sized, red, insensible nodules, here and there, in the hands, which ooze on prickling, [5].
Sour taste in the mouth, in the morning after a good sleep, [3].
*Vertigo (eighty-first day), [45a].,
Aching in the sacrum, in the evening, relieved by pressure (eighteenth day), [20].
The right foot goes to sleep (after two days), [1].
Painful ulcer on internal surface of lower lip; pain ameliorated by cold water, [1].
Violent stitches in the chest with every inspiration; he dared only to take a short breath; from this the head became affected (after five days), [1].
Restless sleep, for several weeks, with many dreams and tossing about, later quiet sleep, [1].

Having been constipated since the first day, I feel at 9.45 A.M. a sudden violent aching in the anus, relieved by fast walking, and ceasing entirely as soon as the fæces began to pass (never had anything like it before), (third day), [40a].
Cramplike drawing below the right mastoid process (fifth day), [25a].

Frequent attacks of contractive pain in the right side of the abdomen, worse in the morning; following this, more severe constrictive pain in the stomach; thence the pain extends to the chest; relieved by eructations, [1].

Appetite diminished (twelfth and thirteenth days); little appetite (seventeenth day); the appetite was diminished, and after taking but a small quantity of food, he had the feeling as if the stomach was overloaded (twenty-sixth day); appetite diminished, in the forenoon (thirty-first and thirty-third days); appetite diminished; he ate rather from habit than from necessity (thirty-eighth day); appetite diminished (forty-eighth day); little appetite (fifty-second day); at noon the appetite was very poor, and after eating, there was a troublesome feeling of fulness in the stomach and aching in the scrobiculus cordis (fiftieth and fifty-first days), [29].
Drawing in the teeth of the left upper jaw, the gums of which pain, as if ulcerated (third day), [18].
Great weakness of the knees, [1].
Aching and heat in the head, about noon (twenty-first day), [43].

Headache comes on with the heat and gets better with it, but never quite goes; it is as if the occiput were opening and shutting; better by cold water or in open air; worse by bending head down, [16].
A cicatrix on the tip of the index finger commences to bleed spontaneously, [1].
Spasmodic cough, [1].
Heaviness of the limbs, [7a].
Protrusion and itching of hæmorrhoids, [1].
Sore corroding pain on the upper part of the toes, [1].
Sudden drawing above the right eyebrow (after two hours, third day), [25f].

Attacks of vertigo when walking in the open air, lasting from 2 to 3 minutes; it was as if something were rolling about in the head, and made her reel; followed in the evening by headache and humming in the ears, [1].
Inclination for coition, with great emission of semen, with but slight voluptuous feeling, followed by tension in the abdomen, extending to the spermatic cords (fifth day), [1].
Swollen dark-red gums, with painful throbbing, as if beginning to suppurate, so severe that it was scarcely endurable, [1].
Pressing in the left ear for a quarter of an hour, in the morning when awaking, [1].
Pressure on the vertex after mental labor, [1].
Severe pressure in the chest, evening in bed, [1].
Vertigo, while sitting; reeling while standing, [1].
Burning on the skin of the arm on the outside just below the shoulder-joint, as from a blister, [2].
Clotted blood is always discharged on blowing the nose, [1].
Desquamation of the skin from the inside of the cheek, [1].
Tongue red and clean; the papillæ elevated; it feels as if burnt (twenty-second day), [20].
Frequent sharp pressure on the os sacrum and a little below it, [1].
The eyes are painful on looking at the flame of a candle, [1].
The eyelids pain on awaking as if too heavy, and as if he could not hold them open, [1].
Drawing and tearing in a part of the skin which had once been injured, [1].
Boring pain in the knee-joint, when at rest, [1].
During the menses, nosebleed, three successive evenings, [1].
In the morning, on awaking, dry wrinkled lips (fourteenth day), [29].

At night, in bed, there occurred deep in the right side of the forehead, in a circumscribed spot the size of a crown piece, a slight digging-shooting pain, which lasted a few minutes (first day), [25g].
Blister on the gums, with burning pain from touch, [1].
*Sore pain in both oral commissures, in the afternoon (eighth day), [44b].
No appetite; loathing of meat, [19].
She is quite hot, then cold, with great faintness, [8].
The glans is hot and itching, with soreness of the prepuce, [1].
About 2 A.M., violent throbbing of all the arteries of the head (third day), [25g].
A painful spot on the left nostril (two hundred and fifteenth day), [45b].
Great distension of the abdomen, immediately after eating some soup, [2].
Sleep disturbed through frequent cough, and from pain in the feet, [4].
In the forenoon on inspiring cold air, tearing pain in a lower healthy incisor tooth (thirty-sixth day), [33].
Offensive odor of nasal mucus on blowing the nose, [1].
In the evening, tearing in the right cheek (thirtieth day), [28c].
Aversion to sour and sweet things, [1].
Pressive headache at vertex, [9].
Sudden hoarseness (after seven days), [1]
Considerable desire to urinate, with painful bearing down in the pelvis, in the morning, [3].
Tickling burning in the right axilla, [2].
Agglutination of the eyelids, only in the evening, [1].
Stitches in one of the breasts, [1].
Cough when going to sleep (fourth day), [1].
Continued erection after coition, and after nocturnal emissions, [1].
Nosebleed just before and after the menses, [1].
Pimple near the right nostril, which afterwards formed a large scab, [1].
Painful pressure on the malar bone and beneath the eye, [1].
Cramplike pains in the calves, and shooting pains in the ankles, [14].
Pimples in the face, which itch somewhat, [1].
Heaviness of the head, in the evening, and after lying down one-sided headache, [1].
Creeping sensation on the inner margin of the left orbit, [2].
Short violent tearing from the forehead down beside the right ala of the nose, [2].
Smarting-boring pain to the right of the navel (after eighteen days), [1].
Stitches in the forehead, with nausea (she cannot eat), better from lying down, [1].
It is painful within the ear, when cleaning, [1].
Violent feverish headache in the crown, occurring several mornings and lasting several hours, [1].
Cutting in the upper lip, as from a splinter, [1].
Desire for but unable to pass a stool; intense constriction of the sphincter ani (after three hours, fourth day), [44a].
Menses anticipated one day the first month and two days the second month; afterwards they came at the proper time, [24].
About 2 A.M., he awoke with aching pain in the occiput (third day), [22g].
*Headache (ninth day), [18a]; (second day), [34], etc.
Sharp tingling pains in the tips of the fingers (twenty-sixth day), [38].
Sleep pretty good, but not refreshing; I spent hours enough in bed, but they did no good, [35].
Pains in tendons of right foot about the ankle, [1].
At night in bed, drawing in the right upper row of teeth (third day), [25a].
