Waking at night about 2 o'clock, with violent colic, and at times also pressing pain above and around the navel, with trembling motion of the heart, which can be felt outwardly (without palpitation), with full pulse; with this, nausea and sensation of great weakness, for three nights in succession, with great dryness of the mouth, [2].
A scabby ulcer with burning pain on the margin of the red of the lower lip, [1].
Scalp for a long time thickly covered with scabs, [39a]. [Up to the age of fifteen I had been frequently troubled with ringworm.]
Burning sensation in the margin of the left lower eyelid, towards the outer canthus, [2].
First a smarting, then a cutting, and at times also pressing sensation in the left side of throat, [2].
Bleeding of the gum, [3].
Severe itching in the nape of the neck, [1].
Much ringing in the ears, and tingling or roaring in the head, for several days, [48].
On two spots of the vertex there are found very tender scabby elevations, the size of a pea, which last several days (forty-third day), [28c].
Stitch, as if in the bone, extending from under the right eyelid down to the upper canine tooth, [1].
Urine thick, slimy, and very offensive, depositing a yellowish pasty sediment the next morning (third day), [23].
Toothache, which is renewed by cold rinsing of the mouth, [1].
*Vertigo when walking over running water, even to falling down, and all parts seem paralyzed, [1].
Swelling of the gums with sore pain, [1].
Thirst for several hours, immediately, [5].
Fulness of the stomach, at noon, [1].
Chilly sensation, with nausea, at 11 A.M. (thirty-sixth day); less severe (thirty-seventh day), [21].
Dryness of the inner nose, [1].
Turbid urine with red sandy sediment, [1].
Tension in the calves, [3].
In the morning, weight and hot feeling in the occiput (fourth and fifth days), [22b].
Sensation of heat in the eyes, [1].
Boring pains in the meatus auditorius (fiftieth and fifty-first days), [29].

Pressure and heavy weight in the ovaries, and a pressure to pass water (after one hour, eighth day); (I usually pass water twice a day, night and morning); increased pain in the ovaries, dull and heavy (after second dose, eighth day), [22].
Woke with a dull headache, which ceased on rising; at 9.45 P.M., a dull headache through both temples (slight), (second day), [40a].
Gnawing in the posterior molars, [1].
Pressive pain, as if sprained, immediately under the left shoulder-joint, in the back, [2].
Burning in the outer canthus frequently during the day for one hour, [1].
Cramp in the toes, recurring several days, [1].
Cramplike pain in lower jaw preceded by pain in neck, [1].
Itching of the occiput, in the evening, [1].
Smarting in the urethra, when urinating, [1].
Bruised pain in the eye on pressing it together and on feeling of it, [1].
Bitter taste of all food, with very coated tongue, [1].
Frontal headache and pain in the temples returned daily, more marked, morning, noon, and evening (twelfth to twenty-third day), [38].
Violent cutting in the stomach, extending up to the breast, with constant motion of flatus, which cannot find exit (after four days), [1].
Pass water much more often than is my habit (tenth day), [22].

Severe cramps in the uterine region, at 7 A.M.; so severe I was obliged to leave college and go home, at 11 A.M.; menses made their appearance at 10 P.M., but the pain continued till morning (seventy-second day), [21].
Since taking the medicine, any break of the skin or a burn makes a sore which lasts a long time, an unusual thing, as my skin generally heals quickly (twelfth day), [22].
Emissions disappear (secondary effect), [1].
Lentil-sized brown spots on the elbows, surrounded with an herpetic-looking skin, [1].
Intolerable itching inside of the nose, which is sore on scratching (after two days), [28].
Painless swelling in the nape of the neck, about the size of a hazelnut, [1].
Beating headache with every movement, [1].
Tensive pain between the scapulæ, [1].
Much discharge of offensive flatus (after fifteen days), [1].
Burning in the rectum during the latter part of a soft stool (after six days), [1].
Severe bleeding of the teeth, in the morning, [1].
Dull stitches in the region of the liver (after three hours), [2].
Drawing pain in the face, with swelling of the cheek, [1].

Dryness of the nose, burning on the outer borders of the alæ nasi, which are very sensitive to touch, in the evening (fifth day); dry feeling and troublesome tension in the nose, in the forenoon (fourteenth day); troublesome dryness in the nasal cavity (sixteenth day); in the nose sometimes dry feeling, and sometimes a discharge of watery fluid from it (seventeenth day); dry feeling in the nose, towards noon (eighteenth day), [45].
Waked with stitching pain in the right temple (thirty-second night), [38].
The food will not go down, [1].
Compression in the upper part of the head, the entire day, with great dyspnœa (after eleven days), [1].
Much distended abdomen, without stool, [1].
Tearing in the occiput, [1].
Restless sleep at night, on account of anxious dreams and heat; she could not lie quiet for five minutes (after seven days), [1].

A watery fluid runs out of the nose (fifth day); considerable mucous discharge from the nose (fourteenth day); fluid frequently flows out of the right nostril (twentieth day); after dinner, a water fluid frequently flows from the nose (thirty-second day); watery discharge from the nose (thirty-fourth day); watery discharge from the nose occasionally (thirty-fifth day); in the forenoon, frequent blowing of thick mucus from the nose (forty-ninth day); blowing of mucus from the nose, in the morning (fifty-third day); much secretion from the nose (sixty-third day); copious secretion of thick mucus from the nose (sixty-seventh day); blowing of thick mucus from the nose (ninety-eighth day); some fluid comes out of the right nostril (one hundred and forty-seventh day); frequent blowing the nose, and coughing (two hundred and nineteenth day); catarrhal symptoms somewhat less (two hundred and twenty-first day), catarrhal symptoms continue in a milder degree (two hundred and twenty-third day); a fluid runs out of the left nostril (two hundred and thirty-first day); blowing from the nose of thick mucus; catarrhal sufferings, at noon (two hundred and sixty-ninth day); much mucus blown from the nose (two hundred and seventy-fourth day); blowing from the nose of thick mucus (two hundred and seventy-fifth day), [45b].
Painful smarting of the eyes, [58].
Slight headache at the left side of the forehead, just above the eyebrow (soon); at noon, troublesome aching on the left side of the forehead (third day), [18].
Thought she would vomit during the perspiration, but was relieved on getting up and moving about (eleventh day), [23].
Drawing pain in the right wrist-joint, [2].
Shivering several times a day, without chilliness, [1].
Sleep does not refresh, but leaves a tired aching feeling all through the body (third, fourth, and fifth days); disturbed sleep continued (for ten weeks), [24].
Some blood discharged with the stool, daily, for a long time, [1].
Drawing pain deep in the right leg, extending down over the malleoli, [2].
Nausea almost immediately, followed by drawing in the limbs, [1].
Swelling on the forehead (after four and fifteen days), [1].
*Dizziness, unsteadiness of the head and body, in the morning, lasting three hours, as if one stood upon wavering ground (third day)
Nausea several minutes every morning, at 10 oclock, without eructations, [1].
Before the menses acrid leucorrhœa, with soreness of the pudendum, [1].
Roaring in the ears, for several days, [1].
Coldness over the whole body, [7a].
Severe tearing in the urethra, [1].
Bone pain in the ball of the great toe, [1].
*Headache pressing out at the forehead, [3].
The complaints are considerably worse, evenings and nights, than during the day, [1].
Slight aching in the region of the kidneys (third day), [40a].
Sensation of a veil before the eyes, and dim vision for near and distant objects, [1].
Local application of warmth relieves the pains, [1].
Great aching between shoulders and under the left scapula, extending into the left lung, worse on expiration (fifteenth day), [20].
Stitches in the pit of stomach, [1].
Sensation as of a knife plunged into the left hand, just on the ball behind the little finger, for a few minutes (seventh day), [27].
Towards evening, headache, and shooting in the throat (first day), [26].
Noise and whistling in the abdomen, with distension, [3].

In the morning after awaking, tongue thickly furred (fourth and fifth days); in the morning on awaking, dryness and burning of the tongue, which was covered with a dirty whitish-yellow fur (tenth day), [29a].

In the morning, after awaking, pain in the left side of the forehead, which lasted till noon (eleventh day); pain in the left frontal region, in the morning (two hundred and twenty-ninth day); in the night, awakened by a rather severe but transient pain in the left frontal region (two hundred and forty-first day); woke, in the morning, with violent pains in the left frontal region, which lasted till he got up (two hundred and fifty-eighth day), [45b].

In the forenoon, some burning on the edges of the eyelids (seventh day); slight burning in the external canthi (sixty-fourth day); during the day, severe burning on the edges of the eyelids (two hundred and third day); slight burning of the tarsal edges (two hundred and seventy-ninth day), [45b].
Pulsating throbbing felt externally on the head, [1].
Boring above the root of the nose (twentieth day), [34].
During the menses everything gets black and clouded before the eyes, in the evening, accompanied by great weakness, which passes off when lying, [1].
Sick pale look, in the morning, with dim red eyes, [1].
Face much heated, in the evening, with heat in the head, [1].
A few sharp flashing uterine pains (eighteenth day), [20].
Dryness of the tongue, which, after a quarter of an hour, gave place to a slimy taste in the mouth (fourth day), [25f].
Abundant discharge of water-colored urine (second day), [1].
Great heat in the head, in the morning, with sensation as if the nose would bleed, [1].
In the afternoon burning shooting beneath the lids of the left eye, as though sand had got into it (second day), [25c].

Sudden severe pain in the back when stooping, like a blow from a hammer, accompanied by a stitching-tearing pain, so severe that he felt as if he would sink together and lose his breath; pressing the back on a hard substance relieved the pain, [1].
Continued and violent eructations, in the evening, preceded by great distension of the abdomen, [1].
Nosebleed for seven hours, but only a few drops, from time to time, [1].
Deep-toned roaring in the ear when lying on it, synchronous with the pulse, for two nights, [1].
Attack of vertigo, as if fainting, lasting two hours, with very short breath, [1].
Unsuccessful desire for stool, passes only wind and mucus, with sensation in rectum as if a plug were in it, [1].
Slight burning and profuse lachrymation of the left eye, in the forenoon (tenth day), [45].
Tearing in the upper part of the right side of forehead (after eight hours), [2].

Passed a very restless night (second night); disturbed sleep (third night); do not feel rested, in the morning; sleep very much disturbed by laborious dreams (fourth night); very tiresome dreams (fifth night); very restless night, full of dreams; awaking often in fright (sixth night), [21].
Dull pressing pain on a small spot in the occiput, [2].
Grumbling in the abdomen, while lying down (after ten days), [1].
Severe dry coryza, with roaring in the head and ears (after twenty-four hours), [1].
Burning in the roof of the palate, [7a].
Pressing drawing on the right false ribs, toward the back, passing off from motion or from rubbing, [2].
Before and during hard stool, excessive contractive pain in rectum (after four days), [1].
Prickling in the tip of the little finger (after three days), [1].
Stitches in the pudendum (after three days), [1].
At noon had a dull pain over the forehead, extending from each temple (after two hours, nineteenth day), [22].
Much pain and weakness in small of back, [8].
Remained languid for five days (after three days), [23].
A couple of jerks in the right temple near the ear (fifty-fifth day), [45a].
Yawning and stretching, in the morning, in bed, [1].
The teeth become elongated, so that she can scarcely chew, [1].
Bleeding from the gums on the slightest touch, [9].
When blowing the nose, a sensation as if air were forced into the ears, [1].
A small ulcer in one nostril, lasting a long time, [1].
Goneness, principally located in stomach (after two hours and a half, second and third days), [42].
Flushes of heat, in the evening, then itching, [1].
Agglutinated eyes, in the morning (after burning, in the evening), [3].
With every movement of the body, nausea, as if to vomit, and such weakness that he had to lie immediately on the ground; in the open air all the limbs felt relaxed, [1].
Great thirst without heat; drink tastes good, but does not quench the first, and seems to distress the stomach, [1].
Lips always hot, sticking, and burning, [1].
In the forenoon, loss of appetite (first day), [25e].
He awakes at night in a fright and screaming, [1].
About 3 P.M., for an hour, remarkable dilatation of the pupils (thirty-second day), [27].
Call to stool; I felt as though I had lost all power of expulsion; only small hard lumps passed, which did not give relief, at 5 P.M. (after nine hours, second day), [21].
Constipation succeeding a relaxed state of the bowels, [8].
A short tensive aching in the left side of the occiput (eighth day), [25].
Small red pimple on the forehead, roughness of the forehead (first to sixth day), [1].
One-sided deep pressive headache, with pressive pain in the molar teeth, [1].
Expulsion of ascarides, [1].
The gum bleeds on spitting, [1].
*Tensive pain in the head, [1].
Sharp pain in the left side, near the heart, in the middle of the afternoon, and again about 10 P.M. (tenth day), [22].

With the constipation and piles, severe pains across the lower part of the abdomen, extending down the inside of the thighs, both abdomen and thighs feeling sore to touch; at times unable to stand, for past ten days (fortieth day), [22].
Fainting during a slow ride, [1].
Offensive breath as from mucus in the chest, [1].
Severe fluent coryza, with great pain in the occiput, and painful drawing in the hips and thighs, for two weeks, [1].
*Painful pressure above the eyebrows, [1].
Red swelling of the cheeks, without pain, [1].
Stitching pain in the third toe of the right foot, at the same time as the pain in the left lung (tenth day), [27].
*Pressure externally on the vertex, extending to the forehead, [1].
In the outer canthus of the right eye itching, shooting, and sensation of fine sparks in the skin of the right upper lid (third day), [25a].
Fluent coryza, like water, [1].
Stupefied feeling in the head, with tightness on the chest and weakness of the whole body, [1].
Little sleep at night, on account of pain in hip-joint, when moving it, [1].

Violent headache on getting up; weight on the forehead; this pain is aggravated in the open air and when walking; a little later it becomes seated in the forehead and is pulsative (twelfth day), [15].
Jerking pain above the right eye, [1].
Dull tired pain in the right shoulder and muscles of the back of the neck (second day), [36].
Swelling between the tibia and calf (after thirteen days), [1].
In the evening after eating an ice, very disagreeable taste and slight nausea (ninth day), [45].
Slight tearing on the right malar bone, below the temple, [2].
Painful confusion of the head, particularly of the forehead, [5].
In the afternoon after a meal, indolent and sleepy, [1].
Scanty expectoration, with wheezing rattling in the chest, [1].
Tensive pain in one side of the neck, as if it were swollen, [1].
Pressive headache, at 10 A.M. (fifteenth day), [43].
Frequent trembling of the whole body (after ten days), [1].
Beating toothache, which on the third day became stitching, with rapid decay of the teeth, [1].
Considerable congestion of the face, at 3 P.M. (sixth day), [33].
After rattling of mucus in the chest, severe cough, with expectoration, producing raw and sore pain in the throat, felt one half hour after the cough, [1].
For four months after the proving, the Sepia symptoms returned whenever a dose of Nux vomica was taken, [20].
Painful drawing, now in the right, and again in the left side of the occiput, inferiorly (after five hours), [2].
Cutting in the lower abdomen, in the afternoon, continuous and also with single jerks, [1].
Bilious vomiting, two mornings (after three days), [1].
Hard distended abdomen, particularly in the evening, together with congested state of the superficial abdominal veins, accompanied with stitching pain in the hernia, [1].
Tension in the elbow, as if too short, [1].
Long after taste to beer, [1].
Smarting in the rectum after stool, [1].
Bad odor from the mouth, after dinner, [1].
Pressure in the eyes, especially on working in the sun, [2].
Pain in the head once every minute, a stitching pain in the head coming up the back at every step, [1].
Pressure in the abdomen a few days before the menses, and after this had passed off, soreness in the perinæum and swelling of the pudendum before the discharge of blood came on, [1].
Drawing-stitching pain in the internal ear, from within outwards, [1].
Yawning and stretching, [7a].
Green halo around the candlelight, [1].
Sour-smelling sweat (after thirty days), [1].
Epigastrium tense, pressing pain in it one hour after dinner, and after walking in the open air, [2].
Very tired in the morning, when rising from bed, [1].
Hands cold, but moist, almost all the time (twenty-ninth day), [20].
Vertigo, lasting some minutes, followed immediately by slight shooting in the anus (fourteenth day), [45b].
Great dragging in my right side (fifth day), [37].
Fine sticking pains occasionally in left lower jaw and the glands underneath, particularly when touched, [1].
Mammæ sore and tender to touch (eleventh day); even moving, turning, or stepping aggravates the soreness (twelfth day), [20].
In the morning, on awaking, tension of the skin surrounding the mouth (third day); dryness and tension of the outer skin round about the lips, and branlike desquamation of it (tenth day), [29a].
Bloated uncomfortable feeling around the waist (second day), [22].
Weakness and dulness of the head during dinner, lasting till evening, [1].

Following the perspiration, headache in the right side of the head and face, not severe, but with a surging sensation in the forehead, like waves of pain rolling up and beating against the frontal bone (after forty minutes); pain in head more severe; still on the right side (after one hour and a half); somewhat abated after eating dinner (after two hours); increased again in ten minutes; severe pain in the head, extending somewhat to the left side of the forehead, with the flush (after two hours and three-quarters; less severe (after four hours); slight increase (after five hours); pressive headache, all the time, in the evening, most in the frontal region, lasting till midnight, but abating after going to bed (first day); headache returned, but not so severe as yesterday; pain in forehead quite violent (after three hours); violent pain in the head, mostly in the forehead and malar bones, with heat in the forehead (after five hours); headache relieved by rest and sleep for three hours, in the afternoon (after eleven hours, second day); some headache and pain in the face, but not marked, unless she thinks about it, then the pain is quite severe (after three hours); headache abated (after nine hours, third day); general dull headache all day, with pallor of face (fourth and fifth days); headache abating (sixth day), [44].
Vinegary taste in the mouth immediately after drinking milk, [1].
Pain in the upper part of the back, every morning, if she laces herself at all tightly, [1].
Drawing and tearing in the teeth, mostly aggravated by cold water, at times relieved by warmth; often with jerking in the tips, [3].
Scanty emission of urine (first seven days), [1].
Violent cutting in the anus and rectum at night, [1].
Loss of appetite; nothing is relished, [1].
Dulness in the head, with pressure in the eyes, aggravated by walking in the open air, [1].
Vexatious dreadful dreams, [1].
Woke at 4.30 A.M., without apparent cause, and remained awake (second day), [21].
Redness and violent burning on both cheek-bones, [1].
Painful blister on the tip of the tongue, above and below, [1].
Discharge of a few drops of blood from the vagina, fifteen days before the time of menses (after eight days), [1].
Stitches in the forehead, as from needles, daily, when walking fast, with nausea, [1].
Slight morning sweat, without odor, lasting three hours, for several successive mornings, without subsequent weakness, [1].
Short breath (immediately), [1].
*Feeling as of some heavy weight on vertex, [66].
Tired feeling, in the morning (tenth day), [35].
Languid dull feeling, at 8 P.M. (twentieth day), [20].
Vertigo, with qualmishness, [1]; (fifteenth day), [34a].

Small painful pimples here and there on the scalp (eighth day); pimples gone (ninth day); several small pimples on the scalp (fifty-fifth day); in the evening, painful pimples here and there over the scalp (one hundred and thirty-fourth day); several small pimples on the head (one hundred and thirty-eighth day); small pimples on various parts of the scalp (one hundred and forty-seventh day); the pimples on the head are almost all there still (one hundred and fiftieth day) on the scalp, several small spots covered with scabs (one hundred and fifty-sixth day); the scabs on the scalp are loosening (one hundred and fifty-eighth day), [45b].
The teeth pain as if too long, and there is a tingling in them, like a vibration, [1].
Drawing cutting toothache, [1].
Sleepiness during the day, she falls asleep as soon as she sits down, [1].
Very hungry at noon (twenty-first day), [20].
Sensitiveness of the eyes to daylight (in two hours, fifth day), [36c].
Painful thrusts in the right side of the head, in the evening while sitting, [3].
Drawing in the left upper jaw and zygoma, about 5 P.M. (eighth day), [44a].

Transient sensitiveness of the mucous membrane of the nose (fourth day); mucous membrane of the nose feels sore, on smoking (thirty-second day); at dinner, a peculiar feeling in the right nostril; he felt as if the mucous membrane detached itself from the bone and rose as a blister, at the same time frequent sneezing; these symptoms were present almost all the afternoon (thirty-fourth day); raw pain on the edge of the right nostril (sixty-fifth day), [45a].
Internal chilliness in the warm room the whole day, for several days, [1].
Quick decay of the teeth, [1].
Shooting pain in the right temple (second day), [25f].
Urine unusually turbid, [11].
Difficult expulsion of soft thin shaped fæces, [1].
Putrid taste to the expectoration and putrid smell of the breath coming up with it, [1].
Tearing in the upper maxilla, [2].
A red pimple on the margin of the red of the lower lip, with sticking pain only on touch, [1].
Stitches in the anus after the morning stool, lasting until afternoon (after seven days), [1].
Painful cracking in the head, as if something in it broke, with pain in the neck, when turning the head, [1].

Feet very tender all day; can hardly bear my stockings to touch my feet; after walking awhile they feel better (thirty-first day); corns on toes very sore, and toes very much inflamed and sensitive to touch (thirty-second and thirty-third days); corns very painful (forty-seventh and forty-eighth days), [21].
About 3 P.M., feeling of fine sand between the right eye and lid (second day), [36c].
Drawing in the thighs (after forty-eight hours), [1].
Aching on the eyelids (fifth day), [45c].
Hiccough during the habitual smoking, with contraction of the throat, and sensation as if a plug were in it, producing nausea and accumulation of water in the mouth, [1].
Symptoms of a catarrhal fever, with weakness in the lower extremities and drawing in the arms, [1].
Slimy diarrhœa, with distended abdomen, [1].
Imperfect emission, with lascivious dreams, [2].

At noon increased appetite (fifth day); at noon uncommon appetite, which, however, he did not satisfy, but left the table before he was satiated (sixth day); good (seventh day); increased rather than diminished, and he relished breakfast, dinner, and supper amazingly (eighth and ninth days); diminished (tenth day); dinner taken with considerable appetite (eleventh day); appetite much increased (thirteenth day); ate dinner with the best appetite (fourteenth day); uncommon hunger (twenty-third day), [35b].
Burning, as from pepper, in the mouth, day and night, causing thirst, not relieved by drinking, [1].
*Dulness of the head, in the morning, and pressure in the forehead till noon, [1].
Starting in the noonday sleep, [1].
Backache almost all day (ninth day); severe backache, in the afternoon (tenth day); backache (twentieth day), [22].
Beating in the left chest (after six days), [1].

After midnight, excessively violent pains in the left lower jaw; the pains were drawing pressing, proceeding from a healthy tooth, spreading over the whole lower jaw, extending to the temple and ear, and lasting till he got up the following morning (two hundred and seventy-seventh day); some tenderness of the left lower jaw (two hundred and seventy-ninth day); towards morning, severe pain in the left lower jaw, sometimes with drawing into the left ear; in the forenoon, in the open air, the pain increased; it was a very painful drawing, which extended not only over the jaw, but over the whole of the left side of the face; one spot on the lower border of the under jaw was especially painful, also when touched; in the evening, in the open air, the pain extended in an aggravated degree all over the lower jaw; occasional pain in the left lower jaw, in the morning (two hundred and eightieth day); drawing in the lower jaw, in the morning (two hundred and eighty-first day); towards morning the pain of the left lower jaw, especially about a loose tooth, extremely violent (two hundred and eighty-second day); pain in the lower jaw during the day, occasional sharp tearing in the left lower jaw (two hundred and eighty-third day), [45b].
Burning sore pain in the upper part of the left chest, even from touch, [2].
Swelling of the eye, with headache on the same side, [1].
Bitter bilious taste in the mouth, when fasting, though food has a good taste, [1].
The borders of the alæ nasi dry, the Schneiderian mucous membrane irritated, as if a coryza were coming on (fifteenth day), [29].
Bitter sourish taste in the mouth, at noon after eating, [1].
Tearing in the head outward at the ear, [1].

Prolapsus uteri, with inclination of the fundus to the left side, producing a numb feeling in the entire lower half of the left side of the body, with dull aching pain constantly; also the same aching pain in the pelvic region, somewhat relieved by the recumbent posture, especially when lying on the right side; tenderness of the os uteri (first and third days), [42].
Laziness after a meal, [1].
Digging in the forehead, at night, [1].
Deepseated, tensive, dull pain in the lumbar region (right side), (third day), [36].
Pressure and tension in the forehead and eyes, with burning, [1].
Swelling of the axillary glands, [1].
Penetrating shooting and drawing in the left zygoma (one hundred and forty-third day), [45b].
When falling asleep he was attacked with an internal trembling, and with itching in the thighs, going off after scratching, [1].
Constant accumulation of mucus in the throat, which almost suffocates her, [10].
Brown mucus on the teeth, [1].
Frequent dryness of the mouth, as if the tongue would cleave to the mouth, without thirst, [1].
Tension of the lower lip, [1].
Wearisome sleep (after fifteen days), [1].
Very much thirst during the day, [1], [2].
Pressure in the throat, even when it is dressed very loosely, [1].
Unsuccessful urging to stool, with load and pressure in the rectum (twentieth day); great urging to stool at same hour as yesterday (twenty-first day); in evening (twenty-second day), [20].
Bad odor from the mouth, in the morning on rising, [1].
Anxious dreams of being threatened with rape (after two days), [1].
Long continued cramp in the soles of the feet, evening in bed, [1].
Leucorrhœa increases, when she has frequent eructations and retching, she then becomes pale in the face, [1].
Stitches in the knee, [1].
Burning in the abdomen while sitting, passing off while walking, [1].
Constriction of the sphincter ani (fifth day), preventing any movements of the bowels (sixth day), [44].
Throat red and dry (twentieth day), [20].
Complete loss of appetite, [65].
Eruption, large and scurfy, in the vermilion border of both lips (after a journey in the cold), [1].
Itching and stinging in the rectum, [1].
Lachrymation in the open air, several days, [48].
Hard and inflamed boil on right nates, [9].
Colic pain in upper part of abdomen, above umbilicus (after eight hours and a half); occasional pains (fourth day), [44a].
Black comedones on the nose, upper lip, and chin, [1].
Burning of the eyes, in the morning, with weakness of the eyes, [1].
Boring pain over the left eye, [51].
Great weakness, at 7 P.M., [1].
Expectoration of white mucus of the size of millet seed (after fourteen days), [4].
Itching and burning of the eyes (fourth day), [36c].
Whizzing before the ears, in the evening when writing, interpolated with whistling, [1].
Soreness and redness of the labiæ, in the perinæum and between the thighs, [1].
Collection of saliva in the mouth, sour and bitter, [1].
Pressure in the abdomen, [1].

Sore pain in the whole nose, especially in its septum, the slightest touch increased the pain, in the evening (second day); sore feeling in the nose, in the morning after rising; at noon pain very severe and an acrid fluid flowed from the right nostril (fourth day); the nose, especially its left outer edge, is very sensitive to touch (seventh day); in the morning after waking, very tensive sore pain in the nose, especially at its point; feeling as if the nose was swollen; its internal aspect is covered with small scabs (eighth day); the edges and septum of the nose rather sensitive (tenth day); sensitiveness of the septum of the nose (eleventh day); sensitiveness and dryness of the nose, at noon (thirteenth day), [45].
Cramplike pain in the left lower jaw and in the glans penis (first day), [18a].
When the heat comes on, a thick fog seems to pervade the (gas-lighted) room, so that she feels half blind; it lasts till bedtime; not noticed in the morning, [16].
Slight swelling of the right parotid gland, in the evening (third day), [37].
Yellow leucorrhœa (after twenty-four hours), [1].
Itching of the toes, [1].
Blew a very little blood from left nostril (second day), [15].
Heartburn forenoon and afternoon, for several hours, extending from the pit of the stomach to the throat, in which he has a sourish taste and a scraping sensation, [1].

Fulness of the head greatly aggravated on lying, at 5 P.M.; distress as of a pressing outward in the forehead, and a feeling of sinking in the vertex; sensation as if the brain moved in waves, with a sensation of hunger (twenty-second day), [20].

Sudden and uncontrollable thirst, at 9 P.M., but water tastes insipid, unless very cold (fourth day); a very unusual thirst appeared, at 9 P.M.; I must have water (sixth day); a peculiar thirst, which lasted all the evening; water tastes natural if cold (ninth day); marked thirst, at 9 P.M. (tenth and following days), [20].
Cramplike penetrating pain in the right mastoid process, in the morning (fourth day), [25f].
Very cold feet, with headache, especially towards evening and in the morning, [7a].
*In two hours, when in bed, he had a violent rush of blood to the head, and felt all the arteries in his head beating (first day), [23].
Slight attack of vertigo and palpitation of heart, when walking in the open air, [1].
Trembling of the lips, [1].
Painful nodes on the forehead, [1].
He cannot tolerate meat or fish, in the evening; it causes pressure in the stomach, draws the abdomen upward, and delays the stool, [1].
Trembling of the eyes, [1].
Disposition to sleep (first and following days), [22].
Blisters form easily on the heel, when walking, [1].
Accumulation of flatus, [7a].
Scraping sensation in the throat, when swallowing, [2].
Aching pains in the left frontal region, in the evening (sixteenth day), [43].
Cutting pain in the nose, and discharge of thin fluid from it, in the evening (seventh day), [45].
She became tired and had to lie down, in the forenoon (after two hours), [1].
Dizziness in the head, in the afternoon (soon, sixth day); dizziness, in the morning, soon after getting up, that lasted till 5 P.M. (seventh day), [44a].
Stitching pain in throat, when swallowing, [1].
Appetite for dinner unaltered, but afterwards unusual fulness and weariness, relieved by walking in the open air (second and third days), [22a].
Digestion excites heat and palpitation of the heart (after three days), [1].
Copious secretion of earwax (fifty and fifty-first days), [29].
Pinching pain in the vertex and in the upper part of the occiput, with sore feeling, which at last became a burning, [2].
Drawing, first in the upper teeth of the left side, and then in those of the right side (third day), [18].
*Violent headache at night, which disturbed sleep; she had rest in no position, [3].
Yellow spots in the face and a yellow saddle across the upper part of the cheeks and the nose (after twenty days), [1].
The mucus brought away on blowing the nose has streaks of blood in it (twenty-seventh day), [28c].
Strong erections (second day); from the twenty-ninth day on, however, only short, and with quick emission of semen during coition, [1].
Tension posteriorly at the left side, as from a cold, [1].
Great heat until midnight (first eight nights), [1].
*Boring headache on the top beneath the vertex; the spot is also painful to touch externally, [1].
Objects seem more distant than they really are, [1].
Pressure in the throat, towards the back, when swallowing food and drink, [1].
Transient aching pain over the right eye and going into the eye (third day), [36].

Sensation of bearing down in the pelvic region, with a slight dragging pain from the sacrum (fourth and fifth days); pelvic symptoms increase; more weight and bearing down; more pain extending into the loins and down the thighs in front, with constriction of the sphincter (sixth day); symptoms of the pelvic region last the longest (seventh day), [44].
Great appetite, which, however, could not be freely indulged; a small quantity of food caused troublesome distension (second and third days), [17e].
Felt sleepy and must lie down; relief from lying down (after five hours and a half), [33].
Stitches and tearing in the anus, [1].
Stitches radiate at intervals from the region of upper abdomen, just under the pit of stomach, obliquely up into left side, [2].
Headache, as if beaten and torn, on coughing, [1].
Sensation as if drops came from the bladder (which was not the case), particularly when at rest, [1].
Tired pain in the small of the back, [1].
Sharp pains in each ovary and pressure to pass water; the pains ceased after passing water; later in the day a dull heavy pain in left ovary (first day), [22].
Griping in the abdomen almost every morning, for one hour, with nausea, qualmishness, and accumulation of saliva in the mouth, [1].
Much mucus on the soft palate, [1].
In the afternoon, for two hours, heat on the forehead and drawing in the thighs, like a fever, [1].
Drawing toothache if anything hot or cold is taken in the mouth, [1].
After dinner, several fine stitches in the right concha (fifth day), [25a].
Coryza and great lachrymation, [56].
Shooting pain from the lumbar region to the left lung (seventh day), [20].
Discharge of blood with every stool for eight days, [1].
Eyelids heavy, with much frontal pain, [9].
Vertigo, only when walking in the open air, she must be led, [1].
Pain in the tendons at the ankle, as if too short, when walking, [1].
Nausea and weakness, [1].

Beating in the pit of the stomach, in the morning, then ebullition in the chest, like palpitation of the heart, followed by burning heat of face and body, without perceptible outward heat or redness, without thirst, but with some sweat, [1].
Stitches in the left scapula, [1].
Hot, oppressed, and anxious from tobacco-smoking, to which he was accustomed, [1].
Dull pain in the small of the back; tired feeling in the back; on sitting down he had to sit very straight (second day), [36].
I am not drowsy this time, as I usually am, during the menses), (eighteenth day), [20].
Jerking of the head backward, in the morning when rising, [1].
4 P.M., I have a singular sensation about the pelvic region, a sort of weakness about the small of the back, pubic bones, and around the anus a dragging pain (third day), [37].
*The vertex is very sensitive when touched, and when not, [3].
Headache in the forenoon, as if the brain were crushed, [1].
Burning in the point of the tongue (soon), [29].
The left jaw very little painful (two hundred and eighty-fourth day), [45b].
Disgust for tobacco after smoking, [29a].
Pressure in the throat in the region of the tonsils, as if the neckcloth were tied too tight, [1].
Stitches transversely through the abdomen, just over the hips, [1].
Intermission of the beats of the heart, after dinner, [1].
Pain in the small of the back, when walking in the afternoon (after five days), [1].
Arthritic drawing in the knees, [1].
Drawing pains in the corns, in the evening, [1].
Moderate appetite, yet by no means for meat, towards which he has had an aversion for many days, [1].
Burning constrictive pain in the shoulders, chest, and throat, evenings, [1].
Left commissure of mouth again painful (first day), [17b].
No appetite, nothing tastes good to her, [1].
Pains shooting through the right eye, and through the head generally, [64].
All parts of the body on which she lies or sits are painful, [1].
Sour taste in the mouth, in the morning on waking, [1].
Itching on the scalp (two hundred and forty-third day), [45b].
Drawing cold feeling in single upper incisors, [1].
Dull, stupid, sleepy, confused feeling through the head (fifth day), [26].
Right eye much inflamed; great burning and lachrymation of the eyes, [11].
Tenderness of the upper lip after rising (second day), [45a].
*In the morning slight frontal headache (fourth day); in the morning aching in the forehead (fifth day), [22c].
*Vertigo, like reeling, while walking, [1].
Bleeding of the hæmorrhoids, when walking, [1].
Pain superiorly on the vertex on chewing, coughing, and blowing the nose, [1].
Tingling in the feet (after four days), [1].
Very tired and sleepy during the day, yet at night he sleeps well, [1].
Shooting pain, beginning in the cervix and passing up to the fundus uteri, and thence to the right ovary; pain is so severe that it causes nausea (thirty-fourth day), [21].
Stupid and dizzy feeling in the head, so that frequently he does not know what he is doing, [1].
Prolapsus recti (after thirty days), (Rl.).
Crackling before the ears, as from the rattling of papers, [1].

All day long an almost constant desire to blow the nose, though no mucus was present in its front part. The mucus remains sticking in the nasal passage; it is uncommonly viscid, and it is only after great exertion, in the way of blowing, that it comes away in the form of long narrow pieces, which interrupt the free passage of air through the nostrils (twenty-seventh day), [21].
General improvement, [43].
Diminished number of erections (curative effect), (first days), [1].
*Sensation of heaviness in the crown, [1].
About 8 P.M., great flow of sweetish saliva into the mouth (forty-eighth day), [29].
Stoppage of the nose, violent sneezing (twentieth day); coryza continues (twenty-second and twenty-third days); diminished (twenty-fourth day), [34].
Soon after dinner, great flow of saliva into the mouth, and sudden softly digging pain in the right parotid gland (fifth day), [25a].
Sick and feverish all day, with thirst, [9].
Acrid smarting on the forepart of the tongue (after thirty-two hours), [2].
Stitches from within outward at the forehead, so that he must hold it with the hand, on coughing, [1].
Chilliness, with shivering, repeated two or three times (within a minute), [15].
Vertigo, every afternoon from 3 to 5 o'clock, everything turns in a circle around her, when walking, sitting, and lying, [1].
Small severely itching pustule on the occiput toward the nape of the neck, which became an ulcer of an inch in length, with rough scabs beneath, which for a long time was moist, [1].
Frequent short paroxysms of coryza, [1].
Disagreeable taste in the mouth, in the morning (immediately, second day), [40].
Pinching pains in the testicle (first and second days), [1].
Black flies seem to float not far from the eyes (after twelve hours), [1].
*Heaviness in the head (fifteenth and seventeenth days), [34a].
Much itching in the eyebrows, and in the tip of the nose, [1].
Swelling of the inner part of the gums, [1].
Dreamed that I saw a spectre outside of the window of the room where I was, and was alarmed thereat (sixth night), [15].
Stitches from within outward in the forehead on every step, all day; also on loud talking and coughing he is obliged to wrinkle the forehead, [1].
Soon tired, for five days (third day after last dose), [16].
Intermittent slight tearing, low down in the left side of occiput, near the neck, [1].
Reddish herpetic spots above the hips, [1].
A roundish bright-red spot on ball of right hand, with violent itching, not relieved by scratching, evening, [2].
Coryza, with diarrhœic stool, [1].
Sensation in the right eye, as if a foreign body were in it, which compels him repeatedly to rub and wipe the eye, in the afternoon (thirty-fifth day), [45a].
Complete loss of appetite; he desires only acids, [1].
Violent coryza, with rawness in the chest, and cough, with much expectoration, [1].
Sore pain of the tongue (after seventeen days), [1].
Distressing stopped sensation in both ears, for many days, [1].
Pressive contractive pain in the top of the head (the first days), [1].
The mammæ have felt sore, like boils, if touched, all day (third day), [21].
Voluptuous itching in the left groin, in the evening in bed, unbearably increased by rubbing, but quickly removed by slight tickling with the tips of the fingers, [1].
Arrests breathing when standing still, [1].
Alternate cold hands and feet (several days after ceasing to take the medicine), [29a].
Drawing in the occiput, [1].
Rheumatic pressure draws through the teeth and forehead in single jerks, [2].
Stitches in the temples, [1].
Lassitude in the limbs, with chilliness (third day), [1].
Paralytic sensation in the left arm, yet there is the proper mobility both in the arm and also in the fingers, [1].

Sensation of fulness in the left axillary gland, in a few minutes leaving the left and appearing in the right axilla (after one hour and a half); the sense of fulness returned about from 1 to 2 P.M., first in the left, then in the right axilla, then to the groin, during lecture; in the evening an occasional soreness in the axilla (fourth day); axillary glands still somewhat sore (twelfth and thirteenth days), [30].
The hæmorrhoids seem indurated, [1].
Chilliness, commencing in the throat, three or four times, in the evening, for five days (third day after last dose), [16].
Swelling and redness of the eyes, with pimples on the lids, [1].
Tension at the anus after stool, [1].
The lips become so dry in speaking that they are quite rough, and cause a disagreeable feeling of rubbing (sixteenth day), [45].
Burning pain to the left and below the navel, [2].
Drawing pressure under the right scapula, at one time more in the back, then again in the side, especially felt when siting with the arm held out free from the body, [2].
Drawing in the corns, the whole night, [1].
Eructation after eating but little, [1].
Tearing under the nail of the right index finger, [2].
Violent itching in the outer canthus of the left eye, with sore pain after rubbing it, [2].
Profuse general nightsweat, from evening till morning, [1].
Violent toothache, [7a].
The ankle joint pains, after walking in the open air, as if compressed, [1].

Bowels moved three times (thirty-first day); natural stool (thirty-second day); no stool (thirty-third day); bowels moved twice (thirty-eighth day); painful urging to stool, which was hard and in lumps, and considerable bleeding from the rectum after stool, at 6 A.M.; bowels moved freely and without pain, at 7 P.M.; moved quite freely at 10 P.M. (forty-fifth day); two stools (fifty-third day); one stool (fifty-fourth day); at 6.30 A.M. and 8 A.M. (sixty-second day); three stools (sixty-eighth day); two stools (eightieth day), [21].

Aching in the vertex, increased in the open air, where it became very teasing, towards noon; after dinner, increased to the feeling as if a heavy weight lay on it; this pain lasted all day in a minor degree, and did not go off till evening (eighteenth day), [45].
Pressing in the vertex (twenty-third day), [20].
Bruised pain in the knee and tibia, more when sitting than walking, [1].
Severe cough, with little expectoration, but mostly with bitter vomiting, yet only evenings, when lying in bed, [1].
Two stools and always with some tenesmus, [1].

Urine, average quantity, 28 ounces; average sp. gr. 1022, fortieth to twentieth day before the proving; average quantity 30 2/3 ounces; average sp. gr. 1022 (for five days before the proving); 20 ounces, sp. gr. 1027, on standing it grew cloudy and deposited a white sediment (first day); 23 ounces, sp. gr. 1022 (second day); 24 ounces, sp. gr. 1024, clear, no sediment (third day); 23 ounces, sp. gr. 1021 (fourth day); 24 ounces, sp. gr. 1024 (fifth day); 26 ounces, sp. gr. 1024 (after Sepia 30, sixth day); 19 ounces, sp. gr. 1028; on standing, a brickdust sediment, and vessel covered with white substance and looking like ground glass (seventh day); 19 ounces, sp. gr. 1027; bad odor; red deposit of a deeper color; smarting in the urethra while urinating (eighth day); 22 ounces, sp. gr. 1023; no sediment (ninth day); 24 ounces, sp. gr. 1022 (tenth day); 28 ounces; sp. gr. 1022 (eleventh day); 31 ounces, sp. gr. 1021; no sediment; looks healthy (twelfth day); at noon, passed urine which was clear; sp. gr. 1026; on standing four hours it deposited a brickdust sediment, and the walls of the glass were coated white; at 9 P.M., urine showed sp. gr. 1034, and was flocky when voided, and on standing two hours there was a dark brickdust deposit, and the sides of the vessel were thickly coated with a white substance (thirteenth day), [45].
Tearing stitches between the patella and knee-joint, [1].
Throat dry, worse evening (nineteenth day), [20].
Dull aching pains in region of kidneys and small of back (thirty-second day), [38].
Frightful dream; she screams aloud at night, [1].
Flushes then chills, [9].
Stitches and cutting in the hollow of the knee, [1].
Feeling as of a painful sore at the tip of the nose; this sore came out afterwards like an eruption, but within two days it quite disappeared, [9].

On the right anterior border of the tongue, a hard raised spot the size of a lentil; on moving the tongue, shooting pain in it (eighth day); the swelling and pains in the tongue were greatly diminished, and the following day were quite gone (ninth day), [26].
In the evening, after walking in the cold wind, I had a sore, rough, burning feeling in my eyes, aggravated by gaslight and on attempting to read (second day), [30].
Excessive vertigo, in the morning on rising; as soon as he attempts to stand he falls back upon the bed, only disappearing after half an hour (tenth day), [1].
Pains like knives shooting through the uterus spasmodically, [10].
Inclination to sneeze, that shook her almost spasmodically, [3].
The arms go to sleep, even to the hands, particularly painful when they lie under the covers, in which case there is also a painful stiffness in them, [1].

Tearing in the head, mostly in the sides and forehead, at times with drawing and sticking and ulcerating pain, and especially relieved or removed by moving the head, by pressing upon it, and by free air, [3].
In two hours, dull aching in the whole right half of the brain (first day), [25f].
*Pain, as if the brain were beating against the skull, always on nodding the head, [1].
Smarting of the eyes, with a feeling as if they watered, [1].
Frequent attacks of cutting pains in the abdomen; she must draw herself quite together for a couple of minutes, [1].
*Shooting pain in the temples, close to the eyes, on moving them or on looking at anything (third day), [31].
Shaking of the brain, from striking the foot against anything, [1].
Pain in the occiput, mostly at night, and worse when lying on it, as if hollow and as if ulcerated, both externally and internally, relieved by pressure with the hand, [1].
Very sensitive to cold north wind, [1].
Before going to sleep, shooting pain in the upper border of the left orbit (first day), [33a].
*Beating of the brain against the skull on moving the head, with pressive pain, [1].
She feels the beating of pulse in the head and all the limbs, day and night, but more at night, [1].
When chewing it seems as if the jaws could not be opened, and as if the joint would crack, [1].
Jerking of the leg when falling asleep, [1].
Uneasiness in the abdomen, as if diarrhœa would set in, passing off from emission of flatus, [1].
Hard stool, fæces covered with slime, at 6 P.M., followed by slimy, bilious, or catarrhal stool, at 8 P.M., and again at 11 P.M. (second day), [23].
Copious sweat of the male genitals (after three days), [1].
Otalgia (after twenty-four days), [1].
Dull feeling in the head with the pelvic distress (sixteenth day), [20].
Itching on the borders of the eyelids (eighth day), [44b].

Roughness of both cheeks, heat and burning in them, and sensation as if they had been exposed for several days to a severe cold; this lasted several days, and was followed by a branlike desquamation, which also lasted several days (twenty-third day), [28c].
Aching pain across the loins, worse on moving, [9].
In the morning on awaking, clammy taste (third day); in the morning after awaking, taste clammy and insipid (fourth and fifth days), [29a].
Obscuration of vision, while reading, [1].
Accumulation of much mucus in the larynx, which is difficult to cough up, but easy to swallow, even with deep inspiration (after twenty-four hours), [1].
Dreams frightful, of murder (sixteenth night), [20].
The right eye feels very weak, water runs from it when looking at anything for a few seconds, [66].
Digging pain in the eyeball (twenty-sixth day), [30].
Taste in the mouth sweet as sugar, [1].
Complexion pallid (fifth day), [31].
Appetite for only soft food, not for bread or meat, [1].
Dryness of the mouth, throat, and tongue, which in the morning were quite rough, [1].
Pressure in the lower part of the abdomen, to the left of the navel, and at times quite in the left side, [2].
Before the menses, burning in the pudendum, [1].
*Pressure in the head from one temple to the other, in the morning after rising, [1].
Bitter taste in the palate and throat, in the morning on waking, relieved by coughing up mucus, [1].
Much weakness in the lower limbs, [1].
Burning in the rectum, daily, with hard stools, intermingled with unsuccessful desire for stool (first days), [1].
Painful sensation of hunger in the stomach, [1].
*Vertigo on stooping, [1].
Biting, as from blisters, on the tongue, [1].
*Tearing in the forehead, [1].
Profuse sweat during exercise, smelling almost like elder blossoms, [1].
Dirty, thinly coated tongue, in the forenoon (second day), [30].
Occasional sharp shooting pains in the eyeballs, during the day (eighteenth day), [20].

After heat, redness and puffiness of the face, which lasted two hours, and during a following paleness of the face, lasting many hours, an inability to urinate of fourteen hours' duration, followed by the desire to urinate every one-fourth hour, with scanty discharge; these periods of retention and urging to urinate recurred several times; the last of these retention lasted twenty hours, notwithstanding much drinking (first day), [1].
While walking, vertigo like an obscuration before the eyes, a reeling to the left side, lasting a few minutes, [1].
Stitches in the right side, when walking in the open air, [1].
Aching in the right eye, and sometimes a feeling as if the eyeballs were swollen, during the forenoon (eighth day), [44d].
Dryness in the fauces (after eleven days), [1].
*Sensation of heaviness in the head, and dulness, as if he would fall forward, relieved while walking, but then a fine sticking in the head, [3].
Tickling in the palate, posteriorly (thirty-second day), [18a].
Stool of whitish color (third day), [1].
Heat in the hands, in daytime, during mental excitement, [1].
Swelling of the upper lid and dry matter in the lashes, [1].
Nightsweat from above downwards, to the middle of the calves, [1].
Hungry feeling in the stomach, very soon after meals (two hours), (third day), [40a].
Very severe pressure in the chest, when not touched, [1].
*Headache, as from a weight pressing upon the top of the brain, and as from a cord around the head, [1].
Stitches and burning at the anus, [1].
In the morning on awaking, and after dinner, aching and sore pain in the gums of the lower jaw, on the right side (ninety-eighth day), [45b].

All the time I had violent palpitation of the heart, as though it would force its way through the thoracic wall; this was relieved by walking a long distance and walking very fast (second day); return of palpitation (fourth day); severe palpitation (thirty-sixth day); less severe (thirty-seventh day); another attack of palpitation (seventy-second and seventy-third days), [21].
Violent beating in the head and sensation as if the head were in motion, in the evening in bed, [1].

When lifting, sudden shoot into the small of back, like a stitch, so that he dared not move on account of the great pain; he had to walk bent forward, and had severe stitches if he struck the foot against anything, [1].
Lips cracked, [1].
Stitches in the penis, [1].
Nightly toothache, on account of which she could not sleep, and in the morning when it ceased, she was so agitated, that notwithstanding great weakness, she could not go to sleep, [1].
She becomes paralyzed from vexation, [1].
Stitching pain at the tip of the nose when touching it, as if a pointed hair were pricking it, [1].
A kind of creeping feeling occasionally felt in the head, especially on the parietal and occipital regions (one hundred and eleventh day), [45b].
Dryness of the mouth, and taste of blood, [1].
Violent tearing in the lower right ribs, [2].
Menses six days too early (after four days), [1].
Slight but shifting toothache (twenty-second day), [20].
Fluttering noises in the ear, [1].
Skin seems tender; the least scratch heals slowly (twenty-fourth day), [20].
Gnawing in the bones in front of the left ear; also on swallowing, [3].
Griping in the lower abdomen the whole day, in quarter-hour attacks, with hard stool daily, three days in succession (after forty-eight hours), [1].
Numbness of the fingers of right hand, evening, [1].
Swelling and some redness of the right upper eyelid, in the morning, [2].
Pressure in the eyes at night (after two days), [1].
Pain in the shoulder, which was higher than the other from disease, also when touching it, [5].

About 11 A.M., while writing, the feet became very cold, afterwards the whole body, accompanied with shaking chill; he had to lie down, then became warm, and at 4 A.M., hot, with disposition to sweat, having had a slight sweat during the night over the whole body (ninth day), [1].
Panaritium on left index finger with severe beating and stitching in it (after twenty-three days), [1].
After coition discharge of blood from the vagina, [1].
Fulness in the bladder, as if it would fall over the os pubis (twenty-ninth day), [20].
Pressure on the bladder, in the morning, and urging to urinate, urine passing only after waiting several minutes, [1].
Tearing in the knee and elbow-joints (after sixteen days), [1].
Discharge of blood with the stool (after eleven and twenty days), [1].
Lame feeling in the knee-joints (seventh day), [38].
Pressive weight in the head, in the temples above the forehead, as if the head were too full of blood, as during a severe chill, [1].
Stitches in both sides of the upper abdomen, when coughing, [1].
Much perspiration, sometimes hot, sometimes cold, particularly in the hands and feet; constant disposition to sweat, both night and day, [8].
*Tenderness of the head at the crown (fourth day), [45c].
Headache, most severe towards evening, particularly when shaking the head, [1].
Pressing-digging itching headache, with stiff neck and sensitiveness of the head to touch, [1].
Noises in the right ear, [3].
In the morning he blew some blood-streaked mucus from the nose (thirteenth day), [28].
Eyes sunken, surrounded by blue rings, [1].
Slight sweat, in the morning, after awaking, [1].
After a thin stool, smarting sensation in the abdomen, [1].
At noon, for half an hour, great itching of the left eye, with lachrymation (ninetieth day), [45b].
Inflammation of the throat, [1].
Feverish shivering, even of the head, with icy-cold hands, yawning and great weakness, [5].
Flow of water into the mouth (in half an hour, first and second days), [35b].
Heat in the mouth, and much thirst, at night, [1].
Noises in the abdomen, [1].
Suffused look of the eyes, in the morning when awaking, with smarting in the canthi, [2].
Stitches from the navel to the pudendum, when coughing and gagging, [1].
Constipated, [19].
Empty feeling in the head, in the morning (forty-eighth day), [29].
Redness of the white of the eyes (after seventeen days), [1].

Feeling of bearing down of all the pelvic organs (second and fourth days); weight and bearing down (fifth and sixth days); some bearing down (seventh and eighth days); on rising, in the morning, with the leucorrhœa (ninth day); some pressure and bearing down after rising (tenth, eleventh, and thirteenth days), [44].
Pain in the head and abdomen, on coughing, [1].
In the morning dryness of lips, the mucous membrane of which lies in folds; aridity of the commissures of the mouth, which are covered with small whitish scales (fifteenth day), [29].
Pain constantly between the shoulders and down the back (after second day), [23].

Menstruation regular, but scanty, and the flow dark (before the proving). Menses came on (second day); on stepping out of bed I was taken unwell, the blood running down to my feet; flowed freely all day (twentieth day); flowed all day and felt badly (twenty-first day), [22].
Giddiness in the head, she can scarcely carry it, [1].
Profuse sweat on waking, at 5.30 A.M.; afterwards, on walking, even against cold winds (twenty-fifth day), [20].
Colic, in the morning, quite low down in the pelvis, pressing outward, twisting and contractive, [3].
Sharp stitching pain passing up the vagina into the body of the uterus, somewhat relieved when bending double (eleventh day), [21].
Many dull stitches in the anus in succession, [2].
On lying down, at 11 P.M., six sharp stitches in the left temple, three of which were very severe and painful, at short and equal intervals (seventh day), [38].
Heat and redness of the ears, [5].
Foul taste in the mouth as from an old catarrh, [1].
Inclination to sigh (after two days), [28].
Stitching in the dorsum of foot, especially painful when walking on the pavement, [1].
Symptoms of threatened catarrh (fourteenth day); symptoms at height (fifteenth day); catarrh declined (sixteenth day), [16].
Emissions weak and watery, [5].
Frequent hard distension of the abdomen, with cutting in the bowels, [1].
Tongue thickly furred with a dirty-yellow coating (fourteenth day); thickly furred tongue, morning, noon, and evening (twenty-seventh day); in the forenoon, tongue furred (thirty-first day), [29].
Swelling of the gum about an old stump, [1].
Single jerks in the teeth, day and night, when a draft of wind gets into the mouth or ear, followed by a grumbling, causing restlessness, [1].
Stitches in the elbow-joint, [1].
During eructations, in the morning, griping in stomach, as if something would tear loose, [1].

During the day two pimples again appeared, one on the vertex, the other posteriorly about the nape (sixty-first day); a painful pimple on the vertex (ninety-fifth day); on the vertex some small elevations of the scalp, quite free from pain (one hundred and seventh day); several small pimples on the vertex (one hundred and twenty-third day); a small painful pimple on the vertex (one hundred and thirty-third day); a painful pimple on the middle of the vertex (one hundred and thirty-fourth day); a small painful pimple on the middle of the vertex (two hundred and thirty-fourth day); a painful pimple on the vertex, in the evening (two hundred and forty-fourth day); the pimple on the vertex gone, but in place of it there appears on the same spot several not very tender elevations the size of a hemp-seed (two hundred and forty-fifth day); elevations gone (two hundred and forty-sixth day), [45b].
Pain in almost all the teeth, during dinner, [1].

Bloated feeling of the abdomen coming on about fifteen minutes after eating, and lasting half an hour, at 8 P.M. (fifth day); constant feeling of distension, coming on shortly after eating, especially supper; this symptom was noticed throughout the proving, [26].
Blood-streaked expectoration after a meal, [1].
Throat, nose, and all raw, as if skinned (fourth day), [37].
*Pressive pain in the forehead, mostly in the forenoon, [1].
Severe stitches in the anus, particularly when drawing the anus inwards and from external pressure, [1].
Toothache and throbbing in the gums during the menses, [1].
No appetite, [8].
Fetid odor of the (generally sweaty) feet, [1].
Bitter taste in the mouth, only when clearing the throat, [1].
Pain in the whole head on external pressure; for example, by a tight hat, [1].
Jerking of either of the limbs, when moving them, [1].
Burning in the upper lip and the edges of the lids, in the morning after rising (fourth day), [45].
Repeated severe vomiting, at night, with violent headache (after twelve hours), [1].
Difficult deglutition; the muscles of deglutition seem paralyzed, for several evenings (after thirty-six days), [1].
Rush of blood to the head (after five days), [1].
Great heat, one day, right around lower ribs, with fever, but a moist sweat around body, [19].
Very sleepy, inclined to sleep at any time (after seven days), [16].
On blowing my nose, I notice blood mixed with mucus (eighth day), [37].
After a papescent stool, headache, [1].
Smarting pain in both eyes, [1].
Waked several times during the night; restless during the night (second night), [36].
Head stupefied (eighty-third day), [45a].

One sharp darting pain in the right ovarian region, (seventeenth day); pain in the right ovarian region, as of a thread running downward to the uterus and drawn tightly (eighteenth day); pain in right ovary; the dull ovarian pain is sharper on inspiration (nineteenth day); pain in right ovary, worse in the afternoon (twentieth day); dull pain in the right ovary, with occasional sharp shooting pains (twenty-second day); steady pain in the right ovarian region and backache (twenty-third day); pain in right ovary, soreness on pressure after sleep, in afternoon. Felt too badly to move (twenty-fourth day), [20].
Violent pressure under the left ribs, passing off from lying down, [1].
Very viscid nasal mucus (after twenty-four hours), [1].
Sexual thoughts, without erections (fourth day), [1].
Feel better when out of doors (third day), [37].
Lies quiet before midnight, without sleep, [1].
Sleep sound, yet with many vivid dreams, [3].
In the forenoon, smarting in the nose and left eyelid (fifth day), [42a].
Violent stitches in the region of the liver, in the evening, for eight minutes, painful also from touch, with constipation, [1].
Boring pressing in the teeth and on the head externally for only a few minutes after eating, [1].
Much footsweat of intolerable smell; the toes become sore, [1].

Itching in the right eye (second day); during the day prickling, itching, and smarting in the eyelids (third day); in the morning, after awaking, eyelids gummed together, and a feeling as if fine sand were in the eyes (fourth day), [36b].
Dimness of vision, in the forenoon (first day); all the forenoon, unusual weakness and dimness of the eyes, followed by frequent dry tussiculation (third day), [25a].
Pain, as from subcutaneous ulceration, in the external auditory meatus, when putting the finger in it, [1].
Wine-red spots on the neck and under the chin, without sensation, [5].
Undulating pressure in the inguinal canal, from within outwards, [2].
Very warm and oppressed, evenings, [1].
Tension in the knee when walking in the open air, [1].
Flashes of heat all over the body, about 8.30 P.M. (twenty-seventh day), [38].
Colic from the navel to the pudendum, mostly when touching the abdomen, [1].
Dryness of the lips, [1].
Pain in back and sacrum (eleventh day), [44a].
The hæmorrhoids become painful (after two hours), [1].
Left eye ached very badly this afternoon; pain ceased in the evening, then came a feeling as if the head was stuffed (third day), [35].
Cracking in the knee-joints, [1].
Inflammation of the eyes, which cannot endure cold water, [1].
Drawing pain in a sound tooth, when the air got into the tooth, not when in the cold air, [1].
Pinching pain in the bladder, [1].
Pressure in the eyebrows and balls, [1].
At 11.30 A.M., occasional violent shooting in the right cheek-bone (sixth day), [37a].

Aching at the root of the nose (twenty-fifth day); at noon, very troublesome aching pain in the nasal bones (one hundred and twelfth day); during the day, severe aching in the nasal bones (one hundred and thirteenth day); at noon, very severe aching in the nasal bones, and creeping in both temples (one hundred and fourteenth day); during the day, a disagreeable feeling of aching and fulness in the nose, one of the nasal bones was thickened and swollen (one hundred and seventeenth day); in the morning, severe aching in the nasal bones, and dry feeling in the nose. The aching in the nasal bones went off in the forenoon, but recurred at noon in great intensity and went away again in an hour (one hundred and eighteenth day); at noon, severe aching in the nasal bones and dry feeling in the nose, though a drop or two of fluid occasionally escapes unobserved from the nostrils (one hundred and nineteenth day); occasional severe aching in the nasal bones, in the forenoon (one hundred and twentieth day); during breakfast, very violent aching in the nose; the pain extended into the frontal sinus, but did not last long (one hundred and twenty-second day); occasional aching pain in the nasal bones (one hundred and twenty-fourth day); frequent aching pain in the nasal bones, in the forenoon (one hundred and twenty-seventh day); dry feeling and aching in the superior nasal passages (one hundred and twenty-eighth day); towards noon, quite severe aching in the nasal passages (one hundred and thirtieth day); frequently recurring, but always transitory sensation of soreness in the nose (one hundred and thirty-second day); occasional aching in the nasal bones (one hundred and thirty-third day); in the nose, very tiresome aching and feeling of dryness (one hundred and thirty-third day); aching in the nose, at noon (one hundred and thirty-fourth day); occasional tiresome aching in the nose (one hundred and thirty-fifth day); during the day repeated aching at the root of the nose (one hundred and thirty-sixth day); towards noon, tiresome aching in the root of the nose (one hundred and thirty-eighth day); tiresome aching in the bones of the nose, at noon (two hundred and seventh day); aching pain in the root of the nose, in the evening (two hundred and thirty-sixth day); frequent aching pain in the root of the nose throughout the day (two hundred and thirty-seventh day); aching at the root of the nose (two hundred and thirty-eighth day); aching pain in the nose, at noon (two hundred and forty-eighth day); in the forenoon, very severe aching pain in the nose about its root, with dryness of the Schneiderian membrane (two hundred and fifty-eighth day), [45b].
*Throbbing in the head, in the morning, [1].
Disagreeable cold feeling in the lower front teeth, [1].
Much yawning noon and afternoon, after taking a walk, [1].
Sensation of a plug in the throat, when swallowing, in the evening, [1].
A white vesicle in the white of the eye, close to the cornea, [1].
Three thin acrid stools per day, followed by protrusion of the hæmorrhoids, from which ooze a moisture, and which when sitting are exceedingly painful (after twelve days), [1].
Very disagreeable resinous taste in the mouth (fifty-fifth day), [45a].

Fine stitching pains from the scapula through the ribs, on the right side of the back, coming on with and lasting only during each inspiration, the same in all positions; only relieved when walking in the open air, [1].
Twitching on the tongue, [1].
Alternating stitches and griping pain in the intestines, in attacks lasting about ten minutes, [1].
Heaviness in all the limbs, [1], [7a].
Slight pain in the region of the transverse colon, and the bowels moved (after twelve hours); still have pain in region of transverse colon (second day), [24].
The teeth feel loose on biting, and on eating feel paralyzed, [1].
Constant dull heavy pain in sacrum and abdomen, extending to thighs and legs (ninth day); some pain in sacrum and hips, not severe, in the afternoon (tenth day), [44a].
Sensation of a load in the abdomen, during motion, [1].
Sense of smell more acute than usual (eighteenth day); increased acuteness (twenty-third day), [20].
Weakness of right wrist, when using the hand (fifth day), [36].
Crampy pain in the bones of the face, [1].
Woke at 7 A.M. with darting-pressing pain in the right eye, lasting about fifteen minutes, when it ceased in the right eye and appeared in the left eye (second day), [31].
Cough, in the evening, before going to sleep, from 8 to 9 o'clock, continually, until she expectorates, then the cough stops, [1].
The headache is better when lying down near an open window (three days after last dose), [16].
Cough, which affects the chest and stomach greatly, [1].
Twitching of the lips, [1].
Soreness and pain in the back, in sacral region (first and second days), [44a].
Jerking in the nape of the neck, with shaking of the head, [1].
Tearing in the left maxillary articulation, just in front of the ear, [2].

Tearing in the arms from the wrist to the shoulder, so that he could scarcely move the arm on account of pain; when letting it hang down it became blue and rigid; pains mostly at night, less during the day and when at rest, [1].
Have had a sense of nausea all the morning, with no desire for food; think I will not dine to-day (sixth day), [37].
*Pressure in the temples and tension in the brain, on reflecting and on mental work, [1].
Smarting of the eyes, in the evening; the candlelight seems to be a red ring, wherewith he cannot see, [1].
Old symptoms reappear, towards evening (ninth day), [38].

During lecture, my eyes felt as if they would draw within themselves, and the lecturer seemed to be receding from my vision very slowly, and seemed to be a great distance from me; I tried to dispel it by rubbing my eyes, but that had no effect; it ended in nausea; at 11 A.M. (tenth day); same condition of eyes; it makes me very nervous (eleventh day), [21].
Wings of the nose inflamed, swollen, [1].
Very salt tasting expectoration from chest, [1].
Mouth dry, [76].
Troubled with eructations of offensive sour-smelling gases, for five days (after three days), [23].
Looks ill (twelfth day), [34]; (sixth day), [45c].
Dull headache every morning, yet only after rising from bed, [1].
Pain, as if sprained, in the small of the back, over the hips, in the evening in bed and afternoons (after twelve days), [1].
Little appetite, yet he relishes what he eats, [1].
Drawing through the forehead and temples very acute, as though a worm were crawling through it (first day), [1].
Severe itching in the right ear, with moisture in it, at night, [1].
Looks ill; has double rings around the eyes (two hundred and seventy-eighth day), [45b].

In the evening, contractive pain in the forehead and temples (twenty-sixth day); dull aching in the forehead (in a quarter of an hour, thirty-seventh day); contraction and pressing in the forehead (forty-seventh day); aching in the forehead (forty-eighth day); in one hour, in the frontal bone a painful aching, which extended across the nasal bones and both malar bones (fiftieth and fifty-first days), [29].
Hypersensitiveness of the auditory nerves in one who hears with difficulty, so that playing the piano causes nausea, [1].
Appetite uncommonly good (fifteenth day), [43].
Frequent awaking at night, on account of drawing pain, extending from the molar teeth to the forehead, [1].
Blisters on the hard palate, which prevent talking and eating, [1].
Sore pain in the tibia, only during motion, [1].
Dull aching frontal headache (left side), (fifth day), [36].
Inclination to cold feet, [1].
Chilliness, with thirst, towards evening, followed by nightsweat, [1].
Large blisters on the right thumb, with itching, [1].
The distress was all relieved on eating supper (ninth day), [20].
I noticed a peculiar quite unpleasant exhalation from the body after getting warm in bed (twenty-seventh day), [38].
Uterine pains very severe; the uterus feels as if clutched and then suddenly released, causing nausea, at 7 P.M. (sixth day), [21].
Febrile excitement, immediately after dinner, [1].
Uneasiness in the whole body (after twenty-four hours), [1].
Violent shaking chill for one hour, then great heat, with inability to collect one's senses; then profuse sweat in the evening; the urine brown and of acrid smell (first day), [1].
The water accumulates in his mouth in large quantities, like waterbrash, but passes off after eating, [1].
Drawing in the upper molars, [2].
Pain in the outer canthus of both eyes (twelfth day), [15].
Short dry cough, which seems to come out of stomach, [19].
Leucorrhœa, like milk, only during the day, with burning pain and excoriation between the thighs, [1].
Tensive headache in the eyes only on raising them, several mornings in bed, on waking, [1].
Cough, from tickling in trachea, toward morning, without expectoration, [1].
Stitches through the bladder, a little while before urinating (sixth day), [21].
Dryness of the inner surface of the lids, [1].
Much oppression, particularly when walking, [1].
Lascivious dreams, with erections, disturbing his sleep at night, [11].
Severe rheumatic pains about the elbows and knees, when the eruption disappeared, [23].
A toe-nail, which had been crippled for years, suppurated, and in its stead a new and healthy nail formed, [1].
Pain in the eyes several times, with headache and heat in the eyes, [1].
Frequent fine burning stitches in different parts of the skin of the left upper eyelid, as if from fine sparks (seventh day), [25].
Constant feverish shivering with the noonday rest, [1].
In the evening, sudden drawing on the right side of the lower jaw (third day), [44].
It is hard for him to get up in the morning, as he has no desire to rise, [2].
Burning in the right flank, [2].
Itching in the left eye (second day), [20a].
Protrusion of a humid painless hæmorrhoid from the anus after a natural stool, [1].
Eructations, with efforts to vomit (after twenty-six hours), [1].
Itching on the eyeballs, [1].
Sleep at night disturbed, with pain in small of back (after twelve days), [1].
Pressive headache above the left eye, in the afternoon, [1].
Reappearance of menses which had been suppressed for four months (after eighteen days), [1].
Contractive pain in the anus and then forwards and upwards into the abdomen, during stool, [1].
The skin of the whole body pains as if sore, [1].
Noise like boiling water out at both ears, and frequent painful drawing in the right ear (first day), [25b].
Pimples on the dorsum of foot, itching severely, causing scratching until blood comes, [1].
After 11 A.M., frequent attacks of a dull headache, deep in the left side of the forehead when at rest and when moving, which sometimes increased to a drawing-throbbing pain (first day), [25b].
Restlessness will not permit her to sleep, [1].
*Vertigo, in the morning, with some nosebleed, [1].
Dark points and spots before the eyes, [1].
Herpes around the mouth, [1].
Fluent coryza, the mucus must be drawn through the posterior nares, [1].
Deafness in both ears, very transient (after nine days), [1].

With the burning heat in the throat, fulness and pressure in the head; this gradually increased into a severe frontal headache, more severe over the left orbit (second day); increased (third day); continued four or five days, [32].

Great distress in the stomach, it is sensitive to the pressure of the clothes, and there is an aching and throbbing, relieved by slight eructations; in the afternoon the distress is worse; it is sore and sensitive as a boil; even walking is painful from the jarring; this almost entirely ceases after supper; some flatulence in the evening (fifteenth day), [20].

During the menses she was obliged to remain in bed for two days, on account of an uneasiness in the body, drawing pain in lower limbs and in abdomen, with rumbling; on the second day, palpitation of the heart, for several hours in the forenoon, accompanied with dyspnœa (after nine days), [1].
He blows strings of blood from the nose, [1].
Aching in the small of the back (ninth and sixteenth days), [20].
Slept several afternoons (after two days), [1].
Chest a little sore, [19].
Eruption on the head, back, and shoulder; it itched badly during the evening and all night (fifth and sixth days), [22].
About 10 A.M., a pretty violent drawing in the left temple, which only lasted a short time (second day), [25f].
Increased appetite the whole first part of the proving, [3].
Teeth on edge, [1].
On clenching the fist, the last joints of the fingers feel sore; if pressed, they are quite painful (thirty-second day), [38].
Drawing pain in the left side of the face, as if in the skin, above the eye, on the temples, and on the malar bone as far as into the lobule of the ear, mostly in the morning, [1].
Pressive headache in the right side of the occiput, [2].
Pressure on the shoulder, at night, which felt as if it had gone to sleep and was sprained, [1].
General prostration and weariness in the joints, especially in the knees (fourth day), [36].
Orgasm of blood, with congestion of blood to head and chest (after sixteen days), [1].
Throbbing headache, in the evening, [1].
In the afternoon, itching, burning, and redness of the edges of the lids, and of the skin on the outside of the nose (twenty-fourth day), [29].
Feeling of tension in the neck (third day), [36].
Drawing in the arms from above downward, extending to the fingers (after twenty-four hours), [1].

In the morning some chilliness, then the whole day heat of the face and hands, with paleness of the face, without thirst and without sweat, together with pressing pain in the stomach and headache, when stooping, in the forenoon (after six days), [1].
