Itching in the rectum and anus, [1].
Intense itching of the skin, [10].
Uterus congested, and a yellowish leucorrhœa pouring from it; beginning to prolapse; slightly displaced (fortieth day), [22].
Vertigo, in the evening while standing, with rush of blood to the heart, [1].
The limbs from the knees downward ache badly during the afternoon (third day), [22].
Dulness of the whole head and unsteadiness of it, with tension of the muscles of the throat and back of the neck, [1].
In the morning, shooting in the tip of the tongue (immediately, second day), [40].
She felt best when at rest and while lying, [1].
Creeping in right ear, [1].
Bitter eructations, in the morning, on arising, with bitter taste in the mouth and throat, yet the food is relished, and after the meal the bitter taste is gone, [1].
Attacks of flushes of heat, as if hot water were poured on one, with redness of the face, sweat of the whole body, and anxiety, without thirst, yet without dryness of the throat, [1].
Anxiety in the limbs; he has no rest anywhere, [1].
Pressure in the pit of the stomach, passing off by a fermenting movement downwards (after three hours and a half), [2].
Spasmodic drawing in the jaws, [1].
Heaviness of the head, every, morning when rising, which is better after two hours, [1].

A painful spot in the red part of the upper lip, in the forenoon (first day); a small pustule on that spot; after this was opened and the matter discharged, it disappeared in a few days (second day), [45b].
Drawing tension, like cramps in the calves, from the malleoli to the knees, [1].
Dislike to the usual glass of beer, in the evening (seventeenth day), [40].
Dryness of the red of the lower lip, with scabs and tensive pain, [1].
Jerking in the lids, mostly in the afternoon, [2].
Pimple on the tip of the tongue and very sweet saliva, [1].
At 9 P.M., in the undecayed teeth of the left lower jaw, aching pains which last an hour (fourth and fifth days), [22b].
Very disagreeable taste, for an hour after breakfast (fifty-seventh day), [45a].
Diarrhœa after partaking of milk, [1].
Sensitiveness and burning in the eyes, for several days, [48].
Lower extremities go to sleep while sitting, [1].
Roughness and burning in fauces, which is aggravated by hawking, [1].
Tension and drawing in the left shoulder-joint, passing off when moving it, [2].
Sticking and burning in the outer canthi, with dimness of vision, in the evening, [3].
Pain in the nates, so that he can scarcely sit, [1].
Painful pressure on the upper part of both eyeballs, more frequent in the right, [2].
The canthi of the eyes red and inflamed, slightly adhesive, and exuding a little (fifteenth day), [29].
Mouth sweetish, and foul all day, [1].
The feet go to sleep, frequently when sitting, especially in the morning, [1].

Several pimples on cheeks and wrists, which are very sore, and of a pustular character at first, then resemble chicken-pox (sixth day); pimples still on cheeks (for ten weeks); pimples on cheeks just before and during menstruation (for three months); the pimples were attended by burning and soreness; when opened; pus and blood were discharged, and a small pit was left at the seat of the pimple, [24].
Pinching in the throat, from larynx upwards, [1].
Burning stitches in the heels wake her, several nights (after five days), [1].
Bitterness in the mouth, in the morning on waking, [1], [3].
Frequent itching, burning, and smarting in the canthi of the eyes, making him rub them (third day), [30].
General languid feeling of the whole body (fifth day), [35].
Itching on the crown of the head, with great falling out of the hair, [1].
Whirling and reeling, [1].
Stitches frequently in the left side of the head, in the afternoon, in the occiput in the evening, [1].
Aching-boring pains in the temples and ears (seventeenth day), [29].

Distress in the pelvis, with the sick feeling, at 9 A.M., increasing during the forenoon; waked from a nap, at 4 P.M., with the distress aggravated and feeling somewhat gloomy, but battling against it; after supper, at 6 P.M., all my bad feelings left me; at 9 P.M., the bearing-down feeling in the abdomen returned (second day). At 9 A.M., the dragging and pressing sensation in the abdomen returned; pressure as though the contents would issue through the genital organs; pressing outwards in the hypogastric region, as if the bladder would fall out over the os pubis, partially relieved by hard pressure (third day). The pelvic distress was noticeable through the whole night, at waking intervals, and relief only momentary by lying on either side with the legs flexed on the thighs and the thighs on the abdomen (third night). I waked this morning without the distress, but it returned on stirring, and increased before breakfast; distress in the hypogastric region through the day, as of overdistended bladder, that could not be endured; worse by continually sitting and lying; better on walking about; it disappeared on eating supper; better when walking in the open air (fourth day). Pressure downwards, as if the uterus would issue through the vulva; complete cessation of distress in uterus from supper to 9 P.M., when it returned (fifth day). A load or weight in the lower part of the abdomen, in the morning; at 9 A.M. suddenly ill, with the bearing-down feeling greatly increases in the abdomen; pelvic symptoms aggravated, at P.M., after sleep; the distress was relieved on eating supper, and returned at 9 P.M. (ninth day). The pelvic distress and bearing down have returned; they last all day, with dull feeling in the head and desire to sit or lie still with eyes closed; amelioration after supper; sick in my room from 9 A.M. to 6 P.M. (sixteenth day). Bearing-down sensation, with the menses (eighteenth day). Feeling of crowding and pressing downwards (nineteenth day). Downward pressure in abdomen; the only way in which I could fall asleep was by assuming the knee-elbow position for a time, causing slight eructation, relief, and sleep (twenty-first night). In the afternoon pressure in the uterus, as if everything would issue through the vulva (twenty-third day). Through the day, occasional bearing-down sensation in abdomen (twenty-seventh day). Pressing down in abdomen (twenty-ninth day), [20].
Coryza, which he formerly never had; he snuffles continually, [1].
Falls asleep late in the evening, [1].
Swelling of the inner mouth and gums, with burning in the mouth extending into the throat, [1].
Bitterish sour taste in the mouth (after five days), [1].
Burning of the eyes, with redness of the outer canthi and discharge of corrosive tears, [3].
A white spot before the eyes, on looking into the air, [1].
Stitches in the right side, in the morning, after a half sleep, [2].
The pains are renewed and increased during and immediately after a meal, [1].
Illusions of vision, as if her skin were yellow, [3].
Pain in the vertex, like a tingling, and pain beneath the right ribs from the (short) cough, [1].

Severe itching on the right side of the pubis, worse at night on going to bed; becoming moist after scratching, and forming a thin scale, easily pulled off (after a week); this eruption has nearly disappeared (after eighteen days), [39].
First a slight tickling in the left temple, then a sensation as if the skin were being drawn upwards, [2].
Vertigo, when she sees a large plain before her, [1].
Stiffness in the lower part of the back, so that he can only with difficulty straighten himself, [1].
Drawing in the left side of the lower jaw, in the morning after getting up (thirty-first day), [44f].
*In the evening, dull pain in the whole head, which lasted till late at night (fifth day), [24].
Plugs in the nose (twenty-third day), [20].
Stitches in the gums, [1].
Drawing in the crowns of the teeth, in the evening (eighth day), [44f].
In the evening, the gum around the stump of a tooth in the lower jaw, right side, is painful, as if a parulis were about to form; it went off before bedtime (ninety-ninth day), [45b].
Drawing-aching pains in the occiput to the nape, in the forenoon (one hundred and fifty-eighth day), [45b].
Palpitation of the heart, in the evening, for a quarter of an hour, [1].
Pain in the left side of the head this afternoon, over the left eye, worse in the evening; it kept me awake a long time after I went to bed (fourth day), [35].
Crawling in the nose, as in coryza, [1].
Symptoms still return, especially marked about 12 to 1 P.M., and 4 to 6 P.M. (forty-second day), [38].
The itching changes to burning, [1].
At 5 P.M., fluttering before the left ear (sixth day), [21].

*From time to time, painful pressing inward from the vertex superiorly deep into the brain, especially late in the evening and at night in bed; the pain compels wrinkling the forehead and drawing the eyes together, [1].
Stitching and tearing in the heels, day and night, more pain when treading on them than when at rest; they were pale and cold, and felt numb, [1].
Tongue rather white-furred (forty-third day), [22a].
Momentary stitches around the right lower ribs, towards the pit of the stomach, relieved by empty eructations, [2].
A transient slight attack of vertigo (after fifteen minutes), [18].
Pinching pain in one side of the head, in paroxysms, [1].
During the menses, severe pressure in the forehead, with discharge of hardened offensive matter from nose, [1].
Noise in the right ear, [1].
The eyes are painful to touch when closed, [1].
Pain in the back and in the sacrum, mostly between the lumbar region and the crista illi; more on the right side; a pulling or dragging; feeling strained when walking. -T. F. ALLEN.]
Painful feelings, as from a stiff body or a plug, in both sides of the abdomen, which renders stooping painful or impossible, [1].
Aching pains in the left frontal region on going upstairs (seventh day), [44a].
Swelling under the eyes, in the morning after awaking, [1].
Much sweat during sleep, particularly on the head, [1].
Inner surface of lower lip feels sore and is full of painful blisters (after seven days), [1].
Tearing and pressure in the left temple and eye, [1].
Stitches just beneath the pit of the stomach, during inspiration, [2].
Tearing in the lower part of the right foot (after eleven hours), [1].
Crawling or prickling stitches in the sole and under the toes, more during rest than during walking (after four days), [1].
He suddenly becomes averse to all sweets and to milk, [1].
Pain along the sole of the left foot to a point between the fourth and fifth toes (thirty-first day), [38].
Pressing sore pain in the lower cervical vertebræ, in the evening, while walking in the open air, [1].
At night, pressive pain in occiput (forty-fourth day), [22a].
Long unrefreshing sleep (after twenty-three days), [1].
Compression of the head, immediately after eating; every covering is oppressive, whether hat or cap, [1].
In the evening, twitching in the eyelids (second day), [20].
In the evening, headache, with several momentary attacks of oppression (ninth day), [15].
Face pale and collapsed, with an expression of great anxiety, [51].
A gurgling sound in the chest, [8].
Loss of appetite (fourteenth day), [16]; (ninth day), [22b]; (seventeenth and following days), [27]; (fourth day), [44a].
Pain in the tip of the nose, when touched, [1].
Stiffness of the nape of the neck, [1].
Whizzing and roaring in the ears, with sensation as if they were stopped, yet she can hear, [1].
Feeling of roughness in the mouth and throat (forty-third and forty-fifth days), [22a].
Frequent cracking in the ears, as if a string broke in them, [1].
Continuous stitches in the left chest, without any relation to the breathing, [1].
9.30 A.M., a slight but decided tingling in the urethra, for about an inch back from the head of the penis (fourth day), [40].
In the forenoon, drawing in the teeth, which recurred several times (tenth day), [44f].
Great thirst for beer, worse an hour after eating, [1].
Stitches from within outward in the forehead on loud talking and coughing, so that she was obliged to hold the forehead with the hand, for several days, mostly in the evening, [1].
Easy bleeding of the gums (fourteenth day), [34a].
Dragging feeling in the eyes (fifteenth day), [20].
Dull headache through both temples and forehead, with drooping of the eyelids, at 10 A.M. (third day), [21].
Inclination to vomit, anxiety, and vertigo, [1].
Burning pain above and beneath the eyebrows, every afternoon, [2].
Smarting in the right eye, in the evening, with inclination of the lids to close against one's wish, [1].
Dryness and soreness in throat; at night it feels quite parched, [11].
Shuddering with the pains, [1].
*Violent pressure in the forehead, [1].
Tearing in the right half of the face, [1].
Thirst, with dryness and agglutination of the mouth, [3].
Backache only when walking, arresting the breathing, [1].
Averse to motion, with desire to stretch, and very sleepy, on waking at 6 A.M.; dulness all day and aversion to motion (twenty-second day), [20].
Yellowness of the face and whites of the eyes, for one day, [1].
Chilliness, at 6 P.M.; he must lie down, [1].
Convulsive shooting in the tip of the tongue (twenty-first day), [40].
*Headache as from a board in front of the head, [1].
Itching in the face, on the arms, hands, back, hips, abdomen, and pubes (after two, twenty, twenty-three, and twenty-eight days), [1].
Swelling of the cheeks, with sticking pains, and also pain on touch, lasting eight days, [1].
Tearing in the first phalanx of the right index finger, [2].

About 8 P.M., tickling in the left nostril, immediately followed by the discharge of bright-red thickish blood, to the extent of about half a drachm, which contained a proportionately large quantity of sulphates (forty-eighth day), [2
After urinating at noon, discharge of milky moisture from the urethra, [1].
The right ear ached after midnight, after walking in the wind (eighteenth night); earache after midnight, with cold sensation over head (nineteenth night), [20].
Stitching pain in the stomach and in the distended abdomen, in the afternoon, [1].
Some dimness of sight (after some days), [6].
Great exhaustion and indolence, [7a].
Cough, day and night, pain therefrom in the pit of the stomach, [1].
Drawing pain in the knees, [2].
Twitching of both orbiculares palpebrarum, which was relieved by going into the open air (thirsty-sixth day); less severe (thirty-seventh day), [21].
Much matter in the eye, in the morning, for several days, [48].
Sensation of a plug in the throat, [1].
Quick pulse (100 to 110), at 3 P.M. (second day), [35].
Toothache in the open air, [1].
Violent formication in the abdomen, [2].
Supper relieved all the symptoms except dryness of the throat; sick all day until supper (twenty-fourth day), [20].
Slight frontal headache, passing around on the right side to the occiput, in the evening, [33].
Passed a great deal of flatus all day, which did not relieve (second day); a great deal of flatus from vagina and rectum, without relief (third day), [21].
Heaviness of the head, she could scarcely lift it, [1].
Itching on the left nipple; it bleeds occasionally, and seems as if it would ulcerate, [1].
The pain was relieved after eating, at 4.30 P.M. (second day), [35].

A sharp stitching pain in the prepuce and frænum prep.; a smarting raw feeling, causing me to examine if it were not abraded; found only a congestion of the integument; these symptoms are new to me (twelfth and thirteenth days), [30].
Soreness in the anus, [1].
*Rush of blood to the head; a pressure in it and out at the eyes; a feeling of numbness before the ears, [1].

Pressure in the uterus, causing oppression of breathing; the pressure downward is as if everything would fall out, accompanied with pains in the abdomen; she must cross her limbs in order to prevent the protrusion of the vagina, yet nothing protruded, but there was an increase of gelatinous leucorrhœa (after ten and twenty hours), [1].
Stitches as with a knife in the right eye, [1].
Great bitterness in the mouth while eating, [1].
Aching boring pains in the ears, especially the right ear and the temples (seventeenth day), [29].
Bruised pain and lassitude in the legs; she sank unavoidably into a slumber full of anxious dreams, [1].
Tearing and jerking toothache, from 6 P.M., until after midnight, about 1 or 2 A.M., on four successive days, [1].
Undulating pain in the upper part of the femur, [2].

A peculiar headache, not easy to describe, accompanied by vertigo, and compelling her to keep quiet, and at its worst to sit still; she felt relief by shutting her eyes (fourth day); again affected by above described headache and vertigo. Today she was obliged to remain constantly seated in order to keep off the attacks; they were rather less in the open air. In the afternoon this vertigo became extremely severe; it followed upon nausea, inclination to vomit, twisting and turning in the stomach, yawning, excessive prostration, almost amounting to trembling of the limbs, and occasional noise in the head and ears. (The vertigo had this peculiarity, it increased in violence on stooping or moving about, but was alleviated by sitting still), (eighth day), [31a].
Appetite good, but wants to eat often, [16].
At 10 P.M., pain in the right iliac region, near the crest, a pulling painful sensation (fourth day), [37].
Burning-aching pain in occiput, which feels as if its seat were beneath the bone; it lasted till the afternoon, and then gradually went off (after one hour, eighth day), [22a].
With the earache after midnight, a cold sensation all over the head, relieved by warmth and sleep (nineteenth night); sensation of coldness on the head, especially at night (twentieth day), [20].
Aching at back of right eye for half an hour (after some days), [16].
*Pressure in the head, in the morning, immediately after rising, [1].
Violent persistent erection, at night, [1].
Severe pain at the cardiac orifice of the stomach, when food is descending, [1].
Excoriated feeling about the anus (fourth day), [37].
Stitching pressure between the scapulæ, [1].
Much yawning and stretching, [1].
A sore bruised feeling in the left elbow, in the region of the ulnar nerve (sixth day), [30].
Amative feeling quite dormant, [19].
Stool consisting of light-colored fæces, thin, looking almost like grits, [7a].

Severe pelvic pain, commencing in the sacrum, passing forward and down to the right knee, at 7.30 A.M.; the only relief I found was pressing against something hard, which relieved all the pain, but by crossing my limbs the pelvic pain was relieved, but the pain in the knee was much aggravated (third day), [21].
Headache in the forehead, as from catarrh in the head, [1].
Slight burning in the septum of the nose, in the morning (third day), [45].
Blood from the nose on blowing it, [1], [2].
Large blood-boil on the left side of the neck, below the inferior maxillary, with stinging pain, [1].
Frequent painful contractions in the anus, [1].
Stitches in the heels and corns, during the day, [1].
Twitching at times on the malar bone, at times on the chin, [1].
If he only thinks of past troubles, the pulse grows quicker and breath fails him, [1].
Burning in the lids, especially of the right eye, in the morning, after getting up (eighth day), [44d].
On the right side of the scalp, over the parietal bone, a very painful pimple forms (eighteenth day), [45].
Drawing extending from the right hip to the sole of the foot, the entire day (after eight days), [1].
Stitches in the corns, even during rest; when knocking against, them stitches so severe as to cause a scream (after forty-eight hours), [1].
Toothache every afternoon, as if the teeth would be broken off, with chilliness; disappearing when in bed, [1].
Pressure in the stomach, from morning until 1 P.M., [1].
Great dryness of the palate, with much thirst; she is obliged to drink much, [1].
Stitches in front teeth, [1].
Burning in the forepart of the urethra (after nine and twenty days), [1].
Heat and swelling of the margin of the anus, [1].
Violent tickling stitch on the lower part of right tibia, [2].
Redness and flushes of heat in the face, [1].
Eructation of wind alone after supper, [1].
Profuse sweat in the face, after eating warm food, [1].

Abdomen very much distended after the least bit of food; felt some relief from loosening the clothes, but the distension soon returned, causing more distress than before, as it seemed to give the abdomen more room to expand (third day). Abdomen tympanitic, at 4 P.M. (fifth day). At 10 P.M., abdomen very much distended; since dinner, at 6 P.M. (seventh day). Bloated abdomen after eating the least bit of food; discharge of flatus does not relieve it (fourteenth to sixteenth day), [21].
Jerking of the eyelids, [1].
Tongue feels too large and scalded (thirteenth day), [21].

In the evening, immediately after dose, sweet taste in the palate (thirteenth day); sweetish taste (seventeenth day); in the evening, sweetish taste in the mouth (twenty-sixth day); sweet taste (in one hour, thirtieth day); in the forenoon, sweet taste (thirty-third day), [29].
Nosebleed, for seven days (after eleven days), [1].
Constrictive sensation in the mouth, [1].

A sensation as if there were a foreign body in the right eye, in the morning (twenty-eighth day); feeling of foreign body in the eyes, in the forenoon in the right, in the evening in the left eye (twenty-ninth day), [44f].
About midnight, awaking with chilliness, great anxiety, jerking and spasmodic drawing in the thighs, the chest, and the maxillæ, lasting half an hour, [1].
Yellow complexion (nineteenth day); appearance grew daily worse (twenty-first to thirty-first day), [32].
Swelling and suppuration of the glands in the right axilla, [1].
In the morning, on awaking, arid, wrinkled lips (third day); lips dry and shrivelled (fourth day); dryness of the lips and palate (tenth day), [29a].
Itching and biting in the inner canthi, [3].
The lower limbs pain as if beaten; she desires to sit down, and when sitting she feels as if she must stand up, [1].
Disagreeable creeping and tension in the scalp (two hundred and forty-third day), [44b].
Collection of saliva in the mouth, even after eating, [1].
Great thirst, in the morning, after awaking, [1].
Emptiness and lax feeling in the abdomen, after stool, [1].
Exhausting diarrhœa, with diarrhœa-like feel in the abdomen, [13].
Some transient stitches behind the left ear, in the evening (twenty-fourth day), [45a].
Left side of throat and tongue and corner of mouth covered with vesicles (seventeenth day), [21].
Pain and weight in the abdomen, on rising in morning (twelfth day); pain and tenderness in abdomen (thirteenth day), [44a].
Painful pressure in the place of a hernia, during violent laughter, [1].
Have not the bad taste in the morning which is customary during the menses), (nineteenth day), [20].
Crawling sensation in the face, [1].
Something seems to have come before the left ear, so that though he hears everything, he cannot understand the human voice, [1].
After coition, great weakness in the knees, [1].

In the forenoon, dimness of vision; it seemed as if a veil were before the eyes; sometimes she saw objects double; she could hardly see to do needlework; when sewing the sight went away completely (seventh day), [31a].
Swelling of both legs (after thirteen days), [1].
Purulent mucus in the eyes (after three days), [1].
Corrosive itching of the scalp, [1].
Soreness of the left commissure of the mouth (sixth day), [17c]; (second day), [17d].
Tingling superiorly in the vertex, [1].
Small dark specks before the eyes; eyes dazzled after looking long at an object (twenty-third day), [34].
Great faintness, with heat and then coldness, [8].
Felt sleepy after eating, at 4.30 P.M., and went to sleep, sleeping until 7.30 P.M. (second day), [35].
All her teeth feel loose, [35].
During the whole menstrual period she could not sleep on account of tearing in the back, chills, and heat, with thirst and painful contraction of the chest, [1].
The slightest exercise, even writing, excites sweat, [1].
Nausea several mornings before breakfast, [1].
The sore spot swells and becomes hot, accompanies by burning pains, [1].
After emission, indolent, languid, sensitive to damp air, with turbid urine, vertigo, and constipation, [1].
Itching of the anus, even during the day, [1].
Somnolence every third day, returning four times, the child slept almost the whole day; when it sat down it fell asleep, and complained also of pain in the forehead, [5].
Pains appear on the left side, at 5 P.M. (sixth day), [38].
Icy coldness in the stomach, with rumbling, [7a].

Dull drawing-throbbing pain deep in the right side of the forehead, which was at times more violent, and again less so; it lasted half an hour (in two hours); a slight threatening of headache on the left side of the forehead (after four hours, fourth day), sudden, oft-recurring, dull drawing pain in the left side of the forehead, which (in the house and out of the house) alternated with a similar pain, now in the right side of the forehead and now in the right parietal region (after four hours, fifth day); sudden, oft-recurring, dull drawing deep in the left side of the forehead (soon, ninth day), [25].
Pain in the left side of the occiput, as from congestion of blood, after waking from sleep, [1].
Lancinating pains in the uterus, shooting upwards (fifth day), [20].
Dreams, not exhausting, the whole night, [3].
Weakness of the head so that she can scarcely think, particularly in the afternoon, [1].
Inflammation in the nose (after nine days), [1].
Have always had a strong appetite, but while taking the medicine, had but little inclination to eat, [27].
Oppression of breathing in the evening, from pain under the right short ribs, which prevents the slightest motion, [1].

He raised himself about midnight, as if in delirium, began to laugh; on being questioned he closed his eyes tightly, sat quite stiff, with outstretched arms and hands and tightly set teeth; after drinking a swallow of water he asked what he was to do with so much water in his stomach, yet he drank more, held up his hand bend, as if holding the glass, laughed and said, Now this is strange, this water did not agree quite well; afterwards talked of three doctors who were coming, and referred to persons as if they were standing about, [1].
Single, violent, undulating jerks of pressing headache, quite in forepart of the forehead (after thirty-five hours), [2].
Frequent expectoration of mucus from the fauces, [1].
Going out in the morning into the open cold air produced great discharge of tears from the right eye, painless; seated for awhile in a warm room this ceased (second day), [38].
Dry feeling and tensive pain in the left side of the palate, gradually extending to the right side, and lasting two days, in the morning (second day), [18d].

Stool, which has been free and regular, is to-day, large, hard, and difficult (eleventh day); loose, yellow, watery, at 8 A.M., with pain and some flatulence (fifteenth day); sudden urging to stool with pain in the abdomen, at 6 A.M.; stool yellow, thin, and scanty, with much tenesmus (eighteenth day), [20].
Leucorrhœa, looking like pus, [1].
Chilly sensations in the back, with the sleepiness, at 8 P.M. (twentieth day), [20].
Continual inclination to stool, yet passed but little, [1].
While at stool, a painful raw sensation in the anus (sixth day), [37].
Severe burning in the sternum, [1].
Hair came out much, in the morning, on combing it, [44d].
Feels weary and trembles all over, [9].
Tensive pain in the tendo Achillis, [1].
*Pressive headache in the forehead, more violent on motion, [1].
Nose cold and pinched (fourth day), [21].
Bruised pain in the muscles of the calves and in the hamstrings, [1].
In the morning after awaking, palate dry (fourth and fifth days), [29a].
Pain and tingling all through the head, [56].
Pressure on the bladder and frequent micturition, with tension in the lower abdomen, [1].
Pressure in the stomach, in the evening, followed by headache, [1].
Unaccountable feeling of weariness (third day), [40a].
Appetite much increased (seventh day), [15].
Hard, dry, concussive cough (third day); continued four or five days, [32].
Scabby nostrils, [1].
Violent cramp in the region of the liver, relieved by eructations and emission of flatus, [2].
Periodically recurring, but not very severe pains in the temples, followed by acute drawing pains in the temples, [17a].
Severe stitches in the occiput, extending toward the vertex, [1].
Severe bruised pain in the left upper arm, [1].
Profuse secretion on lower part of the glans of purulent fluid, having a sourish salt smell, with itching, [1].
Raw pain in left commissure of mouth (seventh to thirteenth day), [17a].

Stitches posteriorly over the right hip, for four days almost continuous; she could not lie on the right side on account of the pain, and when touching the part it pained as from subcutaneous ulceration, [1].
Sudden paralyzed feeling in one leg, lasting two hours, [1].

On waking from nap, at 7.30 P.M., pain in the lumbar region, more on the left side; pain in the lumbar region all night of a dull aching character (second night); pain in back better this forenoon; pain in the lumbar region somewhat but not much better, in the evening (third day); pain in the back all day, more of a dull ache (fourth day); still some pain in the back (fifth day). Never had any form of backache before I took this medicine, [35].
Sticking pain in the forehead, though only on walking, [1].
Stitches here and there in the forehead, [1].
Headache in the occiput from noon on, a stupefying tingling in it on stepping; she was obliged to sit very quietly for four hours, [1].
Ravenous hunger, and if it is not appeased, water accumulates in the mouth, [1].
Itching and burning in the nostrils, as if sore, [1].
Spasmodic contraction on the right side of lower abdomen, [1].
Extreme nervous restlessness, [8].
Leucorrhœa of mucus, clear as water, [1].
Violent burning in the upper lip just under the nose, [1].
Drawing pain in the femora from below upward, [1].
Sensation as if the ears were stuffed, [51].
Weakness of the muscles of the hand, [2].
A feeling as if the eyes were plucked back into her head, [66].
Great burning and lachrymation of the eyes, [11].
Violent nosebleed, in the morning on blowing the nose, [1].
Boring above the root of the nose, [1].
Coition, with insufficient erection (after twenty days), [1].
Much straining in passing, even the fæces which are not at all hard, [1].
Stitches in the vagina every three or four seconds, and after a quarter of an hour a similar attack, [1].
Constant dull drawing pain in the back part of the neck (right side); worse on bending the head to the opposite side (third day), [35].
Violent headache (seventeenth and following days), [27].
Frequent pressure in the larynx, without pain, in the morning, [1].
Diarrhœa, the first days, [1].
Attacks of crawling in the thighs down to the toes, frequently lasting one-fourth of an hour, a number of days in succession, [1].
Severe itching on the tibiæ, [1].
Pulse 70, at 10 P.M. (second day); 85 (third day); 88, in the morning; 86, at 8 P.M. (fourth day), [21].
Face flushed (after five hours and a half), [33]; (second day), [35].
Smarting sore pain on the inner side of the lids, after midnight, followed by a sensation of a rubbing dryness upon the inner surfaces, [1].
Stitch continuing one minute in the region of the lowest right rib, toward the pit of the stomach, passing off from eructations, [2].
Before the menses sensation as if the genitals were dilated, [1].
Sour taste in the mouth (after twenty days), [1].
Throbbing pains in both temples after walking, especially after going upstairs (fifth day), [44].
Bitter taste to food, for example, to bread, [1].
Drawing in the teeth as from a cupping glass, [1].
Much itching in the sound ear, great roaring, and accumulation of purulent whitish cerumen, [1].
*Lachrymation in the morning, followed by dryness, [1].
Turbid clay-colored urine, with reddish sediment in the chamber, [3].
She cannot endure any draft of air on the teeth; no pain while in bed, pain commences early in the morning, about one hour after rising; also no pain from touching or cleaning the teeth, [1].
A long-continued pain under the right shoulder (fifth day), [38].
Grumbling in the front teeth, [2].
Burning pains in different parts of the body, especially in the lower part of the left hypochondriac region, [29].
At night during sleep, severe bruised pain and exhaustion in the thighs and upper arm, but only during slumber, on awaking it passed off immediately, [1].

Shooting in the left eye, preventing him from reading, for several days; when he attempts to read he gets, immediately, violent shooting pains through the middle of the pupil deep into the eye (thirty-second day), [18a].
No appetite, and yet the food has the proper taste (third day), [30].
Transient dull drawing pains in the right forearm and thigh (third day), [36].
Sensation of emptiness in the abdomen, [1].
Inflammation of the lower lids, without especial swelling, [1].
Heat in the face in the morning, pale face in the evening, [1].
Drawing and sticking in the nape of the neck, even when at rest, arresting the breath, [1].

The menses, of an elderly female, which had been absent for two months, returned forty-eight days after taking the medicine, accompanied with drawing from the teeth into the cheek, which was swollen, [1].
Vertigo, while walking, as if every object were in motion, [1].
A back tooth is painful to touch, [1].
Unusual thirst, [57].
Pressive drawing in the lower part of left side, near the small of the back (after twenty-eight hours)

Nausea at intervals the whole day, also after a meal, with an afflux of watery saliva, bitterish sour taste in the mouth continually, without appetite, yet the food has a natural taste (after four days), [1].
Painful swelling on the lower jaw beneath the gum, [1].
Drawing in the right molar teeth (eighth day), [44d].
Burning jerking in the right eyelid, [1].
Stinging pain in the kidneys and liver, [7a].
Very offensive and sour-smelling, soft, pappy stool, evacuated very quickly, [1].
Pain in the submaxillary glands, as if bruised; also painful when touched, [1].
Swelling of the upper lip, also, in the evening, with pain, [1].
Inflammation and swelling in upper part of throat, [1].
Ebullition in the left side, like a bubbling, [1].
Stitching tearing in the left wrist-joint (after five days), [1].
Earache in the left ear, [1].
Profuse perspiration after coughing, [9].
Heat in the stomach and pit, with feeling as if eating would relieve it, [1].
Severe tearing from the hip-joint to the foot, at night, hindering sleep, [1].
While walking, a sensation of fulness in right inguinal region, which soon passed off; I never had this symptom before (after two hours and a half), [30].
Dulness of the left side of occiput (after three hours), [2].

Since the thirty-second day I have had a vesicular eruption on the scalp, chest, back of the shoulders, and also on the calves of the legs, and on the knee-joints; a few of the vesicles became pustules, and when squeezed yielded a tough sticky matter; but pressure was painful and made them look angry; those on the scalp itched; brushing the hair was agreeable, but combing or scratching made the pustules sore; the brush brings off more scales than usual; the skin of the nose is also peeling (forty-fourth day), [38].
A sharp shooting pain through the heart, like an electric shock, about noon (eleventh day), [58].
Stretching out the neck and straining the cervical muscles distort the facial muscles (eleventh day), [1].
Severe throbbing headache in the temples, [1].
Eyes slightly adhering, in the morning, on awaking (fourteenth day), [45].

The front teeth seem too long, with sensitiveness when pressed upon and in the open air, when there is a jerking pain and tearing extending up into the left temple where also it is painful to pressure, [3].
Slight frontal headache off and on during the day (fourth day), [36].
Daily griping in the abdomen, without diarrhœa; at the same time much flatus accumulates; relieved by eructations, [1].
Numbness and sudden paralytic sensation of one lower extremity when standing, [1].
Heat in the face, after a meal, [1].
Catamenia appeared the second time after an interval of only eighteen days, instead of the customary twenty-six days, [20].
Left side of tongue and mouth covered with vesicles, causing a stinging pain; tongue coated yellow (twenty-eighth day); tongue clean; vesicles have disappeared (twenty-ninth day), [21].

Frequent sneezing (nineteenth day); frequent sneezing, in the afternoon (twenty-eighth day); frequent sneezing (thirty-second day); frequent severe sneezing, at least ten times in succession, at noon (sixty-seventh day); frequent sneezing, in the afternoon (seventy-eighth day); repeated severe sneezes (eighty-first day), [43a].
Swelling of the feet (after twenty-seven days), [1].
*Dulness of the head, after walking in the open air, [1].

Whirling and staggering, while sitting, after drinking a harmless drink, so that he thinks he will have an apoplectic stroke; this lasted five minutes; afterwards, flush of heat lasting five minutes, [1].
Ineffectual desire to urinate, at 11 A.M. (fifth day), [26].
A vesicle on the left border of the tongue (thirty-third day), [33].
About 2 A.M., painful dry sensation in both eyes (third day), [25g].
At noon, good appetite and much thirst (first day); great appetite (second day), [42].
Pimples on the right cheek, [1].
Sensitiveness of the upper lip, which is quite dry (fifty-fifth day), [45a].
Accumulation of saliva in the mouth, when beginning to eat, [1].

Bowels moved (in twelve hours); four movements during the day, and slight pain and some tenesmus during stool. (The bowels had always been remarkably regular, one stool each morning), (first day); stool about every two hours until the afternoon of this day; stool natural, but towards night it was diarrhœic, with tenesmus before and during stool, and burning of anus after stool, and feeling of intense bearing down in region of the anus (second day), [24].
Rush of blood to the nose, especially in the open air, [1].
Outward pressure in the ears, while straining at stool (after three days), [1].

At noon I notice soreness in location of a former congestion of liver (nineteenth day); the sore spot is felt on turning or reaching (twentieth day), and on moving suddenly (twenty-first and twenty-second days), [20].
Coppery taste in the mouth, in the morning on waking, [1].
One-sided, sharp, pressive headache beneath the left parietal bone immediately after supper, [1].
Staggering vertigo, every afternoon from 4 to 6 o'clock, when sitting and walking, [1].
Pain in all the limbs, particularly in the hips (after two days), [1].
Itching in the urethra, [1].

Pustules on the conjunctiva of the left eye; no pain, but I noticed a mist gathering before my eyes, and in this mist seemed to float black objects looking like tadpoles, with their heads pointing to the centre and their tails radiating, at 7 A.M.; much better, at 11 A.M.; much worse than this morning; the mist causes nausea, at 2 P.M. (fifty-eighth day). Same as yesterday morning, at 7 A.M.; same as yesterday, at 11 A.M.; aggravated as yesterday at this hour, but more painful, at 2 P.M. (fifty-ninth day). Eyes better (sixtieth day). Eyes all right (sixty-first day). Again affected (sixty-fifth day), [21].
The eyes are agglutinated, in the morning, the lids thick and red; afterwards dry mucus in the lashes, [1].
Itching on the occiput making him scratch (eighty-sixth day), [45b].
Much mucus in the throat, he must hawk much, [1].
Violent cough, with much expectoration of white mucus, every night for one hour, for several weeks, [1].
Vision is impeded by fiery zigzags before the eyes, [1].
Pulsating in the left side of the occiput, that at last changes to a jerking, [1].
In the evening a fine burning, like sparks, on some parts of the skin of the right upper lid (third day), [25g].
Rheumatic drawing in the left side of the head, [1].
Boils on the thigh (after seventeen days), [1].
Toothache from the slightest draft of air, [1].
Itching on the bends of the elbows, [1].
Pressure on the upper part of the sinciput, [2].
The upper lip very red and sensitive on its inner surface (twentieth day), [45a].
For the last two days have had the contractive pain in the back of the neck, mostly on right side (fifth day), [36].
He talks aloud during sleep, [1].

Frequent sneezing, discharge of fluid mucus from the left nostril, a very severe catarrh, although that which dated from 20th October, had only quite ceased a few days previously (seventeenth day), [28c].
Drawing pain in the shoulder-joint, in the morning in bed, lasting one hour after rising, [1].
Drawing in the teeth (eleventh day), [44f].
Pressure on the lower part of the right eyeball, [2].
Moist scalp, [1].
Drawing pain in both sides of the abdomen, in repeated attacks, [1].
Loud noises in the ears, with the distension of the head (after one hour), [51].
Pressing pain in the upper abdomen, afternoons, [2].
Sprained pain in the shoulder-joint, when resting the arm while sitting (third day), [1].
The hair of the head is painful on scratching, [1].
Emptiness of stomach, with nausea, as soon as she thinks of food, which she would like to take, [1].
*Dulness of the head, in the evening, [1]
Sore throat, with difficulty of swallowing, [10].
Itching in the upper part of the cheeks, and after rubbing it, a burning smarting, [1].
Lachrymation of the eyes, when walking, in the open air (two hundred and seventy-sixth day), [45b].
Pain in the roots of the hair, especially when touched, [1].
Tensive pain in the anus (and rectum), (after four days), [1].
Feels very faint when walking out of doors, in the evening, for five days (three days after last dose), [16].

For many years he had been subject to great scaliness of the head, so that a large quantity of scales came off when he combed or brushed his hair, and his coat collar was always covered with them; for a few days he has not noticed any of these scales, so that he thinks the Sulphur must have acted curatively (fifty-first day); no scales when he combs his head, though he used to have a good many (seventy-fourth day), [45a].
*Vertigo for eight minutes, while walking in the open air on an elevation; he could not step firmly, with obscuration of his senses (after four days), [1].
Pressure on the right chest in paroxysms, relieved by empty eructations, [2].
In the afternoon and evening, aching pain in the right ear, in the external meatus, towards the membrane of the tympanum (twenty-eighth day), [45b].
Cough, from tickling in the larynx, without expectoration (after five days), [1].
Itching in the nose, [1].
Cough, with expectoration, [7].
The hand is immovably bent in toward the little finger, [1].
Great desire for wine, which he previously did not drink at all, [1].
The tooth is elongated and painful when not touched, or when not bitten upon, [1].
After a walk, violent heat in the head and face, [1].
At 3 P.M., the pain in my right side is nearer to the sacrum; it is a dull heavy ache, a pulling sensation (fifth day), [37].
Occasional roaring in the ears (first day); roaring all day long (second day), [39b].
At 5 P.M., head hot, with feeling of fulness (tenth day), [20].
During the day, frequent cramplike tensive pain in the muscles of both mastoid processes (second day), [25d].
Sore throat, smarting and burning on posterior portion of fauces, and above on the palate, as if from a violent coryza, [2].
Burning of the upper lids, [1].
Very sleepy all day, for five days (third day after last dose), [16].
Itching biting in the outer canthus (after six hours), [1].
Nausea in the morning, on waking, towards evening and at night, [2].
I had some dreams, but cannot recall them, except one, of a foolish character (an old gentleman of seventy, running away from his wife, and suspected of having married another), [38].
Jerking of the limbs, at night, [1].
Burning from the stomach upwards, [2].
Backache only when sitting, even from the least sitting, [1].
Painful swelling of the knee, with tension in the knee during rest and motion, [1].

Swelling of the whole body, face, abdomen, legs, and the arms down to the wrist-joint, without thirst, but with great shortness of breath, lasting three weeks, fever every two or three days, chills and heat alternating, coming on at irregular hours, even at night, the heat accompanied with sweat all over (after forty-eight hours), [1].
Tired feeling, at 9.45 P.M. (second day), [40a].
Bleeding of the nose when blowing it, in the evening, [1].
Nausea, with bitterness in throat, without vomiting, [1].
Burning in the abdomen, when walking in the open air, [1].
Drawing pressure near the spinal column, near the left scapula, at times drawing to the neck, [2].
Arthritic drawing in the knee and finger-joints, [1].
Speaking caused fatigue, if continued for any time (twelfth to twenty-third day), [38].
Tickling on the tip of the right great toe, [2].
Sore pain in the rectum mostly between the stools, and like an outward pressing, even when lying, in attacks at regular intervals, accompanied by hæmorrhoids, painful when touched, [1].
Astringent smarting in the forepart of the urethra, in the morning when awaking, [1].
In the morning, on awaking, feeling of sand in the eyes, with raw pain on rubbing them (second day), [25d].

8 ounces of urine A.M., 18 ounces at noon, 10 ounces 10.30 P.M.; total, 36 ounces; sp. gr. 1022, A.M.; 1015, noon; 1022, 10.30 P.M. (thirty-fourth day); 12 ounces, A.M.; 8 ounces, noon; 12 ounces, 10.30 P.M.; total, 32 ounces; sp. gr. 1020, A.M.; 1014, noon; 1022, 10.30 P.M. (thirty-fifth day); 9 1/2 ounces, A.M.; 8 ounces, noon; 10 ounces, 10.30 P.M.; total, 27 1/2 ounces; sp. gr. 1016, A.M.; 1020, noon; 1015, 10.30 P.M. (thirty-sixth day); 8 ounces, A.M.; 20 ounces, noon; 7 ounces, 10.30 P.M.; total, 35 ounces; sp. gr. 1015, A.M.; 1014, noon; 1024, 10.30 P.M. (thirty-seventh day); 9 1/2 ounces, A.M.; 10 ounces, noon; 12 ounces, 10.30 P.M. (4 ounces, 1016, midnight); total, 35 1/2 ounces; sp. gr. 1020, A.M.; 1010, noon; 1016, 10.30 P.M. (thirty-eighth day); 10 ounces, A.M.; 11 ounces, noon; 10 ounces, 10.30 P.M. (9 ounces, 1026, midnight); total, 40 ounces; sp. gr. 1018, A.M.; 1016, noon; 1024, 10.30 P.M. (thirty-ninth day), [39a].
Pressive headache, at 10 A.M.; towards 5 P.M. it increases; it feels as if the base of the brain were tightly compressed by a band (eighth day), [15].
Burning and sticking in the right side of the occiput, [3].
After a stool, which was not hard, pressing headache in the forehead, [1].
Heat in the head, evenings (after three days), [1].
Upper lip sensitive to touch (second, eighth, and eleventh days), [45]; (sixty-eighth day), [45a].
Daylight dazzles the eyes and causes headache, [1].

On the internal surface of the left lower lip he observed a group of grayish-white aphthæ, which were rather painful; after a time, several aphthæ appeared on the right upper lip (they lasted a week), (fourth day), [25f].
Pressure over the eyes if he goes into bright daylight (after eleven days), [1].
Stitches in the weak ear, over which she laments loudly, [1].
She could not get warm, although in a warm room the whole day, [1].
Little pleasurable sensation during coition (second day), [1].
Short hacking cough, in the evening, after lying down, with expectoration of much pure coagulated blood, once every minute (after eight days), [4].
Painful contraction and pressure in throat, [1].

Feel very tired this morning (third, fifth, and sixth days); beginning to feel tired and listless, at 8 A.M. (thirteenth day); feel very sick; have a heavy cold, never had such before; lungs very sore; harsh distressing cough, worse from going from cold air to warm room, and vice versâ (twenty-first day); very languid all day (twenty-seventh day); feel very stupid (eighty-seventh day); feeling very tired I took a dose of Nux vomica, after which I found all my symptoms returning, pustules on the conjunctiva, throat, and tongue, also the loss of memory (one hundred and ninth day); much better (one hundred and tenth day); entirely relieved (one hundred and eleventh day), [21].
Hypersensitiveness of hearing, [1].

After dinner, rather severe itching of the lids, especially of the right eye (two hundred and forty-seventh day); great itching on the borders of the right eyelids (two hundred and forty-eighth day), [45b].
Stitching pain in the left lung and in the third toe of the right foot at the same time, of the same character, lasting but a few seconds (tenth day), [27].
About noon, burning in the right cheek, as if some drops of hot fluid were thrown against it, lasting four or five minutes; this recurred twice (fourth day), [39].
In the evening, watery colorless mucus from the nose, [33].
Temperature 99 3/8, at noon (fifth day); 99 3/8, at noon (sixth day), [20].
Feels dull and drowsy, [28a].
Sudden stitches in the pit of the stomach, when swallowing the food very quickly, [1].
Nose feels very raw and sore (fourth day), [37].
Sensation as if the vulva were enlarged (twenty-third day), [20].
Coryza, with chilliness, catarrh and cough, [1].
Profuse falling of the hair, [1].
Heat in the left eye, in the morning, with swelling of the inner canthus, [1].
Reeling, stupefaction, and great weakness, at 11 A.M.; she was obliged to lie down and lay till 3 o'clock, in an uneasy slumber in which she heard everything
Profuse sweat, while walking, [1].

Tingling at the meatus urinarius (second day); considerable tingling in the urethra, as in the first proving, only more severe, between 1 and 2 P.M. (third day); some tingling (fourth and fifth days), [40a].
First great distension of the abdomen, then severe rumbling and motion therein, [1].
Expectoration from the chest, without much cough and without dyspnœa, [1].
Spasmodic stitching in the heel, as if the tendons were too short, evenings when undressing and extending the feet, [1].

Great burning in the canthi, at noon (second day); slight burning in both outer canthi (tenth day); slight burning in the edges of the lids (twelfth, seventeenth, eighteenth, and nineteenth days), [45a].
Toothache and inflammatory swelling of the gum, in the vicinity of a stump almost entirely destroyed (twenty-fourth day), [34].
*A spot on the vertex is painful to touch, [1].
Tearing toothache out through the left ear, during and after eating, [1].
Morning nausea, as if everything in the abdomen were turning around, [1].
Shooting above the left eye (twenty-third day), [34].
Severe irritation to cough, from crawling in the chest, [1].
Eructation and hiccough, alternating, [1].
Four hours after taking the medicine, when in bed, he felt a rubbing dry sensation (like sand) in the mucous surface of the eyelids (fourth day), [25].
In the evening, violent pains in the occiput (fourth and fifth days), [36d].
Tensive pressure on the chest, more on left side, [1].
Slimy diarrhœa, with discharge of round and thread worms, [7].
Itching of the eyelids, as if they would become inflamed, [1].
Burning and hot feeling in the loins (region of kidneys), when taking a long breath, [1].
Dull drawing-tearing pain, as if sprained, in the shoulder-joint (after dinner), [1].
Painful pimples on the forehead, [1].
Both ears feel as if plugged up; am somewhat deaf; obliged to ask that a question be repeated (seventh day), [37].
She cannot sleep at night on account of incessant cough (after forty days), [1].
Tearing in the prominence back of the right ear, [2].
Violent drawing pain in an incisor, lasting till 11 P.M., followed by sleeplessness till towards morning, [1].
Pressing jerks in the molar teeth, mostly when stooping, [1].
A painful tearing at a small spot in the brain, as if something tore loose, during a short spell of cough, [1].
Throat very sore, at 7 A.M. (eighth day), [21].
Pale suffering expression, as after a long illness, with great discomfort, [3].
Tearing in the lower maxilla, below the incisors, [2].
Jactitation of muscles of upper arm, [1].
Tearing in the sole of right foot, close to the toes, [2].

At night, drawing pains in the region of the left eyebrow and aching in the left eyeball, as if it were swelled out and pushed forward; the aching in the eyeballs only went off the following morning, after getting up (twenty-fifth day), [40].
Blowing of blood from the nose, at night, [1].
Pain across the lower part of the bowels (twentieth day), [22].
No appetite for dinner (ninth day), [32].
Burning of the lids, that are inflamed and red and tense on motion, [1].
A slight burning feeling in the eyes, and a desire to close them; they feel sore to the touch (nineteenth day), [22].
Burning stitching in the extreme tip of the great toe, [2].
Jerking motion in the left biceps of the upper extremity, lasting an hour, in the evening (seventh day), [20].
A sharp piercing pain in the lower lobe of the right lung, coming on in paroxysms, and so severe as to almost make me cry out (third day), [42].
Tearing in the right thigh, when walking, with pain of the parts from touch, [1].
Burning pain in the sternum, when drinking beer, [1].
A general good-for-nothing feeling (fourth day), [44].
Taste of manure in the mouth (after five days), [1].
The lips are sore, smarting, and disposed to crack, [9].
All the symptoms are greatly aggravated on lying; I must get up and walk about slowly; relieved after supper in all respects (twenty-second day), [20].
Left arm down to wrist feeling heavy and very cold, but hands hot, for five days (third day after last dose), [16].
Very much affected, as if he had been hungry a long time, an hour after dinner, [1].
In the afternoon, pressure in the uterus, as if everything would issue through the vulva (twenty-third day), [20].

Urinated freely (after third dose); passed a little urine, 2 ounces, sp. gr. 1031 (at 11 P.M., first day), which presented next morning the following phenomena: Reaction slightly acid; deposit of a white adherent film; sediment at bottom of tube slightly pinkish; the sediment readily dissolved on slight heat (not by a few drops of nitric acid), and displayed under the microscope amorphous particles, and on standing a long time (forty-eight hours), crystals of uric acid appeared. At 8.15 A.M., passed 12 ounces urine, sp. gr. 1029; at noon, 9 ounces, sp. gr. 1023; total amount 53 ounces (a cold day), (second day). The urine of last night had a heavy white deposit, showing the same characters as before; 8.15 A.M. passed 15 ounces, sp. gr. 1021 (third day), [40a].
*Headache over the eyes, every morning, as from stopped coryza; was constantly obliged to sneeze, [1].
During the first part of the proving I slept soundly, but now sleep is restless (forty-fourth night), [38].
Icy coldness over the whole body, [7a].
The teeth are very painful when touched and when talking, [1].
Blue rings around the eyes, [1].
Griping in the bowels, with sensation as if they would turn inside out, [1].

Vilent sneezing (immediately); frequent sneezing, which increases the pain under sternum (seventh day); few sneezes (forty-second day); frequent sneezing (forty-fifth day); occasional sneezing and hawking of mucus (fifty-fifth day); occasional violent sneezing, in the forenoon (fifty-ninth day); frequent sneezing and dry tussiculation (sixty-seventh day); occasional sneezing, in the morning after rising (eighty-fifth day); occasional sneezing and coughing up of thick mucus (one hundred and tenth day); frequent sneezing (one hundred and forty-seventh day); violent sneezing, in the evening (two hundred and seventeenth day); very violent sneezing, at noon, ten successive times, followed by frequent dry tussiculation (two hundred and nineteenth day); occasional sneezing (two hundred and thirty-first and two hundred and thirty-second day); occasional violent sneezing (two hundred and seventy-ninth day); occasional sneezing (two hundred and eighty-second day), [45b].
Much pressure and tension in the upper abdomen, at times relieved by an internal fermentation, together with pressure and sticking in the umbilical region, [2].
Hoarseness, with dry cough, from tickling in the throat (after five days), [1].
Menses several days too early (after forty-eight hours), [1].

A distinct chill at 9 A.M., followed by fever, with chilliness across the stomach and bowels, and chilliness between the shoulders; the sweat that followed the fever was exceedingly offensive and pungent; her feet, which had always been subject to perspiration (not offensive), now gave forth a most offensive odor (third day). One hour after a dose she felt a coldness between the shoulders, and then a general chilliness over the body, followed by sudden loss of strength and weakness about the chest, and she broke out into a profuse perspiration over the chest and neck; the hands and feet became cold as ice; her face pale; she thought she should vomit, but was relieved on getting up and moving about (eleventh day), [23].

Itching of the inner canthi, in the morning after awaking; after rubbing, there set in smarting and much lachrymation, and then sore feeling in the outer canthi, which were also somewhat agglutinated, [2].
Much pain in the swollen gums of decayed teeth with swelling of the cheek, [1].
When sitting he is sleepy, and when reading he falls asleep, [1].
Pressure in the eyes as if sleepy, every evening, without sleepiness, [1].
Vertigo, with qualmishness to falling sideways, while walking in the open air, [1].
Aching pain at the coccyx, just before the action of the bowels; it was intolerable, and shot across her with such severity that she had frequently to lie down and cry, [9].
Dull pain in the sacrum (thirty-fifth day), [21].

At noon but little appetite; he ate more from habit than from necessity (third day); at noon little appetite, and no desire to drink water while eating, which he was always in the habit of doing (sixth day); at noon no appetite (ninth day), [29a].

Occasional aching in the root of the nose, between the shoulders and all over the back (fifth day); some aching in the nasal bones, towards noon; recurrence of the aching after dinner (sixth day); aching in the nasal bones (eleventh day), [45c].

Pustules in the right groin and between coccyx and anus; they feel hard like shot (sixty-first day); pustules in groin very painful; quite a number along the posterior border and inferior angle of the left scapula (sixty-second day); pustules forming on the crista ilii from the spine to the middle of each bone (sixty-third day); pustules very painful, which make me irritable (sixty-fourth day); pustules indistinct on my body (sixth-fifth day), [21].
Frequent sneezing (sixth day), [45c].
Heat in the mouth, without thirst (after nineteen days), [1].
Feeling as if the upper lip were swelled (first day), [45].
Many gelatinous stools, with pains in the abdomen, [1].
Nose much stopped up (sixteenth day), [34a].
Dry coryza, only in the left nostril, [2].
Constant chilliness, day and night, with pinching pain in the abdomen for several days, [1].
Dulness of the head (after twenty-four hours), [1].
Bitter taste, in the morning, relieved by eating, [1].
Anxious dreams, as if the body were disfigured, [1].
If she eats a little too much, the next day she has a horribly sour, offensive taste, [1].
Tearing in the right little toe, [1].
Beating in the region of the liver, [1].
Tearing in the left ear, extending into the head, [1], [3].
Craving for food (after three hours and a half, second day), [42].

Attack of drawing pressive pain in the region of navel, followed by discharge of mucus from the rectum, with violent urging and stitches; soon afterwards congestion of blood to chest, with anxiety and restlessness, which after dinner turned to a sort of fever, with alternating internal heat and a chilliness, with sweat on the head from 1 to 4 P.M., then headache, which left a pain in nape of neck; the following day the same condition returned, [1].
Slight pressure on the region of the stomach causes great pain, [1].
Strong bearing-down pains, [10].
Burning-pressing pain in the corn, even in wide shoes, [1].
Food tastes bitter, [1].
Drawing pain in the back teeth, aggravated by inhaling cold air, [1].
*Pinching together in the brain from one temple to the other, frequently, for a minute, [1].
Feverish chilliness, with alternation of heat, till in the night, [1].
Rumbling, with distension of the abdomen, [7a].
Loss of breath by every, even the slightest, motion, [1].
In the evening, drawing in the left eyebrow (forty-third day), [28c].
Inflammation of the corns, [1].
Eyes feel pulled downward (nineteenth day), [20].
Cough, awaking at night, [1].
Inflammation, great swelling, and suppuration of the left tonsil; he could not swallow on account of pain, heat of the whole body, thirst, and burning in the eyes (after eleven days), [1].
In the evening, by candlelight, a veil before the eyes; the surrounding objects appeared to be enveloped in smoke; rubbing and wiping them had no effect (third day), [30].
At night, during frequent waking, stitches in the tip of the elbow, [1].
Weak, particularly in the knees, [1].
Fine quick gurgling in the right side of upper abdomen, [2].
Very thirsty for cold water, drinking much and often, especially in evening, for five days (third day after last dose), [16].
Hiccough after supper, [1].
Burning tearing at inner part of left buttock, [2].
Sleep disturbed, through vivid unpleasant dreams (after sixteen days), [1].
Burning heat in the eyes, [57].
Itching and itching pimples on the joints, particularly on the bends of the elbows, popliteal space, and ankles, worse evening and morning than during the day (after a few hours), [1].
Eyes feel very sore, as if bruised (fourth day), [37].
Itching on the occiput near the nape (thirteenth day), [45].
Uneasiness in the limbs (after six days), [1].
Sour taste in the mouth, with costiveness (after eleven days), [1].
Copious secretion of mucus from the Meibomian glands (fifth day), [36c].
Pressure and itching in the eyes and vertigo on stooping, [1].
Eruption on the face, a red roughness of the skin, [1].
On waking from sleep before midnight, pressure in the left frontal protuberance (ninth day), [21].
I could scarcely open my eyes, which were agglutinated, with forcible closure of the lids; in the evening the light obliges me to shut them (fourteenth day), [15].
Severe constriction of sphincter ani (seventh day); so intense as utterly to prevent stool (eighth day), [44a].
Tingling in the ears; at times in one, at times in the other, and difficult hearing with the tingling, [1].

It seems to me that I have taken cold by the sensation, although I have not exposed myself; head troubles me very much; the anterior and posterior nares and the pharynx seem as though they had been skinned; these feelings are mostly confined to the right side; head feels dull and heavy, and there is a thick yellow mucous discharge from the right side, and on putting the finger into the nose, it becomes bloody; the sensation is the same that I once had after snuffing persulphate of iron into the nose, a kind of excoriated sensation (third day), [37].
Hard difficult stool, also mingled with mucus, [1].
Strong taste of Sulphur in the mouth (soon), [29].
Urine became thick and turbid, [8].
Shooting pain in the second right upper molar (after one hour), [38].
Easily strained when at work, and consequent stiffness and tense feeling in nape of neck, [1].
The femora are painful when sitting, she must change her seat frequently (after ten days), [1].
Great itching of the margins of the eyelids, [29].
Pressing pain at the root of the nose, [1].
In the night he dreamed that he was urinating in the chamber, instead of which he was wetting the bed (after seventeen days), [1].
General profuse sweat, after dinner, with sensation of heat, [1].
Itching on the tip of the nose, [1].
Pressure and bruised pain in lower abdomen wakes her at night, for several nights, [1].
Itching in the ear, immediately followed by itching heat in the outer ear, [1].
Contractive pain in the rectum, and thence into the perinæum and vagina, [1].
Itching inflammation of the penis increasing the excitement during coition, [1].
Pain all over the bowels, with sense of fulness and soreness, [24].
Awaking at night with anxious warmth, [1].

Pulse, A.M., 84; P.M., 80 (forty-first day before the proving); P.M., 84 (fortieth day); A.M., 83; P.M., 80 (thirty-ninth day); A.M., 80; P.M., 78; (thirty-eighth day); A.M., 72; P.M., 73 (thirty-seventh day); A.M., 76; P.M., 78 (thirty-sixth day); A.M., 75; P.M., 75 (thirty-fifth day); A.M., 76; P.M., 72 (thirty-fourth day); A.M., 73; P.M., 78 (thirty-third day); A.M., 74; P.M., 77 (thirty-second day); A.M., 73; P.M., 75 (thirty-first day); A.M., 74; P.M., 72 (thirtieth day before the proving); A.M., 90; P.M., 80 (third day of proving); A.M., 82; P.M., 80 (fourth day); A.M., 80; P.M., 75 (fifth day); A.M., 74; P.M., 75 (sixth day); 1 P.M., 80; 6 P.M., 74 (seventh day); A.M., 74 (eighth day), [37].
Pain at the upper part of the sternum, when coughing, [1].
Headache, as from pressure, from within outward (after thirteen days), [1].
Anxious dreams, which drive him out of bed (after nineteen days), [1].
Pale face, [7a]; (after twenty-four hours), [1]; (second, fourth, and fifth days), [44].
He must spit a great deal, [1].
Throbbing of the carotids (twenty-second day), [20].
Violent digging pains in a right healthy molar tooth; strong pressure on the tooth diminished the pain; cold and heat had no effect on it, [17e].
Weakness and aching in the thighs, especially when going upstairs (eleventh day), [44a].
Sweat over the whole body, in the morning, after awaking, [1].
Slight sensitiveness and swelling of the gums on the right side of the lower jaw (sixtieth day), [45b].
Near the outer canthus of the left eye an intensely red, excessively itching and burning spot on the skin; the left palpebral conjunctiva much reddened (twelfth day), [29a].
Pressure in front in the lower abdomen, right side, [2].
A kind of red rash came out all over the body, the face was first affected, then the trunk, and lastly the extremities; it was accompanied by high fever, pulse 120, [10].
Single stitches, at times through the head, [1].
Itching on the upper part of the sternum, [1].
Violent cutting in the abdomen, in the morning, [1].
Painful stitches in the left thigh, when walking (after eleven days), [1].
Vertigo, when moving the arms, [1].
The menses, which had always been very regular, came on seven days too early (after twenty days), [1].
Hoarseness, he cannot speak a loud word, [1].
Waked at 3 A.M.; a rush of ideas prevented sleep for an hour, when I broke out in profuse sweat; followed by quiet sleep (twenty-seventh day), [20].
Hands generally cold, but moist with perspiration (fourth day), [20].
Eruptions, Moist and Pustular.
Very frequent sneezing, in the evening and morning, [1].
Hiccough after a meal, lasting a quarter of an hour, [1].
Considerable pain in the right knee (fourth day), [21].
Dull pain in the lumbar region, with tenesmus in the rectum (after fourteen hours, second day), [21].
Pain in the lumbar region (seventh day), [20].
Pain shooting into the right ear (third day), [37].
Contractive headache in the forehead, [1].
Longing for sugar water, [1].
The hand becomes numb and goes to sleep if he holds anything tightly or carries anything, [1].
Sourish taste in the mouth, [1].
Mouth dry, insipid and sticky, in the morning, [3].
Wakened at 5 A.M., and slept again, after which I was dull, languid, and not disposed to move (thirteenth day), [20].
Intolerance of sunlight, [1].
Red, salt-sour water is exuded from a left lower hollow back tooth, [3].
Feel sick all over (twelfth day), [21].
At 9.30 P.M., dull pain over both eyes; it seemed to be in the bone (ninth day), [35].
Everything seems an exertion (after three hours and a half, second day), [42].
Much chilliness and internal restlessness, in the morning, when awaking (after twenty-four hours), [1].
Great dryness of the vulva and vagina, causing a very disagreeable sensation when walking, after the cessation of the menses (eleventh day), [21].
The upper lip burns as if it were raw (second day), [45a].
Inflammation of the eyelids, with a stye thereon, [1].
Great sweetness in the mouth, in the morning on waking, with much mucus, [1].
A sore throat, from which I had suffered ever since I had small-pox, eight years ago, is somewhat improving), (fifth day), [38].
On the mucous membrane of the right side of the under lip two aphthæ, which went off in two days (third day), [25f].
Swelling of the feet, they burn and are very dry, [11].
Sudden aching tension in the left side of the occiput (eighth day), [25].
Smarting in the forepart in the orifice of the urethra (after thirteen hours), [2].
Boring-digging headache in the forehead, commencing in the forenoon, lasting the whole day, from the slightest motion, [1].
Profuse sweat on the scrotum, [1].
Dull stitches in the whole head, lastly in the occiput, making him feel quite inactive, [1].
Heaviness in forehead and temples (after two hours), [38].
Lassitude, at 9 A.M. (twenty-third day), [20].
Alternating heat in the head and chilliness in the lower limbs (after thirteen days), [1].
Violent palpitation of the heart and beating of all the arteries, in the evening in bed, [1].
Contraction in the region of the stomach, [1].
Hoarseness, she cannot sing high notes, [1].
Twitching of the upper lid, [1].
Insipid taste, in the forenoon (second and thirteenth days), [30].
Pain in the front teeth, at night, [1].
Pressure in the upper lids, [1].

An inflamed pimple on the occiput (twenty-second day); some inflamed pimples at the back of the scalp (sixtieth day); on the occiput two painful pimples, and a similar inflamed pimple on the middle of the vertex (seventy-ninth day); several painful pimples on the occiput (ninety-ninth day); [I must repeat the remark, that the large quantity of scales I used to have on my head for some time back have quite disappeared, and that I cannot now bring away anything of the sort by vigorous combing and brushing, but the hair on the vertex is falling off considerably, so that a bald place is beginning to appear.] on the right side of the scalp a small painful pimple (one hundred and eighth day); several small, not itching pimples, in the hollow at the back of the head downwards towards the nape (two hundred and twenty-third day), [45b].
The natural tension of the facial muscles gone, so that her features appear distorted, as if worn out by long suffering (fourth day), [31].
The lower limbs become quite stiff and go to sleep, with crawling sensation, after sitting only a short time, [1].
Feel weak (fourth day), [37].
Great dryness of the tongue in the morning when awaking, as if burned, [1].
Profuse leucorrhœa of lumpy mucus, having a fetid odor, with drawing pain in the lower abdomen, [1].
Severe drawing pain in the knees, when walking and when rising from a seat, [1].
Discharge of bloody mucus after the stool, [1].
Great thirst for beer, [2].
Stitching pressure in the left great toe, more during rest than when walking, [1].
He bites the teeth together at night, during sleep, which causes great pain, [1].
Aversion to all food, particularly to meat; he could only eat butter, bread, and soup, [1].
Swashing, as from water in the ears, with excessive sensitiveness of hearing (to the crack of a whip), [1].
Vomiting of milky water (during pregnancy), although she had not drank any milk, [1].
After coition, first an erection, then weakness of thought, vertigo, discouraged, relaxation of the body, and in the evening, low-spirited and inclined to start (fourteenth day), [1].
Head feels full and hot (thirteenth day), [1].
Stitching headache in both temples, in the evening, [1].
Profuse nosebleed, several times (after second day), [28].
The chilliness is felt in evening only, for five days (third day after last dose), [16].
Stitching in the heels, only at night (after forty-one days), [1].

Menses began to flow one week too soon (sixth day); dark, scant, and fetid (seventh day); menses began to flow; dark clotted blood (thirty-eighth day); very scant all day (thirty-ninth and fortieth days); very scant and membranous, and very painful (forty-first day); better, but not entirely relieved (forty-second day); menses made their appearance, with pain (seventy-second day); very scanty and pale, and very acrid, no pain (seventy-fourth day), [21].
Aching in the legs and ankles (first day), [22].

Headache only in the sinciput, mostly toward the forehead; pressure on the brain passing off in half a minute, returning eight or ten times in an hour; it would then remain away for an hour or an hour and a half, returning the next day but not so severe (after twenty-three days), [1].
Stitches deep in the chest, [1].
A dull headache all day (twentieth day); headache (twenty-first day), [22].
Much sweat and exhaustion, while walking, [1].
Painfulness of the whole chest, [1].
Tension in the left thigh and leg, like pain when parts have gone to sleep, extending to the sole of the foot (after twenty-four days), [1].
Much ebullition of blood in the whole body, at night, producing restless sleep, [1].
Boring, as with a hot iron, in the teeth, [1].

Slept from 10 to 11 P.M., and then woke, feeling as if a load were resting across the epigastrium; she took a dose of Aconite 3d, according to her custom, when disturbed in her sleep, and slept until morning (eleventh night), [23].
A red herpetic spot on the upper eyelid, scaly and peeling off, [1].
A suppurating pimple on the hairy scalp near the nape (sixteenth day), [45a].
Aching in the muscles of the abdomen and limbs, on waking (for ten weeks), [24].
Simple pain in the liver when riding over rough roads, just under the last ribs, obstructing breathing, [1].
Smarting of the lids; inclination to rub them; the eyes can hardly bear the light, in the evening (eleventh day), [15].
Stitches in the forehead, in the evening, which afterwards constantly became more violent, [1].
Great excitement of the whole body, [1].
Some pain in lower limbs, most in thighs (ninth day), [44a].
At noon, when sitting, some vertigo (twenty-sixth day), [45b].
Drawing pain in the stomach, with gnawing, extending to the back, where it is most painful, followed by great prostration and lassitude, one hour after dinner (also earlier), [1].
Pressure in the upper left chest, toward the axilla, mostly during a strong expiration; when touching the part, pains as if bruised, [2].
On rising from stooping position, vertigo and weight in the head (ninth day), [21].
Violent sneezing, several days, [1].

About noon, shining red swelling of the point of the nose, whereby the anterior angle of the left nostril felt thick, hard, and painful to the touch (thirteenth day); increased redness and swelling of the inflamed nose (fourteenth day); the redness of the swelling on the nose is diminished, the shininess of the skin, and the sensitiveness to touch continue (fifteenth day); swelling of the nose as yesterday (sixteenth day); at 6 A.M., on the inside of the swollen portion of the nose is a hardened, transparent, bright-yellow mass, which can only be detached with difficulty and pain (seventeenth day); rapid diminution of the swelling of the nose, of which next day not a trace remains (eighteenth day), [21].
Great thirst, and always more thirst than hunger, [3].

Very distressing dreams, and could see mice, rats, and snakes; no pain, but very dreamy and restless; heard noises in the street, and people talking, running, etc. (seventh day); could not sleep from the sights I saw and noises I heard; tossing about the bed (eighth night); bad dreams (ninth night), [43].
Repeated flying tearing in both cheeks (thirty-first day), [28c].
Heaviness in the feet extending to the knee, from early in the morning, [1].
Eyes feel like balls of fire, especially the left, which is much injected (fifty-seventh day), [21].
Violent pressure in the ears on swallowing and sneezing, [1].
Great heat and redness of the face, at noon, with cold feet, [1].
Bruised aching pain in the sockets of the shoulders, extending to the elbows; it was intermittent, and generally in only one arm at a time, [8].

In bed every place appears too hard for his head, which, on account of this disagreeable feeling, he must keep moving hither and thither, without succeeding in finding a better position (twenty-ninth day), [18a].
Bitter eructations, with nausea, [1].
Sticking in the lower jaw, extending out of the ear, [1].
After a meal, pressure as from flatulence deep in the abdomen, to the right; later, in the side it is felt, only when moving the part and bending forwards, [2].
Sensation as if the heart filled all the cavities of the body, with labored muffled beating (twentieth day), [20].
When at stool, profuse flow of saliva into the mouth (second day), [18d].
Burning of the eyes, with great sensitiveness to daylight, [3].

Urine, sp. gr. 1022, A.M.; 1005 (due to eating a sour orange), P.M. (twenty-fifth day before the proving); 1012 A.M., 1026 P.M. (twenty-fourth day); 1026 A.M., 1028 P.M. (twenty-third day); 1020 A.M., 1022 P.M. (twenty-second day); 1022, A.M. and P.M. (twenty-first and twentieth days); 1022 A.M., 1012 P.M. (nineteenth day); 1020 A.M., 1024 P.M. (eighteenth day); 1012 P.M. (seventeenth day); 1024 A.M., 1026 P.M. (sixteenth day); 1012 A.M. (fifteenth day); 1028 P.M. (fourteenth day); 1022 A.M., 1028 P.M. (thirteenth day); 1022 A.M., 1026 P.M. (twelfth day); 1020 A.M., 1012 P.M. (eleventh day); 1014 A.M., 1028 P.M. (tenth day); 1020 A.M., 1016 P.M. (ninth day); 1014 A.M., 1024 P.M. (eighth day); 1020 A.M. (seventh day); 1020 P.M. (sixth day); 1018 A.M., 1028 P.M. (fifth day); 1024 A.M., 1026 P.M. (fourth day); 1020 A.M., 1026 P.M. (third day); 1020 A.M. (second day); 1020 A.M., 1022 P.M. (first day before the proving); 1012 A.M.; smarting pain in urethra (first day of proving); sp. gr. 1022 A.M., 1026 P.M. (second day); 1024 A.M., 1032 P.M. (fourth day); 1022 A.M., 1028 P.M.; sharp pain along canal of urethra (fifth day); sp. 1024 A.M., 1030 P.M.; urine high-colored; quickly gets turbid, and stains bottom of vessel; occasional stitches along urethra (sixth day); sp. gr. 1024 A.M., 1030 P.M.; smarting and tingling pain in the urethra (eighth day); sp. gr. 1026 A.M., 1032 P.M. (ninth day); 1024 A.M., 1026 P.M. (tenth day); 1022 A.M. (eleventh day); 1028 A.M., 1030 P.M. (twenty-eighth day); 1030 A.M. (twenty-ninth day); urine remained high-colored; became quickly turbid, and a fine reddish sediment was noticed, in the morning, in the urine passed the previous evening (twelfth to twenty-third day). The quantity of urine was so small as to alarm me; not more than 8 ounces in twenty-four hours; constant irritation and desire to urinate (thirty-eighth to fortieth day), [38].
Pressure in the right nasal bone, in the evening, [1].
*Vertigo, in the forenoon (first day), [25e]; (thirty-second day), [43b].
Stitches in the left temple, [1].
Dull drawing pain in the suprascapular region, on the right side (second day), [36].
Sleepy early in the evening, with pressive dulness of the head (after seventy-two hours), [1].
Hawking up of phlegm, in the morning (after four days), [1].
Great swelling of the lower lip, in the morning, [1].

The night's rest was disturbed by boring tearing pain in the teeth, such a height that he could not sleep a wink, in consequence of which he got the tooth, which was somewhat carious, drawn the following day (seventeenth day), [29].
In the morning, slight sensitiveness of the edges of the lids (one hundred and thirty-fifth day), [45b].
Diarrhœa after partaking of boiled milk, [1].
