Lachrymation, feeling fatty, from both eyes, [2].
Right eye looks red and feels sore, left eye normal (third day), [37].
Tearing in the right upper jaw, in the evening, [1].
Feet cold and damp all day, feeling as though I stood in cold water up to my ankles (my feet are usually dry), (eleventh day), [22].
Icy-cold feet, afternoon and evening, when sitting, [1].
Sleeps better towards morning, with aversion to rising at usual time, for five days (third day after last dose), [16].
Itching and burning of the lids, which are red and swollen, in the morning (ninth day), [44d].
Sleep at night light, with vivid dreams of the events of the previous day, [1].
Sore pain and swelling of the gums; they recede from the teeth and bleed from the slightest touch, [1].
Ulcerative pain in the left upper jaw (soon), [15a].

Fine rash over her body, particularly about the bends of the elbows and knees; this was attended by prickling, tingling, and itching; while in a warm room it remained out, and she felt well; if she passed into a cold room, the eruption would disappear, and she would then have the most severe rheumatic pains in and about these joints (nineteenth day); it had extended over the arms to the axillæ, and over the lower extremities to the groins; when warmly dressed, and in a warm room, she felt well; when exposed to cold or severe weather, the eruption and the rheumatic condition returned (fifty-third day). When the eruption makes its appearance, it is attended with profuse sweat, which usually lasts two or three days, [23].

A sudden, not violent, pain in the left side of the forehead (soon); in the morning, aching in the forehead, first on the left side and then on the right, extending to the mastoid process (second and third days), [18a].
Burning in the feet, at night, [1].
Drawing in the left side of the lower jaw, towards its articulation, about noon (sixth day), [44d].
Headache so that the eyes seem to close, [1].
Stitches in the parietal and occipital bones when coughing, [1].
Teeth on edge, and painful only when bitten upon; cannot chew black bread on account of pain (after five days), [1].
Great uneasiness in the evening in one lower extremity, as from a sort of internal imperfect itching, [1].
Tearing in the left scapula, as from a cold (after four hours), [1].
The teeth seem too long, [1].
Aching pain in forehead and occiput, especially when stooping, about noon (second day), [43].
Eyes congested and dry (thirteenth day), [21].
Drawing pain and heat in right ear, [1].
Menses eight days too late (the after effect), (after twenty-eight days), [1].
Pressing pain on left forearm internally and externally at the bend of the elbow, [2].
Throbbing through chest and abdomen, as if the heart occupied the whole body (tenth day), [20].
Tensive pain in the dorsum of left foot, making it impossible for her to walk on the pavement, [1].
Discharge of prostatic fluid, after micturition, [1].
Smoking does not agree with him, contracts the fauces, [1].
Screaming, at night, during sleep, [1].
Constrictive pressive sore throat, just above and on the larynx, [2].
A dizzy condition of the head prevented sharp and clear thought
About 4.30 P.M., felt very hungry, and after eating a little felt satisfied, and the stomach felt full (second day), [35].
Weakness of sight, she sees things only sideways, [56].
Slight nausea after lunch (fifth day), [38].
*Pressive headache, especially in the forehead, going off in the course of the day (fourth day), [24].

Since commencing my proving of Sulphur I have observed a considerable weakness of vision, and very often a feeling of heaviness and aching in the eyeballs. When reading or writing I often feel as if a mist were before the eyes. I must then cover the eyes with the hand, slightly press and rub them, in order to read. Moreover, I must hold the book I am reading a considerable distance from the eyes, for when I hold it close I cannot distinguish the letters. I had previously noticed a slight diminution of my visual powers, but since the proving of Sulphur, the feeling of weight and aching in the eyes, and the weakness of sight rapidly increased, and to a great extent, [29].
Short sharp stitches in the right chest (after four hours), [2].
Very thirsty, in the morning, [1]; (fifth day), [20].
Distension of the abdomen, with diarrhœa and gripings, [1].
Lachrymation, in the open air, [1].
Dryness in the posterior nares, yet much mucus in the mouth, with involuntary urging to swallow, [1].
Difficult awaking, late, with weariness of the limbs, [2].
He awakes at night with violent anxiety and spasms in the abdomen, then in the mouth, the chest, and hip-joints, with palpitation of heart, [1].
Extremely sleepy at noon, afternoon wakeful again, [1].
Heat in the head, so that it seemed like a burning coming out of the ears, causing difficult hearing and dim vision, [1].
Violent cutting transversely across the abdomen, as from flatulence, passing off from motion, accompanied by cutting in the left testicle, [1].
Occasional sharp shooting pain in the left lung, on expiration (eighteenth day), [20].
After a short sleep at night he awoke with great bodily restlessness, which would scarcely allow him to lie quiet, [1].
She felt that she had a weight pressing on her thighs, momentary, [8].
Hard stool, with cutting in the rectum, [1].

In the evening had a severe headache, characterized by pressing pains in the temples, which seemed to press outwards, began at 6 P.M., and continued till next morning; have had similar headaches after drinking strong coffee, but had taken no coffee while taking the medicine (second day), [34].
Neuralgic pain over the right eye (I was accustomed to this some time ago, but had not had it lately), (ninth day), [22].
Coryza (after fourteen days), [1].
Gurgling to the right of, near to the small of the back, [1].
Itching of the scalp, in the morning (eighth day), [45c].
Intense headache, in the morning on waking and after getting up, [1].
Dry cough, as if proceeding from the stomach and abdomen, or from constipation, or as if something remained lodged in the stomach that would not pass off, [1].
Great dryness of the lips, [29].
Burning in the stomach, after eructations, [2].
Drawing in the gums over the two upper front teeth, [2].

Violent boring pain in a hollow tooth, always occurred in the evening and tormented him until late at night (fourth, fifth, and sixth days), [35]. [As he had no more toothache during the whole time of the proving, he was disposed to attribute it rather to wet weather, then prevailing, than to the Sulphur.]
The head pained, as if raw, and would not bear the slightest touch (second day), [43].

Salivary secretion increased; for a long time he had every now and then traces of blood in the saliva (twelfth day); rush of water into the mouth (seventeenth day); in the evening, great flow of saliva mixed with blood (twenty-sixth day); great flow of saliva into the mouth; bloody streaks in the saliva (in one hour); increased secretion of saliva mixed with streaks of blood, in the afternoon (thirtieth day); in the forenoon, copious secretion of saliva mixed with streaks of blood (thirty-third day), [29].
Drawing toothache, [1].
Very bad odor from the mouth, in the morning, and also afterwards, [1].
Hoarse, this evening (third day), [37].
Tingling and pulsation in the ears, [1].
Sticking pain under the right false ribs, with the short, dry, evening cough, [1].
Flying shoots in the left temple, in the afternoon (twenty-eighth day), [40].
In the morning, expectoration of salt-tasted saliva (ninth day); after hawking and slight coughing it went off in four days, [38c].
During the day, frequent sudden vertigo, especially when walking near a declivity. The accustomed beer at night makes the vertigo worse (thirteenth day), [22a].
Chest is quite raw, owing to much cough and expectoration, [1].
Pimply eruption in the centre of the vermilion border of the upper lip (fourth day), [1].
Daily jerking under the eyes, [1].
Dryness in the throat, with sense of thickness, [8].
Slight aching at the neck of the bladder just after urinating (third day), [40a].

In the afternoon, in addition to a frequent alternation of the already-described pains in the head and joints, there occurred a violent cramplike tensive pain close to the right mastoid process (when at rest), which seemed to pierce into the deepest parts of the bone; it lasted for a few seconds, and then made way for a shooting pain in the right temple (second day), [25f].
Repeated shooting pains in the heel (ninth day), [38].
Violent continued cutting, soon also stitching in the urethra, [1].
Looseness of the teeth and bleeding of the gum, for three weeks, [1].
Leucorrhœa, with stitches in the uterus (after twenty-five days), [1].
Feverish, weak, hot urine, [1].
Pressing pain in throat, in upper right side, [2].
Stitches in the middle joints of the fingers, [1].
In the evening, vertigo; feeling as if all the blood rushed to the head (fifth day), [42a].
Severe shooting pain in the left temple from 12 to 7 P.M.; pains also higher up about the anterior inferior angle of parietal bone (ninth day), [38].
Digging and contraction in the abdomen, with passage of much wind, [1].
An inflamed pimple behind the right ear (one hundred and sixty-second day); a small inflamed pimple behind the right ear (two hundred and sixty-third day), [45b].
Sore throat, with swelling of the cervical glands, [1].
Slight creeping in the throat, with sensation of hoarseness, which causes frequent hawking, [2].
Pointed pimples on the calves, extending up to the knees; they itch, and where the clothes touch, cause a sticking, [1].
The eyes become fatigued from reading and writing, and pain in the internal canthus as if sore, [2].
Roaring in the ears, in the evening in bed, with rush of blood to the head, [1].
Dryness of the mouth, after eating, [1].
Some griping pains in the lower part of the bowels; passed away about 10 A.M. (eleventh day), [22].
Shooting pains along the inner side of the whole right arm (fourth day), [36].
Burning in the eyes, with redness of them (thirty-third day); redness of eyes much diminished (thirty-fourth day), [16].
The tip of the tongue feels scalded, [29].
At noon, disgust at meat (fourteenth day), [34a].
Bitter eructation after breakfast, [1].
Accumulation of flatus in the abdomen, when walking in the open air, [1].
Footsweat, particularly at the toes, for two weeks, [1].
Drawing-tensive pressure in the abdomen, [2].

Intermittent fever, returning frequently during the day, at indefinite periods, first general heat, with sweat in the face, violent thirst, and bitterness of the mouth; then chill, with general coldness even in the face, with inclination to vomit, pressure in the forehead, extending into the temples; during the heat, vertigo, as if he would fall, [1].
A feeling as of sand in the eyes, [56].
Want of steadiness and dizzy feeling accompanied anxious state (fourth day), [30].
Vinegary taste in the mouth all day, [1].
Transient aching in left eyeball (fifth day), [36].
Cutting in the rectum in the afternoon, drawing towards the lower part of abdomen, followed by unsuccessful bearing down and pressing to stool, [1].
Dreadful gnawing frontal pains, [66].
No appetite, but thirst, [1].
Paleness of the face, [1].
Strong, somewhat painful, erections, after the morning sleep, while sitting, [5].
Inflammation of the eyes, with redness of the whites; stitching and pressure therein, [1].
Anxious oppression in upper part of chest, [8].
Tearing around the knees and malleoli, only when sitting and lying, [1].
Burning and easy fatigue of the eyes when reading, [1].
Distressing itching in the nose, which is still stuffed (eighteenth day), [34a].
Pressing headache in the hot forehead, in the evening from 7 to 8 o'clock (after fourth and fifth days), [1].
Very sleepy at 9 A.M. (sixteenth day); 8 P.M., sleepy, with chilly sensations in the back (twentieth day); great drowsiness, at 9 A.M. (twenty-third day), [20].
Slight burning in the upper lip (forty-fifth day), [45a].
Heaviness in the abdomen, [1].
Ringing in ears (sixteenth day), [34a].
Vertigo, as if from intoxication (soon, second day), [22c].
Sticking pain in the ear as far as the pharynx, [1].

Some yellowish leucorrhœal discharge, with the bearing down in pelvic organs, in the morning; slightly, bloody and increased in quantity, at 10 A.M.; more profuse, yellowish, creamy, or slightly bloody, at 9 P.M. (ninth day); (none in the morning); slightly yellow and somewhat bloody, offensive slightly, in the evening (tenth day); glairy, amber-colored, slightly offensive, occasionally bloody (eleventh day); sanguineous, in gushes, but not profuse (thirteenth day), [44a].
Smarting throughout the urethra, [3].
Flickering before the eyes when looking into light; he sees a zigzag circle of colors, [1].
Painful distension of the abdomen, while riding in a carriage, [1].
Bleeding of the gums, almost without cause, [1].
During the later days, the stool became hard, knotty, and insufficient, [1].
A wart seems to be forming on the outer side of the hand, [1].
*Great dulness and confusion, [1].
Acidity in the mouth, and acid eructations after drinking milk, [1].
Obstruction of the nose and difficult breathing (after eleven days), [1].
Dimness of the vision when writing, so that he could scarcely distinguish anything clearly, [1].
The urine deposits blood in the vessel, [1].
Bad sweetish taste in the mouth, [1].
Excessive hunger and appetite, [2].
Sweat every morning, in bed, after awaking, mostly on the lower limbs, [1].
Cutting in the abdomen, at night, with urging to urinate, [1].
Severe itching on the head, when the headache passed off, [1].
Pressive pain all over the head, especially on the occiput, aggravated by external pressure (fifth day), [22b].
Contraction of the chest, in the morning on awaking, [1].
About 4 P.M., after a glass of beer, pressive pain on the left eye (nineteenth day), [22a].
Rush of blood to the head, even during a soft stool, and after riding in a wagon, [1].
Pressing and stitching otalgia in both ears, [2].
Grumbling and motion of flatus in the abdomen, as in diarrhœa, [1].
Roaring in the ears, [1]; (in two hours), [25].
In the morning, itching in left eye, which is not only aggravated by rubbing, but extends all over the face (fifth day), [20].
Menses came on a week too soon, scanty, and lasting only one day, [8].
Purring in the lower limbs, arms, and hands, [1].
Herpetic blotches around the mouth, [1].
No appetite for breakfast (eighty-eighth day), [45a].
Bruised pain in the right malar bone, even at night, [3].
Eyelids heavy, in the evening, [1].
Remains wakeful late in the evening, [1].
Cough, mostly in the evening, in bed, with vomiting, [1].
Trembling of the thigh and knee, without chilliness, with jerking in the muscles of the thigh, [1].
A kind of stupid weakness in the head while walking in the open air, with gloomy disagreeable, ideas for several minutes; at one time more, at another less, [1].
In the morning, after getting up, aching and heavy feeling in the occiput, extending into the nape; headache went off in the course of the day (forty-seventh day), [45b].
Drawing in the right upper jaw and in the left thumb (fourth day), [44e].
Cramp in the forearm, when walking, [1].
Distortion of the left pupil, [1].
